Summary: Small older resort with plenty of amenities. The laundry room is open from 8-10 and costs $1.50 per load to wash and dry - bring quarters. As Wyndham owners, we had a great experience. We received a bottle of wine and snacks when we wanted. Valet is great! They were quick and helpful, never had to wait for our car. Overall ALL staff was awesome. We rented a 1 bdrm - two beds and sofa bed. To our surprise, there was also a murphy bed so plenty of room for our party of 6. Resort is a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.
Room tip: Keep your key card or band on you at all times. Everything is access controlled. If you forgot...
Manager Response: none

Summary: So usually I would probably give this place 4 stars, since it's a Wyndham affiliated timeshare without stuff you would expect from some of the other Wyndhams, but people that work here are very nice and just overall pleasant. Plus, we were here 2 separate times within 2 months, for about 14 days total.  The valets are really good, considering it gets pretty busy in the evenings. They are so nice, I thought all valets in Cali were like them, but they are  just unique to Peacock Suites. I imagine its pretty crazy during tourist season.   I am also super grateful to David, he checked me in and out second time we were there. He was able to figure out how to keep us in same room. It was even better to know that he was an Army Reservist. I am a Vet so it's always good  to see military
Room tip: You have to pay for valet parking, but those guys deserve it.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear of your positive interaction with our team, and enjoyed your visit. We'll ensure they receive well-earned kudos! Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back again, soon.

Summary: Make sure you ask if you can get the room cleaned, they gave me bedding and stuff for the room to do myself, I was able to get a vacuum from a staff member, and the resort stated after 3 day stay your rom would get service. they used covid as an excuse its 2023 and there cleaners did not use masks or gloves while cleaning rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are terribly sorry to hear of your concern - experiences such as this are unacceptable and the cleanliness of our suites and our entire resort is one of our top priorities. Can you please call our Owner Care team at 1-877-743-5510 so we can learn more about your vacation? We look forward to connecting.

Summary: Great location and people to stay with.  The parks being within easy walking distance.  The Anaheim Garden Walk has plenty of eating establishment. One can use the Disneyland bus system to ride from the park to Toy Story parking then a short walk back to the room.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary: We had such a busy week and having attentive hotel staff in the lobby as well as the valet staff was great!  Rooms were clean, view of Disney fireworks was a plus to see from our room.  Special thank you to all who work there.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for sharing your review and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: Peacock Suites was a perfect location next to Disneyland. And they had a shuttle to get to the parks as well, but you could almost walk there. Also the hot tub was open until 11pm which was very nice!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary Heading: Ideal set up to meet up with another family. Great location, comfortable beds!
Summary: We are shell owners, and this was our fourth stay at Peacock Suites. It is a great place to stay if you were meeting up with another family, as they have  a game room and pool area with spaces where the adults can hangout while keeping an eye on the kids. We have had so much fun sharing a drink with friends in the common areas by the game room/pool, while our kids had a blast, playing air hockey, etc.  We went as a couple this time and also really enjoyed our stay. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the TV had a port where we were able to stream from our home account. We saved money by using the microwave for simple breakfast. There were plenty of dishes and utensils. Staff was extremely friendly, particularly the concierge, front desk, and valets.   You can buy
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your insight regarding resort location and amenities -- we appreciate your review and we hope to welcome you back again, soon!

Summary: Excellent location. Walking distance to movie theater, several restaurants and eateries. Just a few blocks from Disney parking and also walking distance to Disney attractions if you are a walker. Laundry room on site was so convenient for our 7 day stay.  No daily housekeeping unless you wanted to pay $25 fee.  You can ask for clean towels and bedding. The microwave was pretty good however, some of the controls didn't work.  The mini fridge kept our leftover and store bought food cold.  Beds were comfortable as well as the sofa bed.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We will ensure your concerns regarding the visit are passed along to resort management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Super Service, Wonderful Location!
Summary: I can't say enough good about Peacock Suites - especially the manager and desk staff! They resolved a stressful situation where our we had booked through Airbnb and we did not get what we paid for. We had booked a suite with 2 bedrooms and 7 beds for 12 people for 5 nights. I paid all money up front. When trying to check in, I was told that we only had one room with 2 beds for 3 nights. It took AN HOUR to get this straightened out with calls and texts to our Airbnb host where she had to work with the hotel to correct the problem. The clerk was finally able to give us two rooms, 5 doors apart (adjoining would have been nice) that had 6 beds - enough for our family of 12. The manager even handed me a bottle of Martinelli's to thank us for our patience. Wow! It wasn't even their
Room tip: Make sure your reservation is EXACTLY what you asked and paid for, especially if going through...
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary: Beautiful property located near Disneyland with an incredible staff. From the concierge to the manager every person was pleasant, professional and went out of their way to make sure that my stay was is the best ever… And it was! I will be back…
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear of your positive interaction with our team, and enjoyed your visit. We'll ensure they receive well-earned kudos! Thank you for your review and we hope to welcome you back again, soon.

Summary Heading: Great Visit, Close to Disney and Food
Summary: Clean, updated room designed to sleep 6 but it would be a bit tight with that many people.  Roof access was nice for afternoon sunshine.  Property felt secure and well maintained.  Didn't love the valet requirement for car + fees.  Close to several restaurants and walking distance to Disney. Although there is a ART bus stop right outside.  Pool and 2 hot tubs were nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We will ensure your concerns regarding the visit are passed along to resort management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary: Even though the hotel says they should clean the rooms they excused themselves and do not clean the units so you have to clean them yourself!!! Rooms are very cold and noisy in the mornings. I would not like to stay there again. Rooms are too small with only 1 bathroom for 4 persons.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We found this hotel to be very good, especially given the value through the Armed Forces Vacation Club.  Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the staff. They offered us a cold drink and provided a map so we would know all the places close by to eat and shop etc. The concierge was great in ensuring we had our park tickets, and transportation figured out etc. We were aware there was a time share presentation offered but this was not pressured on us at all.  There is a different company who provides very unnecessary valet parking (the parking lot is LITERALLY under and beside the hotel). At one point we had a valet bring us out a car that was not ours, we had to tell him that was not our car. Kinda scary to think some people who rent cars may not have noticed it was not the same
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location to Disneyland was great. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was adequate, although felt slightly dirty. The worst part was the hotel backs up to a uniform services company that made deliveries starting around 4-5 in the morning. It was quite loud and would keep us up.
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear of your experience with noisy neighbors! We try to ensure all of our guests have a good time and we see there is still room for improvement. Your feedback will be shared with resort management so we can continue to improve your vacation experience.

Summary: We like this place because it is conveniently located to Disneyland. The place is clean and well maintained. The parking fee is a little high. The admitting clerk is pleasant but she won’t accommodate what is requested. We asked not to assigned us to a unit across the Laundry building because it is noisy starting at 5am. Send us there without saying anything when we came back she told us no other room available. Fortunately we met Jennifer Stasi who made arrangements for us to be assigned to another room. She is an Angel in disguise which made our vacation more enjoyable.
Manager Response: Thanks you for your review. We're sorry you encountered issues during your visit, and we're happy to hear it was resolved by our resort staff! Kudos to the resort team for making things right. We hope to welcome you back again, during your next visit to the area.

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at the Peacock Suites Anaheim and would stay again - it is ideally located very closed to Disney (walking distance) as well as Anaheim Garden Walk nearby. The rooms are very spacious with excellent storage and well kept, clean and tidy. Check in was super easy thanks to Lily who was patient and explained everything about the hotel to us. All hotel staff were super helpful, especially with the offer of free daily drinks, etc. Clean and tidy with easy parking (Valet at $15 per day, charged at check in). Didn't have chance to use the pool but lovely rooftop with plenty of loungers, BBQ grills and also views of the Disney fireworks! All in all, a good stay with plenty of perks.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your fantastic review! We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us, and we hope to see you on the next one!

Summary: My family and I recently stayed at Peacock Suites in Anaheim. This trip was booked in December 2021 for a three bedroom. My husband and I received corresponded from the resort prior to our stay so they were aware of our upcoming trip. We arrived at the suites around 11:30am and didn't expect the room to be ready but they did check us in. We were told that we would receive a room on the second floor, which I had previously requested a higher floor due to families with children that constantly run over your head, but we were okay with the second floor. At 4pm we came back to see if the room was ready. Sam, manager told us about the room on the first floor was ready, we reiterated that we were told we would be placed on the second floor. He snapped that we were rushing them (staff)
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are terribly sorry to hear of your concern - experiences such as this are unacceptable. We want all of our guests to feel comfortable during their stay, and we are disappointed to hear this was not the case. We’d like to discuss this with you further. Please give us a call at 1-800-251-8736. We look forward to connecting.

Summary: This hotel may have the friendliest staff and customer service, I have experienced. The one bedroom is small, but comfortable.  The ART transit system worked wonderful with getting around town and to the Disney parks. Absolutely loved the bed, and the quaint recreation area. Will definitely be staying here again.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you enjoyed your visit! Thank you for sharing your review and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: This was a nice place to stay for Disney.  It's a 15 minute walk, or you can take a community bus that picks up directly in front of the hotel.    Rooms were clean and comfortable.  We stayed in a family suite.  My only negative comment on the rooms were that the master bedroom didn't have enough room for our luggage - it was quite tight.  Otherwise...super clean and cozy.  Beds were fluffy and we slept great.  We appreciated the on site laundry.  That really helped us out.  This facility works as a timeshare, but they also rent rooms.  We weren't interested in buying, and appreciated that they didn't push us to participate in a presentation or to lock in as owners.    The pool area was small.  Just enough to take a quick dip. That being said, there were TWO community hot tubs.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We will ensure your concerns regarding the visit are passed along to resort management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary: I was expecting a small resort similar to my Wyndham timeshare since i had traded my points for RCI and got this.  This was NOT on par with a time-share!   The refrigerator in the room was the size of your typical room fridge in a nice hotel.  Kitchen utensils were basic and of course there was no dishwasher.  There was not a market place or any kind of snack shop on the property.  Parking was by valet only.  The pool was tiny and was on the ground floor UNDERNEATH of the rest of the hotel so don't expect to lay out and get a suntan.  It was clean and adequate for my husband and i, but there was no daily housekeeping service.  I prefer to stay at my Wyndham timeshare if possible, but if not, I'd rather stay in Hilton or Hyatt than this "resort"
Manager Response: We’re sorry to learn about your experience at our resort. While we strive to create the perfect vacation for all of our guests, unfortunately sometimes we do fall short. But when we do, we try to make it right. Can you please call our Shell Vacations Club Owner Care team at 1-877-743-5510 so we can learn more about your vacation? Thank you.

Summary: This resort was absolutely amazing.   My family thoroughly enjoyed the rooftop hang out, as we were able to spend time up there with old friends.   The room was large enough for our family of 4, and was extremely clean.   The entire staff was on top of their game as being incredibly friendly and helpful.  So much so, that each morning I would wish the time share sales people good luck for their day.   There's lots of places to hang out and spend time with your family on days that you may not be going to the theme parks, and this is just fine with us.  Oh!  and the location is perfect.  It's extremely close to a place called Anaheim Gardens, or Gardens of Anaheim that features tons of great restaurants, and even a House of Blues.   This is definitely in the rotation for whenever
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us! We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay with family
Summary: Rooms are nice and roomy. Kitchen is nice   Front desk service was friendly.  Location is about a 20 min walk to Disneyland.  Close to Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gumps and PF Chang.   There is a 711 on the corner to pickup some drinks, milk and fruit. Clean and worth the stay
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: DO NOT PARK!!!!!!!!!! Not even for check in! They will charge you!!!!!!!
Summary: We had a friend pick us up from LAX and drop us off at the hotel. The Valet guys do NOT like you to park. Not even just to check in. We had our friend park and they immediately were all over us asking what our name was to make sure we were checking in. After dealing with the Valet guys you can finally go into the hotel to check in. Check in process was nice and normal but then they hand you over to the "2nd" part of their check in process where a guy tries to get you to do a time share presentation. I let them know I was not interested in a time share presentation and they brought out a map to show us the area around the hotel. I just asked if I could head up to my room. Finally,  we were able to get our luggage out of our friends car and bring it up to our room. My friend told
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We want all of our guests to feel comfortable during their stay, and we are disappointed to hear this was not the case. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will make sure to pass it on to resort management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a reasonable price.
Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites from April 13-16, 2022. Our room was clean and the mini-kitchen was stocked well. Plenty of utensils and dishes, wine glasses, etc. Having the dining table was convenient. We picked up a few groceries so we could do our own breakfast and pack snacks for our days at Disney.   Our suite had a separate room with two Queen beds and a sofa bed. It was plenty of room for our family and we all had a comfortable sleep. There wasn't a lot of noise. The bathroom was separated into the tub/toilet area and then the vanity area outside. The vanity was right when you walked into the suite, which got a bit crowded. Everyone's shoes were underneath the sink and it turned into the catch-all station. Just a minor beef.   It is a reasonable 15-20 minute walk to the
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review, Erin! We're glad you loved the unit and our resort location. We'll share your concerns about the sales experience and parking with management so we can continue to improve your guest experience. We hope to welcome you back again, soon!

Summary: The rooms are nice enough and well stocked for a nice stay. The 1 bedrooms provide a nice divider to allow adults to sit on the sofa or at the table after kids have gone to bed.   HOWEVER, they will torment you with timeshare pitches. If you rebuff them, they'll try again. Do not fall for it. The 60-90 minutes becomes 3 hours of torture if you fall for it, and they pass you from one person to the next as you say no to offer another option. They don't give you the promised offer/gifts until you've rebuffed them repeatedly. It's the worst sort of deceptive marketing. I'd rather get stuck on a call about my car's extended warranty. Avoid at all costs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're happy to hear that you enjoyed your overall visit, and your feedback surrounding the sales presentation will be shared with resort management. It is our goal to provide timeshare information in a comfortable and enjoyable environment, and we see that wasn't the case for you. For that, please accept our apology.

Summary: This place is exactly the same as when we first saw it in 2002 except it’s rundown and the hotel has done zero to upgrade their accommodations. The furniture is worn and raggedy looking. When the arms of sofas are bare of fabric, it’s time to change out the sofa.  Worst of the worst…. After checking in, I had to tell the timeshare sellers that I’m not interested and yet they kept pushing. One guy told me the presentation at 8am was for 60 minutes. The second guy who tried to push harder said “it’s not 60mins long” after his rep just said it’s an hour. These guys are so pushy and they need to understand “no.”  Beds are uncomfortable. No daily cleanings because of covid but you get charged for cleaning the room after you check out.  $15 valet parking per day is only way to park
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Charles. We're terribly sorry for your less than satisfactory check-in experience and the furniture conditions you describe are concerning. In regards to your sales experience, it is our goal to provide timeshare information in a comfortable and enjoyable environment -- and we see that wasn't the case for you. Can you please give us a call at 1-877-743-5510 so we can learn more? It is our goal to resolve this matter to your satisfaction and encourage you to update your review afterwards.

Summary: Great location, very close to Disneyland. We had 2 one-bedroom suites. Between the 2 rooms, 9 people were able to sleep comfortably. The bedrooms had 2 double beds and the living room had pull out sofas. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly. The bathroom and sink is right at the the front door of the room so thats kinda strange. Our room had a mini fridge, and microwave. The only negative thing is the noise at night. You can here all the street traffic and people playing in the pool. We were on the first floor and our room faced the front. Try to get a room away from the traffic.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review, Kourtney! We're glad you enjoyed the unit. We'll share your concerns about the noise with resort management, so we can continue to improve the guest experience.

Summary: I had a very concerning experience at check in. After checking in they sent me to their “concierge”, he asked me for personal information and then started asking if I was traveling with my husband. It was very unnerving.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear of your experience, Erin. If you feel your experience with the sales representative was concerning, please give us a call so we can learn more - 1-800-251-8736.

Summary: Stayed here while visiting Disneyland and we had a enjoyable stay. Hotel has pretty clean accommodations, friendly staff, all the amenities we needed and is close to Disney. Wish you didn’t have to valet car but would still stay here again.
Manager Response: We're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks for the great review! We hope to welcome you back, soon.

Summary: I can't say what Peacock was like a couple of years ago but we stayed there January 18 and 19 2022.   It was great.    The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Slightly awkward was that the front room of the two room suite was where the beds were and the back room was the sitting area.    The kids used the pool and it looked clean.  I mean, they're not itching or anything.  All the common areas were well maintained.   Location was great if you are willing to do minimal walking.  After check in, we returned our rental at Budget and walked 15 minutes to the hotel.   Disney is probably a 25 minute walk to the park.   You will pass CVS type stores for quick supplies coming/going to the parks.   About 12 minutes walk is Ono Hawaiian and Habit Burger so if you don't mind
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay with us. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your visit, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Did not appreciate having to valet park only with unexpected cost for that. One bedroom unit nothing but a hotel room you would get at Embassy Suites. Significantly small mini kitchen with no washer/dryer.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will make sure to pass it on to Resort Management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary: - Poor Wi-Fi connection - Noisy outside - Parking requires Valet @ $13+tax - Pool & Spa outside, under a bldg, whether freezing cold or shine - Fitness Ctr is small. Good for 2-3 ppl during CoVid - There’s no such thing as Tour. Another presentation. It’ll take over an hour in-spite of 60 min advertised. Run like you need to go to the bathroom. - Watch for a gal named Daniela. She likes to talk from her beehind. She blubber a lot. She can’t give you a straight answer when ask. She has an issue. - There is a FEE to attend this “Tour” - Room is small and crowded w/ furnishing - One bed is almost against the window - It’s clean - Our room came w/ a sofa bed. Good up to 6 ppl like in a can of sardines - 7-11 less than a block away though
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We want all of our guests to feel comfortable during their stay, and we are disappointed to hear this was not the case. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will make sure to pass it on to Resort Management so that we may continue to improve in the future.

Summary: Peacock resort is a good location for Disneyland-- with a convenient shuttle service.  Clean, friendly, safe.  Fourth floor sun deck has gas grill and tables.  Pool and hot tub felt good after a day out.  Convenient stop on shuttle service to Disney-- so you don't have to hassle with parking there.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your kind review of the resort. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The location is great.  Near Disneyland and eating places.  The staff was friendly and professional.  Check-in was easy, the parking attendants were quick getting the the cars.  We would stay at the  Peacock Suites again if in the area.  I would recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are so happy to hear you had a great stay with us at the resort. We love when our guests have a great time on vacation, and we hope to see you on the next one.

Summary Heading: New staff changes - it’s ok - not awesome as before
Summary: I feel some staff are trying but a lot rules and policies for Covid-  really restricts enjoying when no housekeeping every 3 days.  Carpets serious concerns and need a deep cleaning and some mishap of events. I feel trying but just not same quality I expect. I don’t know if cooperate push however I feel missing kid activities fun events around property and gaming parts  need fixing. They did have hand sanitizer and wipes at elevators when needed.  Missing greetings coffee and water in lobby.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you so much for sharing your review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We walked to Disney everyday, but is quite a walk if you have smaller children. The Garden Walk is about a 10 min walk and offered a good selection of restaurants. We would stay here again as a couple.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your kind review of Peacock Suites. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Peacock Suites Staff was amazing especially Anais. Clean, Kind and down the street to Disneyland, You could walk there and to the Garden Walk. Parking was simple with the help of staff. Cute gift store on top floor. 2 bedroom suite is amazing. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Our team works diligently to make your stay wonderful, so we love to hear from guests such as yourself. Thank you so much for leaving your review, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Peacock Suites for over a week while visiting Disneyland.  We typically stay at the Worldmark condos, but there was no availability so we opted for this location.  If you are used to a condo with a full kitchen and in-room laundry unit, this is NOT the same, however this place is nicer than most hotel rooms. We had 2 adults an one child and our room had 2 double or queen beds and a murphy bed, which was nice, with a small couch and 2 tvs.  There was a sliding privacy door between the 2 beds and the main living area.  The beds were very comfortable. There was construction happening during the latter part of our stay, but this was well advertised by the resort and we were aware of it before our stay.  The noise was not too bad for us, overall.  Check in
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Great no issues nice location near what you need  Down the blocks from Disneyland from our room window you can see the fireworks from Disney  Easy to get around the location of the resort was good  Everyone who worked there greeted you as u come and go
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your time with us at the resort. Our team works diligently to make your stay wonderful, so we love to hear from guests such as yourself. Thank you so much for leaving your review, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Nice location, friendly staff, and clean resort. Check in was easy. No issues with the room during our stay. When requested, more toiletries were provided. Staff were incredibly nice. Quick check out!
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay with us at the resort. Our team works diligently to make your stay wonderful, so we love to hear from guests such as yourself. Thank you so much for leaving your review, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Be careful, if you have people above you, you can hear all the footsteps.  We unfortunately seemed to be placed underneath people who appeared to be playing basketball at all times of the day and night.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of your stay. We are sorry to hear you experienced some noise during your stay. We hope your stay was otherwise enjoyable, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Convenient, great staff, nice place to visit, close to Disney, cwalking distance to great restaurants, easy highway access. The packing District is very nice, and we found a gem in the little Flame Broiler restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your kind review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay. The room was very comfortable and clean. Resort in a great location. Especially if you’re headed to Disney land. Lots of places to eat within walking distance or a short drive away. And 30 minutes from great beaches.
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving your kind review of Peacock Suites. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. Our team works diligently to make your stay great, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: What a Scam!   This place is an old apartment building, poorly turned into a hotel. My family stayed here during our Disneyland vacation.   Sales pitch during check-in, really? I'm staying here on RCI points and your trying to sell me the same points, really?  Rude staff, run down rooms, 10 a.m. check-out, paper thin walls, dirty, pics on-line were zoomed in, small unit, smells, etc.   I'd rather pitch a tent than stay here again! Selling my points and buying direct with Disney!  Traveler beware, you've been warned
Manager Response: We're disappointed to hear that Peacock Suites did not meet your expectations. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, and will make sure to pass along your feedback to Resort Management so we can improve moving forward.

Summary: Great location-walking distance to great restaurants. The hotel staff is friendly and responsive to needs of the guests. We enjoyed the pool and the relaxation area on the top view deck. Our room was clean and fit our needs for our stay. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was small and not very close to park. About a 15 min walk or you had to pay for shuttle.  Also had to pay for parking at the hotel. Pool was like a big bathtub. But the service was good. I expected higher quality for what we pay for RCI and Welk. I had to also book a tiny room for our next trip to Hawaii,  cause that's all they had available this year. Not very pleased with Welk/RCI this year. They advertise high quality,  but don't deliver.
Manager Response: none

Summary: They changed the check out time to 10am even though it says 11am on my reservation. I was charged $25 per hour.  The carpets need cleaning.  The new security into and out of elevators can be troublesome when your kids walk they must always have a key, the lobby is closed after 11 now (use to be 24/7) so you can get locked out and will be a huge hassle.  If you get extra keys they cancel out all other keys - there for you can get stuck not getting a card that works.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for Disney, Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks, and Hollywood. The resort offers tours to see Walk of Fame Stars. The tour guide was awesome, he showed us the celebrities mansions, and other significant sites, plus the beaches.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall good stay. Courteous staff and very accommodating.  Great location. Easy walk or drive to great restaurants and interstate entry. My room did not have a view. It overlooked a parking lot and a warehouse. Unfortunately, trucks arrived daily between 6-7am. Extremely loud. Windows need to be sound proof.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Shell Vacations Club Peacock Suites Resort
Summary: Above average overall.  Great location next to Disney. There is no kitchen.  But there is a microwave though. Parking fee is mandatory and valet serviced. Walking distance to Seven Eleven is a great plus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a 2-bedrooms unit at PEACOCK HOTEL & RESORT, in APRIL 2021. Good location.   Close to DISNEY LAND, ANAHEIM. Rooms are quite small.  NO kitchen. NO complimentary breakfast. MANDATORY VALET PARKING which costs about $15 a day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The resort is centrally located, which is great, but here are a couple things about this resort that you should consider before booking...  1.) The kitchenette: there is no stove so if you plan on staying for a few days and want to cook, you cant. There is only a sink, microwave and mini refrigerator available.  2.) Parking: there is mandatory $14 a day valet parking. This is very inconvenient for families that have many activities planned throughout the day. It's a hassle and honestly, paying a fee to become a member is already enough... but to also pay a parking fee? REALLY?   3.) The rooms are small. The couch is tiny and uncomfortable. There are no extra linens in the room. There are no brooms/dustpans or vacuum for cleaning up if you're traveling with kids. You have to

We felt bad that our pet was stuck in a car for a week, as we followed their obviously flimsy policy.  2.  Required valet parking is a money pit.  Because we were moving we had multiple vehicles.  Very expensive.  No accomodation w exceptional circumstances.  In addition, we arrived @ 4 am.  We had an oversized trailer.  Although there was adequate room in front to park and we said we would move it as soon as uhaul opened, they would not

Summary: Woke up to a huge cockroach on the floor as you can see in the picture I added. If there is one that means there is more. Gross. What if it gets in your luggage? Summary Heading: I own it Peacock suites and love it
Summary: I love the place, it has very nice amenities and it is extremely close to Disneyland with shuttles. As an owner I can get rentals very inexpensively anytime I want as long as there is space available. It is very well With lots of palm trees and tropical plants and very clean.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disney, clean rooms.
Summary: Wasn't prepared for the pressure of signing up to a presentation for a timeshare.  Extreme pressure but still able to walk away.  Location was great and room had dishes, larger fridge, sink etc to prepare food for the kids.  Though they didn't clean the room until the 3rd day, they provided towels each day so it was an easy adjustments.  Area was quiet and seemed safe, even walking back at 1am from Disneyland.  I would stay again for these reasons.

Summary Heading: It Not Your Typical Hotel, Read Before Booking
Summary: Rooms are small and a bit tight but appear updated. Location is a reasonable distance to Disneyland and is walkable or an easy Uber ride. Staff are friendly. It’s a Shell Vacation Club / Wyndham property so it’s important you know:    1.  They will try to get you to sign-up for a presentation right after they hand you the keys. Not a typical experience if your looking for just a room.   2. Because it’s a vacation club and not a hotel, tidy service doesn’t happen till day 3. They didn’t tell us that when we checked in for 2 nights.  We had 5 people in a room for 6. You need housekeeping service in that situation.   3. It has a pool and spa. Both are smaller than you are probably mentally picturing. They’re nice, just be prepared.   There is also a rooftop recreation area.   4.
Manager Response: none

Summary: In making my reservation thru Cancelon (a third party vendor) I did not see anywhere in the information that this hotel was a timeshare and as such they would be trying to get me to sit down for a presentation upon check-in.  Thankfully, they weren't pushy and we didn't attend the presentation.  The bathtub was completely clogged the first morning and water filled the tub as I showered.  Spoke to the front desk and they did fix it right away.  They only do housekeeping every three days unless you ask for more.  Don't have a problem with them not making my bed for 3 days, however, shampoos need to be restocked, coffee needed restocking. Summary: Cute location just a walk away from the Disney Parks and Downtown Disney. You cannot beat the convenience! The staff was very helpful, and there were plenty of dining choices at the mall between you and Disney. We never touched the car the whole time we were there!

The 3 bedroom condo was much smaller than I expected the bedrooms were fine but the living area, if you could call it that consisted of a 2 seat sofa and a small round table with 4 chairs. Summary Heading: A quality resort but watch your parking tab.
Summary: This is perfect if you're going to Disneyland or any of the other local attractions.  There is an inexpensive shuttle that takes you around town.   There are other lesser known attractions in the area to drive to.   I recommend the Lyon Air Museum, Los Alamitos house and gardens, and Old  Towne Orange.  Going any distance in the car means you will spend a lot of time in slow traffic.  That is a fact of life in Los Angeles, no matter what time of day or night.  The unit itself was very comfortable.   We appreciated the quiet location of our unit.  There are many children staying here and it was nice to be away from any potential disturbance.   Be careful about your parking tab.   The valets got a little confused early in the week.  We thought nothing of it until they tried to add

Summary: We stayed in a 1-bedroom suite at the Peacock Suites in Anaheim, CA. Overall it was a pleasant experience. Our main concerns were that you had to pay $13/day plus tax for valet service - not optional, and the 1-bedroom suite closely resembled a studio suite. The bedroom area was closed off from the rest of the suite via a sliding glass-panel door (obaque glass) and had 2 queen-size beds, but the kitchen area was what you would expect in a studio. There was no stove/oven to cook meals with, no built-in dishwasher, no cutlery other than silverware, a small fridge, and only a microwave to make meals with. The dining area was also small and cramped between the living room area (again very small) and the bathroom wall. The bathroom sink area was outside of the bathroom and was next
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at Peacock suites with 2 kids the Christmas week of 2019 in a one bedroom. The unit was much smaller than what I’m used to but it was clean. The unit has a mini kitchen, no stove and no dishwasher. However, the location is very good. There’s a Starbucks across the street. couple gas stations and food marts within walking distance. Disneyland is within walking distance or you can talk the shuttle bus. There’s fresh brewed coffee in the lobby every morning and staff were very friendly. We enjoyed our stay.

Summary: Stayed here the first week of December as part of an RCI exchange. The three bedroom units are small, in my opinion, and configured weird, although updated, so still nice. They offer an open-air multi purpose family room that is good for families (TVs, games, air hockey, etc). The sun deck is updated and nice as well. The entire staff is welcoming and friendly. We experienced miscommunication with the front desk even before we arrived, which was off-putting. Our biggest feedback is that the hotel needs their own Disney shuttle. The ART shuttle pick ups are too unreliable. We did, however, use ART to head back to the hotel after a long day of Disney and it was just okay, lots of waiting and masses of people. Laundry facilities are good. Beds are comfy, showers are awesomely

Summary Heading: New Year's Eve at Peacock Suites
Summary: We enjoyed our stay.  Downtown Disney is about a 20 minute walk.  Instead of facing the calamity and long lines at Disneyland on New Year's Eve, we went to Downtown Disney.  There were plenty of people and live bands at both The Garden Walk and Downtown Disney.  Lots of fun!  Room is not huge - just a like a standard hotel room (beds are a little soft for me).  For a time share, we expected more.  My bed was by the window and it was a little drafty - ask for extra blankets.  No restaurant or bar here, but it's clean and quiet.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, resort itself is above board, surrounding area just ok

Summary: The room was great. The hotel was a little to far from the park but still with in walking distance. The walk was about 20-25 mins or so. The room was comfy and the amenities were nice. Restaurants down the street and a Starbucks about 5 min walk which was nice.

Bed was super comfortable, everything worked and the whole place was spotlessly clean. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the welcome goodie bag was a nice touch. The room clean after 3 nights was no big deal as there were plenty of towels.  Disney shuttle ran every 20 mins and cost $6 per day, but we used Uber/Lyft that cost around $6-$7 on average. The welcome we had when we arrived was just what was needed after a long drive. (We were even given a welcome pack with drinks and water.) When I used the laundry room it closed at 10:00. Summary Heading: Convenient for Convention Centre and Disney

We appreciate your feedback regarding the noise level and nightly parking fees, and will make sure to pass along your comments to Resort Management to look into further.

Summary: We booked this last minute--day before check-in--We booked via a timeshare exchange, packed and took off for a 16 hour overnight drive with 4 of our kids. Upon arrival we were exhausted and the resort was extremely accommodating. Our room wasn't ready--we arrived in the AM, but they worked hard to get us in as soon as they could. The room was smaller than we are used to, but it was fully functional and clean. The small kitchen area allowed for sandwiches and microwave meals..doable for a couple days. Our kids enjoyed the pool and game area. It was a quick drive/walk to Disney and a great grocery store. Highly recommended for distance to Disney and cleanliness.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The resort staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When we first checked in we were assigned a first floor room at the back which was quite noisy in the mornings, as there was nothing else available. At the suggestion of the staff we were moved to a quieter location as soon as there was one available, and they even offered to make the whole move for us.  The location was within walking distance of Disneyland, and numerous restaurants. We would have preferred a more functional kitchen, but made do with what there was. The rooftop sun and BBQ area was lovely, and you could see the nightly Disney fireworks from there. We attended the Wyndham presentation, although we have had some very unpleasant experiences doing so in the past. This time, I am happy to say that the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got a two bedroom suite and it was perfect for our family of four. It has two queens in one room and a king in the other plus a sofa bed. We also had two bathrooms. The hotel had a small pool, but worked for our young kids. There was also a pool table, air hockey and other games that kept them busy at night. We took an Uber each day to Disneyland, which cost about $5 each way. The front desk also has free coffee all day and board games you can rent for free!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This condo style, timeshare property is very conveniently located off of Anaheim Blvd, in close proximity to Disneyland. You don’t have to listen to their presentation, just say ‘no thanks.’ It was only a five minute drive to the Harbor Boulevard guest drop off area. Lots of restaurants nearby for breakfast lunch or dinner. The room itself was great! Very clean! Nice separate seating area with TV. There isn’t a stove, but there is a refrigerator, microwave, and sink. And, plates, utensils, glasses, etc. It is a little difficult to find if checking in late in the evening. Daily Valet parking is mandatory due to the property’s limited space ($11+tax). The Valet attendants are very quick, amazingly attentive and just professional! We checked in late, so got the last available unit

Summary: Very Friendly and accommodating staff.  Very close to Disney and tons of dining places.  The rooms were spacious with double beds in the one bed room and a pull out sofa bed.  Many restaurants are within walking distance.  Very convenient and close to highways.

Summary Heading: GREAT PLACE TO STAY WHEN YOU ARE DOING DISNEYLAND!
Summary: This was a perfect place to stay for our whole family for a week while we were doing Disneyland! The staff was wonderful. We had two units and they worked out very well for our family of 11!  The staff helped to make our needs met and we were able to have our units right next to each other. One day we even walked to Disneyland as it was a nice day and very walkable. You had to walk that far in the parking lot!  The staff went over and above to make our time their exceptional. We would have enjoyed the pool if it would have been warmer weather. The pool is covered by a roof but in the open air so it was kind of cold except for serious swimmers. Our boys enjoyed the game area, also where they played air hockey and pool. We will stay their again when we do something in the LA area!

Summary: these suites were very spacious and top notch.Hotel was very clean, beds very comfortable.  Pool was nice.  Close to shopping centre and Disneyland.  Lounging area and bbq area was great with couches and tables there to relax on.

There is a shuttle you can get, but there was a charge for that. It was a daily charge, once you pay, your good for the day. I dont remember the price, bit it wasnt bad, just added to your daily cost along with the $11 bucks for parking. If your staying there for a couple days, it starts to add up. Summary: We used the Peacock Resort for our trip to Disneyland. The location is great as you have the option to walk about 15-20 minutes or to take a shuttle for a nominal day fee. There is lots of restaurants ( IHop, Denny's, PF Chang's, Bubba Gump, Cheesecake Factory, Tony Roma's....) and amenities (Starbucks, Walgreens, 7-11...) on the way so we chose to walk everyday. Even at night the area is really well lit so we had no issues. We did not use the pool or hot tub but others did and they seemed to like it. We were on the third floor in one of the renovated suites. Very nice and clean. Other than some morning construction noise the construction was not an issue. We would use this location again.

Summary: I wasn't really sure what to expect from Peacock Suites given the mixed reviews, but we had a great time.  We checked in late and stayed until our check out time (11:00am). I thought that was nice, and something I've never had before from another hotel. Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a family vacation.  The place was clean. The staff was nice. My second gripe is they check the room every third day of your stay.  We were there for four so it was trips to the front desk to refill tissues and get more washcloths for our family.  It really should be every two days on a four night stay. They handled someone stinking up the place with marijuana.  The pool is open air but covered.  Nice for bad weather but no sunshine to enjoy.  I just don’t think I would stay here again unless the price was just unbeatable.

Summary Heading: Excellent Amenities, ART for Disneyland right outside
Summary: We stayed here with a friends timeshare in March 2018. The service and amenities were excellent. We briefly got trapped by timeshare shark but a little bit of firmness we escaped. We got braved and decided to walk it since we are both fit in our 30s....blah! The walk was not fun. It was a long 20 min walk (perhaps we didn't take the shortest route) but unless I got an excellent deal, I would not stay here for a DL trip again. I would stay here for other Anaheim/LA adventures though. More frequent buses would help.  Rooms were clean, pool and lounge room were awesome.

Our room was on the small side, the fridge was wobbly, lots of little details. All I can say is the three bedroom suite we had was clean and very comfortable. My daughters enjoyed the game area that featured foos-ball, air hockey and other games to keep them entertained. It stays open till 10pm which was helpful in the "keeping them distracted" aspect. Valet parking is required but at $11 per night its a decent price for the location. Most places would charge $30. The main thing is that it was VERY cramped for our family of 4. We had a king room and the kids slept on the foldout couch but we could barely even get in and out of the room or sit at the small table it was so crowded. Other downsides: there is only one entrance to the property and only from one direction, there is no on-site dining, and the coin laundry on the 4th floor has no change machine, so we kept having to go to the front desk. There is a ticket kiosk right outside the lobby for the shuttle, and it's $5.50 per adult for the day, kids 3 and up are $2, seniors are $2. (Disney parking is $20/day with no in and out).  You can buy multi-day passes for less.  Our room had a small kitchenette with dishes and utensils, coffee maker, toaster, microwave

Summary: We love coming here, the room is so spacious and there is plenty of cooking space using the microwave and refrigerator provided. Restaurants in close proximity and a seven eleven just next door.  Only thing was at night it got noisy from the games room/pool as our room overlooked that area but other than I would stay here again!

Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this feedback Staci. We appreciate that you took the time to share your experience with us. I am happy that your family enjoyed the pools and hot and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The hotel was modern and updated, staff was very friendly throughout the stay, and rooms were clean. We stayed at the beginning of Feb. and paid $109 per night.  When you pull up there’s space to park out front while you check in/load/unload. If you’re parking your vehicle you’re required to valet park. Its obvious that they do this in order to maximize how many vehicles they can park in their parking garage/outside given that the hotel is dropped in a very small piece of land. Valet parking is $10-$11 per day and you can come and go throughout the day at that price. A couple of times I noticed that the valet would leave the kiosk and not lock the key box where all the customer's vehicle keys are stored, and they'd be gone a quite some time. This is a very big no-no in the
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review!  We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your visit.  Your feedback is very helpful in identifying areas of opportunity.  We look forward to your next visit and being of assistance.

Summary: We are looking at buying Disney annual passes again and will be returning to Disneyland several times over the next year. We have loved the Peacock in the past but are very disappointed to find they discontinued the breakfast. This is a deal breaker for us and we will have to look for a different place to stay now.   Please consider bringing it back. The rooms are too small to cook in for a family and with a family breakfast is crucial for a good Disney trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time and providing us with your feedback. We value your suggestions and feedback, as it gives us guidance on what to provide our guests during vacation.

Summary: The staff at this hotel were awesome. Always helpful and great with the kids.  Pool is nice but is under cover. As it was winter that was fine for us. Have an entertainment area was great too and a BBQ/sunroof as well.  Downsides are that the rooms are quite tight for 4 people. We had 2 adults and 2 kids.  Also the rooms are dark.  They are long and thin so nothing easy to do about that other than better lighting.  Shuttle Bus to Disneyland stops outside so that was handy but we also walked one day which took us 10-15 minutes.  Would I stay again. Don't know, probably not.  There is a Wyndham next door and their rooms are normally a better layout than these rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you, Michelle for taking the time and sharing your experience with us. We appreciate your feedback as it helps us continue to enhance the vacation experience for our guest.

Summary: This hotel is upgraded with nice and modern decor. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was unbelievably small. When the couch bed was pulled out it reached the dinette table. Absolutely no room to walk around. The pool and jacuzzi are very good. There is also a nice game room for kids. This location is not within walking distance to Disney however the tram pick up is just in front of the hotel. The biggest downside is the parking situation. You must utilize valet parking so accessing your vehicle once parked is a nuisance.  Staff were very friendly and gracious.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. Our goal is to make each part of the vacation experience satisfactory. Your feedback will allow us to continue to enhance the vacation experience at our resort.

Summary Heading: Very nice room and wonderful service
Summary: The room was large for a "studio".  There was a sliding door to separate the bedroom from the living room with a sleeper couch.  A separate TV for each room.  A lovely kitchenette. Small refrigerator, a microwave, sink & dishes. The furnishings looked new and the beds and pillows were so comfortable.  Not a far walk to most anywhere and you could catch a bus to Disneyland right outside the hotel. We did an exchange with our timeshare for this room.  We loved it!
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for your kind review of your stay at the Peacock Suites. We are so glad you enjoyed your room and found it comfortable.   Kind regards,   Katrina R.

Summary: Stayed 12/25 thru 1/1/17. Great Location off the "5". Many chain restaurants within a 8 minute walk. Nice room with MICRO n Fridge, 2 qns and 1 qn sleeper. VALET parking(required) $10.50 plus tax.approx $12 p/n. You can see the fireworks from DISNEY herein ANAHEIM. POOL, GAME ROOM, BIG TV, Coffee in Chk/lobby in area, PC available. Not to far from LAX or other A/P.
Manager Response: Hello,   Thank you for your review of the Wyndham Peacock Suites.   We are glad that you enjoyed watching the fireworks from Disney and all the amenities that the resort has to offer.   Kind regards,   Katrina R.

Summary: Peacock suites is part of our time share.  We were told that since Wyndham purchased Shell they have been renovating the resort.  We requested a one bedroom suite with kitchenette.  When entering the room the light switch is on the wall behind the door when it is opened, odd place.  We did have a small refrigerator and microwave with plates and silverware but no kitchen sink.  We asked about cleaning our dishes we were told to call guest services for clean ones.  Really how inconvenient to have to wait for them to deliver.  The furniture was also very uncomfortable to sit on.  This renovation was a bust.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such detailed feedback, it helps us identify our opportunities for improvement.

Summary: Rooms are clean, big. Ours had two twin beds plus a fold out double bed. Lounge and kitchen facilities. Very comfortable beds.  Has a pool with two spas that are lovely and warm. We used the spas after a long day walking.  The Disney shuttle is right outside the hotel. They have a Games area for kids to play table tennis etc. a great family hotel.  No breakfast but there is a seven 11 just around the corner that we bought our salads, pizza, beer, wine, bread etc.  Highly recommended!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation! We appreciate you sharing your experience. We hope you come back to visit us soon!

Summary: I wanted to try something better than your average hotel room,i got a really good price for a 2 night stay for me and my family.the description of the room seemed nice it even said there was a kitchenette but after checking in and getting to the room there there was no stove.there was microwave and a cabinet full of dishes,i guess I was assuming there would be a stove from that description.we did enjoy our stay at the peacock suites
Manager Response: Hello Demetrio r,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I am glad to hear you liked our modern styled rooms. While we don’t have full kitchens, all of our units include a mini kitchenette with a microwave, toaster, coffee maker and a mini fridge. We also have barbeque grills located on our sundeck for your enjoyment!   We look forward to hosting you and your family again!

Summary: Me and my boyfriend went to stay at the peacock hotel for vacation in November for 10 days and we just loved it!!! It was our first time ever going to this hotel and they made it very safe and comfortable for us as much as possible. It's good neighbor hotel so you don't have to go stay at a $$$ hotel.. You can see Disneylands fireworks but I would just see it at the park (can't really see it on the sun deck). Their customer service was awesome although we weren't home we could feel the Aloha there!!
Manager Response: Hello Kamalei Blue D,   We are so pleased that you found our property a comfortable, safe and friendly place. ‘That is certainly our goal! It sounds as though our location was a great fit for your vacation.   The Peacock Suites constantly strives to exceed our guests’ expectations, and looks forward to hosting you again!

Summary Heading: Nice units in Orange County handy for Disney
Summary: Warm welcome, very friendly and helpful staff. Clean well maintained rooms, garden and lovely relaxing sun deck on roof. Undercover ground floor small pool and hot tubs. Disney theme parks 30-40 min walk or shuttle bus ride away. Close to Garden Walk shops, bowling and restaurants, Bubba Gump and Cheesecake Factory nice.
Manager Response: Hello Anita W,   Thank you for taking the time to write about your experiences at the Peacock Suites!  We are certainly glad to hear your comments about our staff and will share this with the team.  Thank you for highlighting the details of the rooms, common areas, and the location of the Peacock Suites.   We truly appreciate your review and we hope to see you again for your next trip to Disney!

Summary: The location is wonderful the staff is incredibly friendly the room was a good size for 2 people  my only complaint would be the towels were sandpaper hard and stiff they need to use some sort of fabric softener to make them soft  I did have a guest stay in the living room area which had a queen size pull out bed but the way the door is placed it's in the wrong place, instead of the bedroom  there a door c between the livingroom & /bathroom so for privacy the guest has to turn on the light in the bathroom area which woke me up and I had no privacy - they need to put the door in the bedroom so when the guest needs the restroom they won't  wake you up.
Manager Response: Hello Ladyter,   Thank you for your kind review and your recommendation! We are so pleased to read your comments about the staff, and have shared this review with the team.  Your recommendation is duly noted, as we always appreciate our guests' thoughts to help us move forward.   Thank you again and we look forward to your return in the future!

Summary: Excellent hotel with exceptional service! Definitely a must stay if you don't mind taking a 20 minute walk. Besides that, the rooms were great, awesome tub, big clean rooms, and two tvs!! We also had a small kitchenette that was very helpful for us!
Manager Response: Hello Nabil S,  We were thrilled to read your observations! We appreciate your detailing the features of our rooms and our staff's "exceptional service".   Thank you again for this wonderful review, and we look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: This is really nothing more than a standard hotel room. Nothing great other than the location and friendly staff. Unfortunately their recent renovation did not include anything to reduce street noise or noise from the room above including hearing the shower and toilets flush. For the price in location it did the trick but we will be seeking better accommodations next trip.
Manager Response: Hello Jo C,  Thank you for your honest review. Although we are pleased you enjoyed the location and you found the staff to be friendly, we are concerned about your feedback about the noise level. We have addressed the concerns with our Department Managers as we constantly strive to provide 5-Star service and are sincerely concerned when we fall short of expectations. We appreciate your feedback that assists us in focusing our energies and continuing to improve product and services.

Summary: good for what we needed, a place close to Disneyland - nothing special. The toilets are so loud when they flush that they can literally wake people up at night. The room is incredibly cramped with barely enough to move. We were supposed to have a room with a kitchen area with a sink, there was no sink and we had to do the dishes in the bathroom sink.   Construction was going on all day and well into the night until 6pm every single day. Compressors, drilling, hammering, pending with sledge hammers, and the dropping of large bags of concrete on the sun deck, which was right above our room. They even cracked the ceiling, you could see the ceiling bouncing from the work.   On checkin we had to initial that our cleaning days for the week were Wednesday and Saturday. Wednesday came,
Manager Response: Hello Shark1977,   Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites, we truly appreciate it.   I would like to apologize about the noise you experienced during your last stay and have passed them onto that department so we can have it looked at immediately. While all of our units include a mini kitchenette with a microwave, toaster, coffee maker and a mini fridge, only some of the suites include a sink. The front desk is here for your service 24 hours a day 7 days a week. Please do not hesitate to call us directly and we will do our best to accommodate your requests depending on our availability.     It is our goal to create a relaxing yet exciting environment for guests, and hope you will understand the temporary construction going on at the Peacock Suites. We are happy to announce our Peacock Park will be reopened for our guests to enjoy beginning November 23rd of this year.   As reading through your comments about our housekeeping service I want to be the first to say it has been addressed and the comments have been shared with not only with myself, but the entire management team, housekeeping included.  We take our guest feedback serious and hope you will consider staying with us for your next stay in Anaheim.

Summary: Very nice, helpful staff.  Convenient shuttle to Disneyland.  Valet parking, very organized.  Really appreciated the on site gift shop.  Reasonable prices and no crowds.  Rooms clean, nice kitchenette.  Beds comfortable.
Manager Response: Hello Vixi007,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about our hotel! We appreciate your kind words and we look forward to your next stay with us!

Summary: Have stayed here at this establishment several times before as a timeshare owner. It's very clean and we'll maintained. Although I think some fans in.the bathroom would be nice to get the moisture out. A few years ago they offered a breakfast, but no longer do. Most people staying here go to Disneyland. The money saved by having a hotel that offers a breakfast is significant given the dining options in and around Disneyland. We've stayed in rooms along the main drag near Disneyland (Harbor Blvd) and most offer some sort of morning dining. Although as of now there is some construction at the hotel going on, and hopefully it's a place to dine. Overall, a solid place too stay, but continental breakfast or a quick bagel would be a nice addition.
Manager Response: Hello Roy O  Thank you for continuing to stay with us at the Peacock Suites and taking the time to let us know about your visit. Feedback these days is priceless and without it we cannot continue to grow and get better at what we do.    We recently renovated our sundeck and have barbeque grills and a large screen TV for your enjoyment. We are in the process of completing our Peacock Park and adding some new and exciting things in that area!  While we do not have a restaurant on our property, our friendly associates are more than happy to give you coupons and recommendations to nearby places to dine.   The Peacock Suites constantly strives to exceeds our guests’ expectations, and look forward to hosting you again!

Summary: We stayed at peacock for 3 days this week. I was very impressed.  The rooms were clean, and comfortable.  We were in a 1 bedroom double queen, it was smaller than it seemed in the pictures, but still amazing.  The water pressure could have been better but it was to be expected from such a large place. The treat bags were a welcome surprise. The pool area was small but well kept. The only real negative was how thin the walls were, we could hear conversations from the rooms next to us. I will definitely be staying here the next time I go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello, Angela P   Thank you for including the Peacock Suites on your vacation. We are honored that you chose to stay with us and you found our property nice and clean, which is certainly our goal!  We are pleased to hear when guests enjoy themselves and enjoy their thank you arrival treats.  Thank you for the time you took to write your review! We look forward to your return in the future!

Summary: The noisiest hotel stay I ever had.  Old rickety appliances making weird noises. Construction at 5 in the morning, and loud hotel workers yelling at 6 in the morning. Pic was our view. Third and final stay here! The front desk just cared only about signing us up to here a spiel.
Manager Response: Hello Familymancali  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent experience. We are concerned about your feedback about the noise level you experienced during your last stay. We recently replaced our appliances in 2015, but will be looking into any of the noise you have described. I would like to apologize if you did not get a pre-arrival notice that we have construction from 8am-6pm until November 23rd of this year.  While we have a Guest Guide department that sets up optional presentations to learn more about our property, the front desk team is here for your service 24 hours a day. I hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future so we can give you a memorable stay and enjoy all of our new enhancements on our property.

Summary: We had a very pleasant week at the Peacock Suites. We stayed there for our trip to Disneyland. It wa very close and on the shuttle line to Disneyland which would drop you off almost right at the ticket booth.  The rooms weren't large but adequate as we were mostly at the park and only in our room to sleep. It had a fridge, coffee maker, toaster and microwave. Perfect as I didn't intend to cook, but heating leftovers was great. The living room and bedroom area was separated with a cute glass panel sliding door. The sofa bed in the living room was one of the most comfortable pull out beds I have experienced. That was a huge plus.  The staff was very cordial and helpful. We required a handicapped room and did receive one but it had a tub and we needed a roll in shower. The very
Manager Response: Hello Cruisinmomma67,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I’m glad to hear our location was convenient to the Disneyland Park. It sounds as though the layout of our suites worked out well for you and you liked the private sliding door.  If you plan on traveling with a larger group we have options for more spacious units too! We are so pleased our associates were able to meet your needs and I will be sharing this great review. We look forward to seeing your family again when you return to Anaheim!

Summary: My mother-in-law owned a timeshare here. We stayed here several times during trips to the L.A. area. The location is good. Free shuttle to Disneyland throughout the day. Clean, updated rooms. There is no free parking anywhere near the property. Only parking available is paid valet parking at hotel.
Manager Response: Hello DeidreKing,  Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We are so glad to hear that you choose to come back to Peacock Suites during your trips to the L.A. area.   Thank you again and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: Peacock housekeeping staff are amazing. Very sweep to my granddaughter and accommodated her 'need' for a pencil and property note pads so she could draw. New improvements on the roof top sun deck and pool area are very nice.
Manager Response: Hello Slickkat,  Thank you so much for your feedback, and your kind words about the housekeeping staff! I have shared all of you comments with the staff and we truly look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: First, I was staying in a timeshare condo here but I think some of the rooms are hotel.  The suite was a hybrid, having 4 separate rooms - Bed, Living, Kitchen, Bath, in the space of a large hotel room.  The kitchen had a countertop with sink, a microwave above that, and a half-fridge below, which has a small freezer section.  There is no dishwasher or drainboard, but dishes are supplied.  It's not for serious cooking - more like heating frozen dinners or leftovers.  The one-bedroom suite has a 4-person table in the living room.  I found this all very comfortable and had a nice stay.   A special plus is that the in-room safe was very large.  I was able to store my 17-inch laptop in it. Staff are friendly and helpful, though I had few needs.   Minuses: If you have children
Manager Response: Hello SouthernFamilyof3,   Thank you so much for your detailed comments! It sounds as though the layout of our spacious condos was a great fit for your getaway.  The peacock Suites constantly strives to create a safe environment for our guests and we’re glad you felt comfortable.  We are pleased you found our resort to be convenient to local eateries, and you were able to enjoy our fast WIFI.  We look forward to seeing your family again when you return to Anaheim!

Summary: Really nice suite in Anaheim. The staff were really friendly, the room was good - bedroom, pull out couch (with a comfy mattress!!), kitchenette and dining table. We received a welcome bag with snacks when we checked in which was a nice touch. We only stayed one night, but it seemed like a really great location and wish we had more time to explore the area.
Manager Response: Hello Marisa M,  Thank you for your feedback! We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and that the room was comfortable.  We do hope that you are able to visit us again to be able to enjoy your getaway even more!

Summary: This hotel was awesome. Location was great, right around the corner from Disneyland. It was about a 10 minute walk which wasn't that bad. You could either walk down the crowded streets or walk down Disney Way to get to the park. There is a shuttle that i think is $5 a day per person. It leaves every 20 minutes from the hotel. You could also Uber it which was about $5.75 each way. It is a family hotel so there was a bit of noise from time to time but all sounds seemed to come to a halt at 10pm. There is valet parking and it's $10.50 plus fees a night. The staff was really nice and super helpful. Upon checking in they gave us a little gift bag with snacks and literature. The room was clean, stylish, comfy, and had a small fridge, microwave, sink, utensils and plates. Overall this
Manager Response: Hello Stephaniehopkins2999  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit to the Peacock Suites! Thank you for your comments about the room décor, amenities and especially our staff! We appreciate you taking the time to let us and other guests know about your recent experience and how convenient our location is.  Thank you again for you informative comments Stephanie! We look forward to having you return to the Peacock Suites in the future.

Summary: We stayed at this resort in August and stayed 4 nights.  The reserved a 1 bedroom Suite. Prior to arriving we called to confirm the  reservation and made some requests, Jade the agent who took our call we very polite and answered all our questions and took down our requests.  Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the warm reception we received. The agent at the desk had our room ready at our arrival and the requests we made had been accommodated.  We were also welcome at the adjacent desk next to the checkin area by a very sweet young lady ( sorry we forgot her name) who told us about the property and the local area, also gave us great suggestions for dining.  Upon arriving to our room we were surprised to see a lovely bundt cake waiting for us with a welcome note. We
Manager Response: Hello Familyvacations702   Wow! Thank you so much for leaving us such a detailed review. We are so pleased that you found our property a ‘nice, clean and a friendly place. This is certainly our goal! We have passed along your note to our staff so they are recognized for the service they provided you and your family. I’m glad to hear that you found our location convenient and you were able to enjoy our amenities.   As you know from seeing our parking lot and garage, valet is the most convenient way to handle our parking. We are glad that they were quick and you had a good experience.  Thank you for choosing the Peacock Suites for your trip to Disneyland. We look forward to seeing your family again when you return to Anaheim!

Summary: This is not the place to stay if it is for more than 2 nights the rooms were very small no room to move around. Some rooms did not even have a sink so you could wash your dishes.  The pool area had a heavy odor of bleach and the resort was not up to Wyndham resort standards the good thing was that all the employed were friendly and helpful and the staff was willing to compensate use for the problems we had
Manager Response: Hello frederic F,  Thank you for your comments and for giving an honest review. While it is unfortunate that your experience fell short of expectations, we appreciate your comments. Feedback these days is priceless and without it, we cannot continue to grow.   If your travels bring you back to Anaheim in the future, we would like to hear from you to have the opportunity to give you the wonderful and stress-free experience at Peacock Suites that you deserve!

Summary: Nice Rooms... All with small kitchenets (micro, fridge, plates glasses etc).  The Rooms are smartly appointed with very comfortable beds, flat screens, dvd players & a clock radio. Basic Wi-Fi is free & high speed is avail for a nominal fee.  The grounds are kept well.  they have a pool & spa open till 11pm as well as a nice area with games (PingPong, Foosball & Pool) to unwind at.  They also have a small gym as well as a sun deck on the 4th floor. Only negative is that you must use Valet at $10 a day. The staff if friendly & is attentive to guest needs. There are a couple stores a short walk away & public trans a half block away which is really convenient if you don't want to drive to Disney, the Convention center, Angels or Honda ctr. Parking at these venues is Pricy & all are
Manager Response: Hello Christopher C,   We are so happy that you enjoyed your visit to the Peacock Suites this summer! Thank you for your comments about our amenities, and we're glad you were able to enjoy them. We are always thrilled to hear positive feedback about our staff and happy that they were able to assist you.  Here at the Peacock Suites we work really hard on keeping our property clean and we will share this great review with our staff! Thank you again for your time Christopher, and we hope that you will choose to stay with us again on your next trip to the Anaheim area!

Summary: Not a first class hotel, but nice rooms, clean and convenient location.   Rooms are large and comfortable.  Ground are a parking lot.  Covered pool and recreation area with pool and barbeques to use.   Office area is nice and personnel are very helpful.  Disneyland bus stops right outside.
Manager Response: Hello WILLIAM L,  Thank you for your review and for the kind words about the staff! The Peacock Suites team is always excited to know when their efforts are recognized by our guests.   Thank you again and we hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: We had a wonderful weeks' long holiday at the Peacock suites. The staff was extremely friendly. The room was clean and spacious (although housekeeping only came 2 times during our stay, which we knew would happen in advance). :) We hope to come back again next year for another Disneyland holiday providing we can get the timeshare at Peacock suites. :)
Manager Response: Hello Nikki R,  We were delighted to read your review! We appreciate your kind words about the staff and are genuinely glad you enjoyed our stay with us.   We look forward to having you stay with us during your next trip to Disney!

Summary: An experience so memorable we opened a Tripadvisor account to demonstrate our experience.  I only explain what went wrong to put in perspective how little it took to trigger the attention of Abdul, the presiding General Manager.
