The hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice! This is a great resort to stay with kids... It has a pool, ping pong tables, and a nice recreation area. As for the 3-bedroom suite, it was very cramped and basically two hotel rooms turned into a suite. I would not recommend more then 8 people trying to stay in the suite. It got very cramped after day 2. The room was very clean and nicely decorated and rom was comfortable. Overall, I think this hotel is great for the price. It is definitely somewhere to stay if your taking kids and on a budget. The only draw backs are parking is $10 a night and shuttle is not
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments about the Peacock Suites on TripAdvisor!  We appreciate your comments and have passed them along to the staff.  We look forward to having you and your family stay with us again in the future!

Summary: Great rooms/decor.  Amazing beds (I wanted to take one home, but I have a small car.) Super friendly staff.  They really want to make sure you have a great experience.  Very convenient location to everything that's worth doing in Anaheim.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites!  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your visit.  We are always pleased to hear when our guests enjoy themselves!  Thank you again for your kind review!

Summary: This hotel is clean, well-maintained and staffed by very friendly people. However, the rooms are laid out so poorly that sleep becomes extremely difficult.   * The bedroom area is in with the very large window, which does not have black-out window treatments (see picture - you can see that the bed is up against the window with sunlight pouring onto the pillows). I woke up at 6 a.m. because of the sunlight.  * I live 45 minutes from Disneyland but got the hotel room so I could nap during the afternoon then return in the evening and stay until closing at midnight. When I went back to the room to nap, I could not sleep because of the bright sunshine and because it turned out side of the hotel overlooked some kind of factory that was running an extremely loud air compressor for most
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a great hotel for our Disneyland Vacation!
Summary: Check-in was perfect.  Customer Service is A+ at this hotel.  Our room was exactly as promised.  The location to Disneyland was great.  The $5 round trip shuttle was comfortable and on time.  Very easy to use.  The one block walk to the 7-11 to purchase some food items was convenient.
Manager Response: WOW!  What a great review and thank you very much for your kind words!  I have shared all of your comments with the staff and we truly look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We like to stay here when we go to Disney. It's about a 20 min walk. The hotel also offers a shuttle for about $5.00 a person, and it takes about 5 min to get there. The rooms are nice and clean when you get there. They won't clean your room though until your third day staying there. I was disappointed that they no longer serve breakfast. The pool area is nice. The pool is heated, they also have a pool table, ping pong table, and a couple of video games.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal guest and staying with us whenever you go to Disneyland.  We are glad to hear that our location is convenient for you and for your vacation needs.  As a timeshare resort, we clean rooms after the 4th day, but our helpful staff is always available to take any requests for extra amenities during stay.  We look forward to your return in the future!

Summary Heading: Resort and Valet staff provides you with an A++ experience
Summary: I come to this resort at a minimum of once every other month and each visit never lets me down. Resort and Valet staff continues to provide great service and makes each visit a welcoming one. I am an Elite member and get a welcome pack during each of my visits but they go out their way to make you feel right at home. Resort is remodeled and very nice. Definitely recommend this place and will be back for future stays.
Manager Response: As our loyal guest, we thank you for your kind words and awesome review.  We are glad to hear that you are made to feel as if you were at home during your vacation.   Thank you for your recommendation and we look forward to seeing you and your family again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This was our third time staying at the Peacock suites. Every year the Hotel improves. This year the new “Sun Deck” is open on the roof, and it is a very nice addition. At night you can see the fireworks from Disneyland Park. The hotel was very clean, friendly staff and we had no issues checking in or out. Valet parking at 10.00 a day was reasonable for the area, and the staff was very prompt at parking and retrieving our car when needed. This hotel is great for families on a moderate budget; the 1-room suite was great for my wife and me with our two teenage boys, lots of privacy.  And YES, next year we will be staying here again!!
Manager Response: We’d like to thank you for your loyalty over the past several years.  We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our beautifully remodeled  sundeck.  We are pleased to read that you will be returning to the Peacock Suites on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Valet service was outstanding and very quick when requesting the car.
Summary: I have been a Shell owner for over 10 years and visit the pPeacock Suites almost 3 times a year. I was very disappointed that the continental breakfast service had be discontinued and especially bothered by the fact that when I made my reservations with Shell had not been informed about this change.
Manager Response: Thank you for the compliments given to the valet, we will definitely make sure to share your kind words with the team.  I do apologize, that you weren’t informed about the discontinuation of our complimentary breakfast.  In effort to ensure all of our owners and potential guests were informed about the breakfast, we reached out to all of our outlets who make reservations in March of 2014 to inform about the discontinuation effective June 2014.  Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again.

Summary: Stayed here for 6 days while visiting Disneyland. This is our second time staying here. It's been remodeled since our stay last year and it was even nicer than I remember. We loved the new sundeck where you can sit and  watch the Disneyland fireworks, or just sit and enjoy the sun and listen to music. So cool! I love the suite because we can share a room with our boys and still have privacy. The staff are always friendly and helpful and the price is very reasonable for such a lovely hotel. We requested a room further away from the road and they did what they could to make that happen. Then after our wonderful stay at this place, we were accused by another hotel on our trip home of smoking in their room and charged 250.00 dollars on our credit card. I'm happy to say, Peacock
Manager Response: Thank you for the amazing review of your recent visit to the Peacock Suites.  It is always a pleasure to hear that our guests thoroughly enjoyed what we have to offer.  Thank you again for taking the time to let us know of your experience and we look forward to your return visit to the Peacock Suites!

Summary: Close to everything. We had a suite for our Grandchildren which worked out well. Twenty minute walk to Disney Parks, as well close to some great eateries. Bus stops right in front, and valet parking.Went to a Baseball game which was a ten minute ride
Manager Response: We’re glad to hear that you felt our location was convenient for both Disneyland and local eateries.  We want to thank you and your family again for choosing to stay with us and hope to see you again!

Summary: Reserved this hotel and requested an early check in which I was told would be fine. When I got there at 10 I was told no that I couldn't check in until 4. So I contacted customer service and was able to cancel with no fees I was able to find a hotel much closer to Disneyland. I received a call from Peacock Suites at 5:30 to let me know my room was ready.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at this place several times within the last couple years.  For this review it is for our most recent stay (May 2015).  Getting to the hotel is a little tricky, but once you figure out a couple of times, it's a little easier. The staff are always pleasant and courteous upon arrival. The room for this trip was a one-bedroom with kitchenette.  The kitchenette did lack a sink, but for this trip we did not use it very much.  The couch folded out into a comfortable bed for the kids (two, 6 and 7) and our room had a nice king size bed.  With the four of us, it can get a little tight for space. The staff are always quick to respond if there is an issue.  Also, since we were there for Mother's day a gift was given to my wife to make her day a little more special.  There is
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for the high marks.  Every guest who comes to the property is an opportunity for us to leave a lasting impression in hopes that you will return.  We are very happy to see that you will consider us for your future trips to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed at Peacock on Feb with my partner and 11 mth old daughter. First the kitchenette is not really a kitchenette, it's a counter, mini fridge, micro and minimal dishes and cutlery!  Didn't even have a kitchen sink for cleaning baby bottles.   Rooms are SMALL!  Very small!  I've stayed at many she'll hospitality resorts and this by far had the most badgering for timeshares. Literally we had 3 in room calls in our week, plus every time they saw us, even though we clearly said were not interested in a 3 hr presentation w an 11 mth old!  Parking is valet only, quite annoying and inefficient. Close to disney, Cheesecake Factory and other good amenities. On site laundry facilities were great. Housekeeping was lacking (ie had to call to have trash removed even after housekeeping had
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites.  While we are disappointed to hear that you felt your stay was only mediocre, we appreciate your comments.  We are glad that you enjoyed our amenities such as our sun deck and laundry facilities.  In regards to housekeeping, we clean all rooms after the third day, but encourage our guests to call down if they are lacking or need anything during their stay to ensure that they are comfortable.  Hopefully, you will give us another chance in the future.

Summary: Peacock Suites was a moderately priced, clean, convenient hotel for my family when we visited Disneyland in May, 2015. The "suite" accommodations were nice for my son's family - giving some privacy/separation for the adults and/or sleeping toddlers.   Although it was  a bit of a walk to the Disney parks, the Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) mini-bus (fee-based for an all day pass) stopped right in front of the hotel and dropped us off at the front gate of the parks (no hassles and no parking fees.)  In addition, it is within walking distance to some nicer restaurants. For families on a strict budget, there were several "fast food" restaurants across the street from the Disney park entrance where people could dine before and/or after entering the parks.  I knew there would be
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at Peacock Suites into writing!  We appreciate your feedback and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  Thank you again for your review and we look forward to having you and your family be our guests again!

Summary: The front desk staff appeared very happy and courteous to make sure that we had a pleasant stay. The room was well-designed with a TV in the living room, counter top, microwave, spacious cupboard with kitchenette, just missing a kitchen sink. The layout of the hotel was a little confusing from the lobby to the room as we checked in late, but we figured it out the next day. We'd prefer self parking although the valet guys were very nice and fast.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words about the staff and service you received during your visit to the Peacock Suites.  We look forward to seeing you and your family again soon!

Summary Heading: Three things to know:  Disney is a long walk, housekeeping every 3rd night, and pay for park.
Summary: These three items would have been nice to know before I traveled. First Disney was about a 1.5 miles so if you have small children it's a far walk.  You can take the ART, the stop is right in front of the hotel, we ended up taking a cab back from Disney it was $7.  Second, housekeeping only comes every 3rd night so you have to call for clean towels and set your trash in the hall. Finally, the hotel ONLY has valet parking ($10).  Also there is NO breakfast.  I saw multiple reviews that mentioned breakfast, the hotel stopped serving breakfast a year ago.  The room itself was clean and nice.  The room was setup backwards from what I expected, you walked into the bedroom, the "living room" was past the bedroom.  The bathroom was in the bedroom.    The pool area is under the building
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience as well as helpful tips.  Disneyland is approximately 1.2 miles away from the property which is about a 15 minute walk.  However, as you stated, the Anaheim Resort Transit picks up in front of our hotel for a nominal fee.  As a timeshare property, we clean all rooms after the third night, but are readily available to provide clean linen or take out trash by request.  Although, we no longer provide complimentary breakfast as of June 1st, 2014, there is an array of restaurants within the resort area which you can enjoy a hot breakfast.  We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back again in the near future!

Summary: This is a clean and simple hotel. We are local and have Annual Passes & didn't feel like home so we stayed. You have to drive to the park or take a shuttle. NOT walking distance . The rooms are larger than a regular hotel room with a lounging area. Breakfast is also included which is convenient. The gift store has lots of Disney paraphernalia at non-Disney inflated prices. They also have a pool with a small splash area for the younger non swimmers.  Overall it cost under $100 to stay and our to under two were able to take their afternoon naps and still see the fireworks all in the same day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here in a third floor 2bedroom 2 bathroom unit for 10 nights.  The apartment was tastefully decorated and it had 3 televisions! (1 in each bedroom and 1 in the living area).  The beds were very comfortable and everything was nice and clean.  Had a small kitchenette but strangely it did not have a kitchen sink. Plenty of crockery and cutlery which when used, you place outside the door and house keeping provide clean ones.  Still would be better with a sink. There is a shuttle stop just out the front so for $5 you can travel to Disneyland and a lot of other places over 24 hours.  We walked to Disneyland and the restaurants near it on many occasions - takes about 15 to 20 minutes.  The Cheesecake Factory is close by and there is a Seven Eleven even closer.  We didn't have a
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you found our associates friendly and helpful.  That is certainly our goal!  It is also nice to hear that our location was convenient for you in regards to restaurants and attractions within walking distance.  Thank you for the recommendation and hope to see you soon!

Summary: Great location, ART shuttle to Disneyland park, one day fare of $5.00 with as many trips per day as you wish. We being Grand parents got 3 days for price of one. Valet parking at Peacock is $10.00 per day and everyone pays no choices but you use shuttle anyway. The rooms are nice but walls are thin and being a Disneyland  type hotel means lots of small children running and shouting about their experiences. Lots of eatery's to choose from within walking distance. Food inside park is easy to find but high. ie. $7.00 for corn dog, but, we ate at French Market 3 adults for less than $50.00. Peacock suites staff where friendly but just average on addressing our needs. All in all this is a reasonable place to stay when visiting Disneyland, I have stayed here 3 times.
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to come back to the Peacock Suites and being a loyal family member.  We are glad to hear that you found our staff to be friendly, but saddened that they were just average when addressing your needs.  We will use your comment to help coach and train all of our associates to be attentive to all of our guests needs.  Thank you again and we look forward to your return!

Summary Heading: Updated but small, 1.2 mile walk from Disneyland, fireworks partially visible from sundeck
Summary: We stayed here for a week in a 2 bedroom.  We had read reviews and requested a room on the 4th floor.  We had no issues with noise and had a partial view of the fireworks at Disneyland from one of the bedrooms (we were in room 422).  The kitchen area has a cabinet on the wall holding some dishes and a microwave.  There was a sink below the microwave and a small counter.  Below the sink was a cabinet containing a garbage can and a recycling bin (loved that recycling is offered).  Under the counter next to the sink was a mini fridge.  There is a table for four and a small sitting area with a couch (and fold out bed), chair, coffee table, end table, small dresser, and TV. The TV's have Dish Network and the ability to swap, but no pausing, recording or backing up.  One bedroom had a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your recent experience at the Peacock Suites.  We appreciate hearing both the pros and cons of your stay as we use your comments to help us improve.  If your travels bring you back to Anaheim in the future, we’d love for you to give us a second chance.  Hope to have the pleasure of you hosting you again!

Summary: Hotel is part of our timeshare club. Clean, convenient if you are planning to do stuff around the Disney area. Walking distance to plenty of restaurants and stores. The pool area is nice, as well as the little "park" within the hotel with some activities for the kids.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your review.  We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you and your family again for future family getaways.

Summary Heading: Clean Room, Easy Commute to Disney
Summary: This was our first time staying at the Peacock Suites. We had a very clean room, plenty of space for the two of us. Loved the kitchenette as wee usually bring our own breakfast. Staff was friendly and helpful. Valet was super quick. We took the ART and it was only a 5min drive to Disney and you get dropped off right at the gates... So nice.  We had heard about the time share presentation so we were prepared, however after a long day at Disney, that's the last thing I want to do. My only other complaint was that our room was a little noisy as it was located near the elevator. Nothing a good fan couldn't drown out, but next time will request a room farther away from the elevator. We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the comments about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites.  We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your visit and glad to hear that you will definitely return on future visits to Anaheim.  Hope to see you soon!

Summary: I totally enjoyed myself staying here. The rooms were pretty and had plenty of room. It was very clean and anything we needed was taken care of. The staff was amazing. There was a group of 7 of us together. The grill in the rec area was wonderful to use after a long day on your feet! I would definitely recommend this place to other people.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind recommendation and review.  We are glad that we were able to be part of such a special celebration.  We look forward to you staying with us in the near future!

Summary Heading: Terrific place, terrific people, Peacock Suites gets an A++++++++
Summary: This was a fantastic place to stay.  We went here for a bachelorette party and it was the perfect place to stay.  Within walking distance to Disneyland, clean rooms, great extras, and the BBQ in the common area was a fun way to spend one of our evenings.  The bed was very comfy and all of the employees always had a smile on their faces and had great suggestions for evening shenanigans.  I would highly recommend this place for single trip, couples trip, business trip, family trip, or a friends trip.  There was also a dancing club about 2 blocks away for those of us who like to dance the night away.  I can't say enough good things about this place! Did I mention the sun deck? The pool? The pool table? The ping pong table?!!
Manager Response: On behalf of the staff at the Peacock Suites, we'd like to thank you for your kind words!  Your review has been shared with the team during our morning meetings.  We truly look forward to serving you and your family again in the future.

Summary: Very clean, lots of amenities ( pool, hot tub, bbq's for guests to use, laundry facilities) close to Disney - about a 20 minute walk & tons of good restaurants.  The GardenWalk , nice little shopping area is close by. Shuttle to Disney is available for a cost. Staff at this resort is very friendly & helpful.  You pay for valet parking (no choice for this) but they are great.  Definitely would stay  here again.
Manager Response: Valarie, we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your vacation with us here at the Peacock Suites.  We look forward to your return in the future.

Summary Heading: It's okay, but not what you'd expect of a Wyndham
Summary: This is a clean, newly renovated, decent place to stay. If the price is right (we used a friend's timeshare points), I'd say go for it.  However.  They don't empty the trash unless you request it. They say this is because they are "going green". Really? By leaving smelly trash in my room? -- Interesting. They also don't do daily housekeeping, just change your linens every third day. Okay, I can make my own bed and hang up my towels, but really? They also say they're "within walking distance to Disney", which is technically true, but at 2.7 miles it's not particularly practical. Then there are the little things, like no q-tips and no extra toilet paper in the bathrooms. Overall, not very Wyndham-ish.  If I were paying for a hotel with actual dollars, I'd prefer to stay within
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean lovely suites close by to Disneyland  . Just off the motorway but not noisy  kitchenette in room was good with sitting area . Two TVs valet parking was good 10.per day . It's a tight parking lot so it worth it . Not worrying about your car .great staff .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at the Peacock Suites!  We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Awesome place to stay with one exception
Summary: Just got back from a week in Anaheim and wanted to review this hotel. We've stayed at many hotels in the Anaheim area over the years. I have to say that this was one of our favorites. Rate was great at about $110 per night, room was spotless, and furnishings were all high quality. From the outside you wouldn't think the rooms would be nice, but we were pleasantly surprised (however, I already knew that thanks to the reviews on TripAdvisor). Front desk employees were great and always had a smile on their faces. Valet was always quick and while I'm not a fan of valet, I understand why you have to valet your vehicle (space is very tight). Pool was average and nothing to be excited about. The one complaint that we have is this: If you're on the 4th floor, you HAVE to either take the
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for the time you took to write a review about your stay at the Peacock Suites!  We appreciate your kind words and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites at the end of January, from booking at Wyndham Extra Holidays. The staff was friendly and efficient at check-in, which we appreciated after a long day of travel and the commute from LAX. Our suite was perfect for us, as we spent most of the time at Disneyland. Resort was clean and kept up and within walking distance to a nearby 7-Eleven and restaurants. The concierge was very helpful and scheduled our Hollywood tour, which picked us up and dropped us off right at the Peacock Suites. Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART-which gets you to/from all the attractions in Anaheim) tickets can be bought from a kiosk at the resort and they pick up right in front of the resort. Check-out was easy and we were given a snack bag when we left, which was nice! We
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to hear that you really enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites!  Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments on Tripadvisor.  We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: We found this great place and have stayed here 4 times in the past year. Everyone is always helpful, even when they are slammed with check ins and outs. We always get the 1 br suite with a Murphy bed. It works fine for our family when we stay. The property has gone thru a remodel and looks great. The only downfall is the breakfast was discontinued in May. Booo !!  As long as we continue to visit the OC area, we will stay here. Thank you to the property manager and their staff for all their hard work. See you for Spring break 2015..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review.  We're so happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to seeing you in the Spring!

Summary Heading: Clean and Nice but a bit noisy from bedroom upstairs
Summary: We traveled as a family of 4 (a 4 and 8 years old children). We all loved the room. It is spacious, clean, equipped with microwave, sink and separate vanity outside the bathroom. Also there is a small lounge with a dining table for 4. The only minus is that we could clearly hear the noise from upstairs. Very clear noise of footsteps. On our last night, the upstairs neighbor decided to wake up at 3.38am and walked around. As a light sleeper, I got waken up a few times. Reception suggestion for the solution is next time ask for upper level rooms. Valet parking is a must here at $10.00+tax per night. No option of self parking. Though the valet service is really wonderful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 6 adults 1 room 2 nights at the Peacock Suites
Summary: Sounds like a new Disney movie title, right?   We were looking for a cheap hotel option that was clean, comfortable, and a convenient distance to Disneyland. The Peacock Suites worked well for our needs.  The price was right and even the pull out bed was comfortable. The ART shuttle to Disneyland is $5 for the day and pulls up right out front. We had to coordinate the use of one bathroom, but it was manageable. The bottom line was that for the price, I would stay here again with a group of friends.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback!  It sounds as though the layout of our spacious suites was a great fit for you during your 2 night stay.  We look forward to hosting you again!

Summary Heading: Space is at a premium, but close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for a week in October 2014.  We booked this through RCI which meant it was a great deal for us. The room had two separate bedrooms, one with a king bed and and attached full bath the other with 2 queen beds. There was a second full bathroom and then a small dining/kitchen cabinet/living room area.  The kitchen cabinet and counter area had full size heavy dishes and silverware, but no sink and no dishwasher and a tiny mini fridge.  The dirty dishes are to be stacked up and put outside your room door in the hall.  This is so gross, when you walk down the hall it is lined with people's dirty dishes.  We also were unwilling to risk someone taking our dishes and billing us for them, so we just piled them up on the kitchen counter which was fine since we only used a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do not stay here! This is a run-down shoddy excuse for a "premier vacation." Here's why:  - NOISE.  The noise level is horrendous, and walls are paper thin. You can clearly hear traffic from outside and car noise from inside.  Since there is valet parking only, they drive constantly under your unit and you hear alarms and beeping.  Kids, excited to see Disneyland, are understandable running around inside the units, out on the walk ways, around the property, and generally being kids.  However, there is absolutely no attempt to mitigate the noise and the units are very loud. Do not stay here if you want to sleep at any time.  - Kitchen?  There is NO kitchen or sink or dishwasher to wash dishes.  However, they advertise kitchen facilities in this "time share" property, and they
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us and other guests know about your recent experience at the Peacock Suites.  It’s unfortunate that your experience fell short of the expectations that we set for each and every guest.  We’re known for our amazing customer service and follow up with our guests, and we’re deeply disappointed that your stay didn’t reflect these qualities.  I would like to speak to you regarding your stay.  Please feel free to contact Rochanda at 714-535-8255.  Thank you and I look forward to speaking with you.

Summary: We stayed here for a total of 8 nights from Dec 19th to Dec 27th. Our first impression was that of a well kept establishment with ease of checking in. upon arriving for our first night and making down the sofa for our 7 year old we noticed not sheets or blankets could be found.  A quick call down to the desk indicates all our house keepers are on lunch and we would get them delivered.  Well we waited patiently until 9:30 pm when my wife was tired of the two hour wait and a child that way past bedtime.  A quick trip  down to the front desk and voila we found a housekeeper to get the needed items.   Now as mentioned earlier we stayed a total of eight nights.  During this time we had to get our own towel exchange and never once did we even have a housekeeper offer to exchange our
Manager Response: First and foremost,  we would like to thank you for taking the time to post your comments about your stay with us here at the Peacock. After reading your comments about our Housekeeping service and followup, we wanted to say that it has been addressed, and these comments have been shared with the entire management team, Housekeeping included. Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: This is part of the Shell Vacation Club that is now owned by Wyndham. We traded our week for a week here. We had never stayed at this property before. The property is very clean and the staff is outstanding. It is close to Disneyland and has a City Shuttle that picks you up in front of the property. It has a nice pool and two spas. The property also has nice outdoor seating and BBQ area. The room was very nice and large, we had two queen beds in the bedroom and a living room with queen  sofa, coffee table and end table. It also has a small frig, microwave and sink along with dishes and silverware and a kitchen table. There is no garbage disposal which was the only inconvenience we encountered. However overall I would recommend the property for families with children-- We had
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughts about the stay you and your family experienced here at the Peacock Suites! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit and truly appreciate the time you took to write your review. We look forward to having you visit again in the future!

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights. When we checked in we had arrived early then the expected check-in time of 4pm. I was a little worried as we had had a 14 hour flight with not much sleep and arrived at the Peacock Suites at 10ish. However we were going to ask if we could leave our luggage and we would go off a walk, there was no need as our room was ready and we could check-in, this was fantastic! A major positive to start our US holiday. Reception Staff were friendly and accommodating. Our room was lovely, very clean. Had two queen beds in a room and then the kitchen/lounge room. So two TV's so we could watch our shows and teenager could watch hers in the lounge, another plus! We did attend a presentation on timeshare, but when we said no there was no pressure and we left feeling
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to express your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We are always thankful to our guests who react positively to their stay and want others to know about it.  We have passed your comments on to our staff to read so that they know they are appreciated in their contributions to make your stay as nice as it was!  Thank you again and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This hotels staff is very dumb and they don't know how to book rooms right. When we first got there they messed up our rooms so our family had to split and half our family was on one side of the hotel and we were on the other. A few hours later the one half of our family got kicked out of their room. Now 10 of us are stuck in a tiny room because the staff kept messing up on the rooms. VERY DISAPPOINTED NOT WORTH THE MONEY NEVER STAY HERE.  The pool is also very small and lame.
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments you took the time to submit regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites. While we realize that we are unable to make everyone happy (although we sure try) we would like for you to know that we have taken your comments to heart and have reviewed all that you said.

Summary: I've stayed here a few times, and it's always been adequate. But the renovations they've made are very nice! The rooms look a lot nicer. I would definitely stay here again.  Pluses: - clean rooms with nice decor - swimming pool and two hot tubs - pool table - ping pong table - arcade games by the pool table (maybe 3? I forget since we didn't play) - friendly staff - 2 bedroom suite was very nice! - (paid) shuttle to Disneyland  Minuses: - none really, but it was nice when they had the breakfasts
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for putting your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites in writing. We are happy to hear that you were pleased with our renovations and that you plan to stay here again the next time you are in Anaheim!!! Thank you again. We look forward to your future visit!

Summary: We went as a time share to find out this hotel does both tie share and public reservation. Beds were comfortable. Bathrooms were nice. Weird thing was they had mini fridges (not maintained to well) microwave, and dishes. No sink to clean them in, if you wanted cleaned one you call the front desk.  Overall a fair place that is close to Disney.
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites. Your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!

Summary: Since last years visit it appears that all of the rooms have been renovated. There are still some rooms that lack a kitchen sink, but will be accommodated upon request to vacation owners. They no longer offer breakfast (unless you attend the presentation) which is fine and now have a gift shop on sight but the hours are a little tricky. Since its a vacation rental they also do not offer cleaning but will replenish linens upon request. I rated this higher than average for the price, location in proximity to Disney, cleanliness and the amenities which include the sun deck, pool, splash pad, gym, shuttle and giftshop.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!  We are glad to hear that this vacation was improved from the last.  We are constantly looking for ways in which we can improve our guests’ experience and therefore value any and all feedback from guests. We look forward to hosting you again in the near future.

Summary: My boyfriend and I came across this hotel on Tripadvisor (imagine that!) while doing a search for hotels near Disneyland. For the price of our stay, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of what we received. There were a couple issues, but they weren't so bad that they would deter me from staying again.  We checked in on a Tuesday evening. It wasn't too late, but we arrived after a long drive, so we were tired. There was one staff member on staff, and she was assisting someone else, so it took a few minutes. It was around Halloween, and they were having a pumpkin decorating contest--inviting guests to vote on their favorites--so we entertained ourselves looking at the entries while waiting to check in. I noticed a calendar that listed other guest activities, such as treat
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing us with your honest feedback. We appreciate it, and we also want you to know that we take all comments right to our management team for discussion. We are happy to see that overall you enjoyed your stay and hope you will consider us in the future for your trips to Anaheim!

Summary: Disneyland Hotels can take you for a ride in many ways: crowded with poor service, expensive and not well maintained.  Peacock Suites was the exception: full of people but not crowded, reasonable in price and quite clean. Plus everyone from the maintenance staff to the front desk to the maids were helpful and very nice.  We enjoyed the rec area with comfy couches, ping pong and even BBQ grills.  The small pool was plenty enough for our family. We even found a small gift shop with a lovely lady to help us.  Just in front is the ART Bus stop to get around and a short walk away is a useful 7-11 to buy milk for the kid, snacks and even prepared food. It's wasn't large but the front area had a big couch, a table and food prep area with coffeemaker and microwave so we could have
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post comments about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites.  Our staff was thrilled to hear your feedback regarding our service. We appreciate your kind words and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.

Summary: Well I didnt want to hv a high expectation on how the room will look like or watsoever. Just need a comfortable room to sleep and rest after a long drive from San Francisco. When we arrived.We checked in at the front desk with an issue. Although it took almost half an hr but eventually it was solved by the receptionist with the help of the manager. Was delighted to see the room when we entered. Surprisingly it was clean and well maintained. Just nice for the 5 of us. (me n my husband,our daughters aged 3 & 2 and a 15mths old son). The dining rm with kitchenette was separated by a door to the bedroom. The beds were quite high.not much space for my 3 big luggages that I hv to move the coffee table aside. No scenery frm our room. No room service.So we hv to do the clean up ourself.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: smallest suite I have ever been in
Summary: I checked in to Peacock Suites on a Sat and checked out Sunday....the room was tiny, not like any other suite I have ever stayed in.  and you open your door to the bathroom sink and vanity.  The room is small would have been fine for 3-4 not for 6.  when you open couch which is a (temperpedic- it was amazing) you couldn't get back to the bathroom- and the ceilings were low I am 5'1 and could reach up and touch the tiles. also the living room of the suite was freezing while the bedroom was hot, we had to open the window -   all in all it wasn't at all what I thought.
Manager Response: We realize that you have many options when it comes to lodging and appreciate you choosing the Peacock Suites.  While we are disappointed to hear that the room fell short of your overall expectations, we appreciate your comments.  We hope that you will consider coming back to stay with us in the future.  We do have both a 2 and 3 bedroom suite which may be more accommodating for your family.  If I can be of any assistance with your reservations please reach out to me.

Summary Heading: Good location for Disneyland, plus a mini kitchen to save you food costs
Summary: We stayed in two one-bedroom units for a family vacation to the "happiest place on earth."  One had dishes, a kitchen sink, mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, sofa bed, and two queen beds in the bedroom.  All rooms had a kitchen table, an ironing board, iron, hair blower.  The second room had a murphy bed, queen sofa sleeper in the living room, and the dishes, mini fridge and microwave were in the bedroom - but there was no kitchen sink.  I guess you were supposed to do dishes in the bathroom sink in that room.  The Murphy bed / no kitchen sink room had a view of the park fireworks from the room (4th floor, room 421).  That room was nearly half again the size of the other room (410).  You can also see the fireworks from the roof top sun deck.  They are awesome in the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind recommendation and review.  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our associates to be helpful and friendly.

Summary: We exchanged two weeks through Interval International with Peacock Suites approximately 6 months in advance of our trip.  We had paid a lot of money for this and the conditions of our exchange was for a 2 bedroom appt.  At no stage were we contacted that there were no 2 bedroom suites available and upon arrival we discovered we had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen sized beds.  Given we are a family of 4 with 2 growing boys, this was far from ideal, especially seen as we had paid a premium to get 2 bedrooms.  We asked to be moved to a 2 bedroom suite but were told there was nothing available.  The fold out couch in the lounge took up too much room and was very uncomfortable so was not used.  The whole process left us extremely disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us and other guests know about your recent experience at the Peacock Suites.  It’s unfortunate that certain aspects of your vacation fell short of your expectations.  We appreciate hearing both the good and the bad of our guests experience as we look to these to help us move forward and improve.  If travels bring you back to Anaheim in the future, we’d like to hear from you and have the opportunity to have you experience the Peacock Suites one more time.

Summary Heading: Top shelf stay at this location.
Summary: Huge rooms.   Bedroom with a king bed  and TV, a bathroom area which is again separate from a living room.  Living room has fridge, microwave and full set of dishes and glass wear,,along with a TV.  The only downside is $10/day to park and no maid service.  There are grilles available as well... Very cool place and not a bag of cash required to stay there.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to share your review.  We’re always thrilled when our rooms exceed our guests’ expectations. We look forward to your return in the future!

Summary Heading: must have a wide angle camera lens for the photos...
Summary: Was looking forward to a week near Disneyland. We were very disappointed with what we got. The room was tiny. No kitchen sink...dishes had to be done in the basin??? Large microwave, but nothing else to cook with. No sharp knives...nothing sharp and nothing available. Had to buy a carving knive to cut bread fruit etc. Once the pull out bed was down there was little room for anything. Storeage was very minimal.   Stephanie was a lovely host. Very helpful and honest.  Not good to have to do a timeshare presentation either...even though we stated we had it already. Very pushy then anger by the closer we had...why were we there??? Not a good experience at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for families/groups that need personal space.
Summary: This was my third stay at the Peacock Suites. The first two times I was with family members who are timeshare holders. This time I came as just a regular paying guest with no timeshare.  The Peacock was in remodel the last time I visited. Can't say that the changes are all that noticeable, and certainly not something to write home about. The pool's renovations were not changes, I honestly can't see a difference. I still don't understand why the pool is outside next to the parking lot and busy street. Is it impossible to move it to the "sun deck"? It's quite small so even just a couple of families using the facility means it feels overly crowded.  But, I don't like to use the pool so I guess it doesn't matter either way for me, right?  The hotel used to offer a continental
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to leave such a detailed review.  Your feedback is greatly appreciated.  We constantly strive to provide exceptional service and are sincerely concerned when we fall short of our guests’ expectations.  We hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back to our property again.

Summary: Here is how our visit started. We arrived at 530....during what should be off season. Check in started at 4 and our rooms weren't ready. We could also only get 1 key because they didn't have enough. Took hours to connect to Wifi. As soon as we got to our room we dropped the AC to 75. 2 hours later it was still at 79 so we called. Over an hour later someone finally arrived and told us the room was only 4 degrees above where we wanted it and left. Another nearly hour later he called and asked if it was better...no. Then the front desk called and said there were no other rooms and no manager to talk to until the next day. So now we are stuck in a hot room with an overtired child. As a Shell owner I am highly disappointed in this experience. Day one of 4...let's hope it gets better.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer R and Family. I appreciate your feedback as it helped us reach out to you and reach a resolution. I apologize for the challenges that you experienced, and please feel free to reach out to me if there is anything else I can do to be of service. Yours in Hospitality, Abdul.

Summary: I want to begin with this, we travel monthly and are very picky about where we chose to stay. Cleanliness, and proximity are most important when booking. We have stayed at several 4 star hotels throughout CA and have been disappointed 90% of the time. When booking our Disneyland trip, we decided to take a gamble on this hotel, and we are very pleased that we did!  We booked a one bed King Suite September 6th-9th, and our stay was wonderful! Our suite was very clean and ecstatically pleasing with all of the new updates. The grounds are very clean and all updated as well. We have a one year old, and loved the fact that the pool is shaded, he also enjoyed the sprinkler feature =) This hotel is extremely family friendly, has a rec area with pool tables, bbq, ping pong table and
Manager Response: Dear DJ W! All I have to say is WOW. Your comments not only made my day, but my entire team's! Your experience epitomizes exactly why we do what we do at the Peacock Suites. Thank you for staying at our Hotel, and until next time, be well, have fun, and plan your next Disney adventure! Abdul.

Summary Heading: Nice, but too far away from Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is nice enough, and has suite-type rooms that are superior to other hotels I will mention, but if the purpose of your trip is to go to Disneyland then this place is just too far away. It is about a 20 minute walk versus about 3 minutes if you stay across from the park on Harbor Blvd.  I would suggest the Tropicana, Park Vue, Park Place, or Desert Inn. That way you can easily visit the park in the morning, and go back to your room for a break or a swim, and go back to the park later.  It really makes a huge difference to your holiday if you can stay closer to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear LinkCanada. Thank you for sharing your perspective on the location. I appreciate that you acknowledge the advantages of our rooms in comparison to other Hotels in the area. At Peacock Suites, we truly take pride in what we do, and in the level of service and value that we deliver to our Guests. Although we are approximately 1 mile away from the parks, there is a Disney Shuttle that stops right outside the Hotel every 20 minutes that offers our Guests a great alternative to driving and parking at the park or walking the distance. Once again, thank you for the feedback, and thank you for being our Guest. Abdul.

Summary: Friendly staff!! Always someone at the front desk. Our room was very clean (we had a 1-bedroom suit) with our 2 boys. Easy to short drive to Disneyland. The room was serviced everyday, the pool was clean and I liked that it was covered because it was so hot (we went in late May 2014 it was between 90-100) the air-conditioning in the room was awesome. The free breakfast was good- bagels-boiled eggs-cereal-Donuts-Fruit- coffee-juices. Clean and plenty to go around. Room price was great for a one bedroom suit, 109.00 per night. The only thing that I didn't like was the valet parking (11.00) per day. With that and 15.00 a day to park at Disney the deal we got on the rental car did help balance it out.  We are planning another trip to Disney next May and will book with Peacock Suits.
Manager Response: Dear Mike B! Thank you for the thorough review about the Peacock Suites. I am happy to hear about your positive experience and the value and service that we offer our Guests. Although we have discontinued the Breakfast in June 2014, we have made some wonderful enhancements to the appearance of the Hotel. We just completed a hallway carpet and wallpaper renovation to compliment our modern rooms. I look forward to your future visits to Disney and staying at the Peacock Suites once more! Yours in Disney Adventures, Abdul.

Summary: It was perfect for us. We chose the hotel based on its reviews as we were going to Disney for 1 week. The rooms are spacious, clean and have everything you need. We basically went there just to sleep. The hotel is walking distance to Disney and to many restaurants like The Cheesecake factory which I happen to love. Breakfast is served each morning and they have a little bit of everything.
Manager Response: Hi Gelseyf! Thank you for the awesome feedback. Now is a great time to book another Disney trip at the Peacock Suites and relive the fun times all over again. Until next time! Abdul.

Summary: We stayed here in September 2014 for 3 nights. It was fantastic. Genuine 2 bedrooms - not 1 bedroom and then a bed in the lounge like most. So this was great for 2 couples to stay in. 2 ensuites as well! 2 spas and a pool. BBQs to use. Pool table, vending machines etc. very good in my eyes. Would recommend this place to anyone. The staff were very helpful as well. The only down side was that we had organised a late checkout of 3:00 pm however this must not have been relayed to housekeeping as after 12:00 pm, every 15 minutes someone would knock on the door saying - you check out now? This then defeated the purpose of having a sleep before we went to the airport. However reception did waive the extra fee for the late checkout which made it all good again. Just not rested though!
Manager Response: Dear Luvtravelling1961! I appreciate your positive comments, and we have shared them with our Associates! We welcome you back to Peacock Suites for all your future visits to Anaheim and the area. Yours in Traveling, Abdul.

Summary: My family and I travel to Anaheim at least once a year to go to Disneyland and attend baseball games.  I have stayed at many hotels in the area.  I will never stay here again.  When we arrived, our room was not ready and we had to find something to keep our two kids busy for an hour. On our way out of the lobby, all ready frustrated, we were ambushed by someone trying to sell us a time share.  Not interested.  I was almost offended.  I was a paying customer just staying for a couple of nights, not someone there to listen to a presentation to get something for free. The parking situation was frustrating.  Forced valet when you have kids who leave things in the car and leave multiple times during the day can get a little old.  It always seemed a little disorganized as well.  The
Manager Response: Dear Malinda M! Thank you for sharing your comments with me. Although check-in time begins at 4pm we are always delighted when we can check a guest in before that time, as long as a quality inspected room of the same type that you are booked for is available. However, I thoroughly understand the challenge of keeping the little ones happily occupied after a day of travels. My hope is that you were able to enjoy some of the amenities during the wait, such as the Sun Deck, pool, pool table, foosball, and ping pong. Another recommendation is walking over to the Garden Walk mall down the street for a bite or to explore. With regards to Valet, due to the nature of building, there are fewer parking spaces than units on-site. Having Valet has helped alleviate that by allowing us to accommodate all Guests with cars so they don't have to worry about hunting or vying for limited spaces. Once again, thank you for the feedback, and thank you for being our Guest. Yours in Hospitality, Abdul.

Summary: First off, the pool was LOUD...and echoes everywhere, so get a room far away as possible if you want quiet. Dont buy time share here-but listen to presentation for amusement park tix. Its not even close to the quality resorts Shell normall has. It happens to be close to Dland.  Room had 2 Q then separate living room with a pullout. It was hard with teens to maintain privacy bc the vanity had no door. Kept glass door & curtain drawn bt living room and 2 Q for minimal privacy, but next time, id get 2 rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer M. Thank you for your candid feedback. Although our rooms are not extravagant in size, many of our Guests express similar comments, that they offer better privacy and can accommodate more Guests than a typical hotel room. I look forward to your future visits to our area, and I think you would enjoy our 2-bedroom units quite a bit! Abdul.

Summary: After 21 hours of driving we were happy to arrive at Peacock Suites for our Disneyland adventure. The front desk staff greeted us with a warm welcome and free coupons and discounts for areas in Downtown Disney, only a 15 minute walk away. Our room was very comfortable and clean for 4 adults. The kitchen sink and dishes and mini fridge were a fantastic unexpected addition to our room.  Only negatives was housekeeping came on the 4th night of our 6 day stay. When by the 4th night, we obviously needed more towels and dishes which should have been anticipated. We asked for towels and they were quickly delivered.  All in all, a good stay and highly recommend.
Manager Response: Hi Vanessa S! Thank you for sharing your great feedback about your experience at Peacock Suites. I am thrilled to hear that you had a good time after an exhausting trip. Please come on over and visit us again for your next road trip to Disney Adventures. Yours in Having Fun! Abdul.

Summary: We stayed here the week of August 3rd through August 10th 2014.  Last stay April 2013 and August 2013.  We have no plans to return.  Service reactive as long as I asked for it.  We are with Shell Vacations this is not even close to what I get from other properties. We had two rooms. One was a 2 bedroom suite and the other a 1 bedroom. We expect housekeeping twice a week. They skipped cleaning the 2 bedroom one day. I did advise the front desk who made sure they cleaned it the next day. There was construction going on and we got no advance warning. I had this place booked since November 2013. They have also eliminated there breakfasts and there was no warning there. I have already been asked by 3 separate people who work at my company where to stay in Disneyland.  I would not
Manager Response: Dear WendyFederalWay_WA . Thank you for sharing your input about your stay. As you indicated in your review, it is true that we no longer serve breakfast and housekeeping service is typically scheduled after the 3rd night of your stay. I apologize that your unit did not receive a timely cleaning. Although our property, like most other Shell properties this year, eliminated the breakfast and changed the housekeeping policy, we have instead focused our resources on improving our product. For example, we completed our hallway carpet and wallpaper refurbishment in September, expanded our sun deck in April, and repainted the exterior of the building during the first three months of the year. I warmly invite you to return back since the completion of all our property improvements, and I am confident that you would find the final result a positive impact on your stay. Yours in Hospitality, Abdul.

Summary: This is our 3rd trip here. Each time is better than the last. The 1 bedroom unit is spacious with fridge, microwave, 2 flat screens and 2 DVD players. Every request was accommodated. Vinny checked us in and was very nice and helpful. The swimming pool area has been done over, there is a BBQ area and tables and chairs to eat with a nice pool table and games for the kids.  This place has a nice layback feeling in the middle of a very busy high energy city.  The location, it's down the block from Disneyand and right off of I 5. 7 miles from Knotss Berry Farm, and a short distance from long beach.  Peacock Suites have been renovated and look great.  The only negative is they have mandatory valet parking at $10/ day mandatory. In addition they do not gave a continental breakfast like
Manager Response: Dear ReneeGrandieri! Thank you so much for your wonderful comments. Vinny was very happy to hear your feedback as well. I appreciate that you noticed the positive developments at the Peacock. Although breakfast was discontinued, this has allowed us to focus on continuing to improve the accommodations that we offer our Guests. I am thrilled to hear that you would recommend us, and I would love for Peacock to host you again soon! Yours in Hospitality, Abdul.

Summary: Came here through Shell Vacations.   I've been trying to get clean towels for two days.  The front desk states that housekeeping is a different department and there is nothing they can do?   Really?   I checked in on Tuesday and was told our room would be cleaned on Friday. We were out of the room for 10 hours and came back to nothing being done. Left this afternoon for 5 hours. Requested that our room get done. Came back, nothing done.  Called the desk an hour ago, asked for clean towels. Still nothing.   I've been an owner for 18 years and this is by far, the worst I've ever been to.   I will post to every review place I can find about this place and will be on the phone to Shell next week.
Manager Response: Dear Beth324. I am sorry to hear about the challenges you experienced staying here. This sounds like an unusual breakdown of service that is not typical of what we promise our Owners and Guests. I would truly love to chat with you and find out how I can assist. I strive to make sure that you have a great stay and that is exactly what I want. If you have already checked out, please reach out to me directly at abdelrahman.aboushadi@wyn.com. Thank you kindly Beth324. Abdul.

Summary Heading: Good location and clean room but a few issues with stay
Summary: The location of this hotel is very convenient to Disneyland and the beaches.  It's also within an hour of LA depending on traffic.  The check-in process had a bit of a hard sell for the timeshare breakfast so just be prepared.  We didn't attend the breakfast because we weren't interested in a timeshare and after that the initial enthusiasm of the staff at the desk didn't carry through the rest of our stay.  Also, the regular breakfast that used to be served daily is no longer available and this was disappointing.  The room itself was very clean with comfortable beds.  Just be aware that the housekeeping service comes late in the day sometimes.  Usually rooms at other hotels we've stayed in are cleaned earlier.  If you do come back in the afternoon from your travels your room may
Manager Response: Dear trippin00. Thank you for your thorough and honest feedback. I truly appreciate you sharing some great ideas to continue to improve the Peacock Suites and I will share with my Associates so that we continue to deliver great service. Due to the nature of building, there are fewer parking spaces than units on-site. Having Valet has helped alleviate that by allowing us to accommodate all Guests with cars so they don't have to worry about hunting for spaces. I am glad to hear that the staff greeted you in the hallways and were generally friendly. I invite you to return back to Peacock Suites especially as we complete the hallway renovation in early September. Thank you trippin00! Abdul.

Summary Heading: Well would have liked to have stayed there!!!... but...
Summary: Thousands of miles away from home... little old me from New Zealand... sitting in Chicago on Saturday night... flying to LA the next morning... thought I would ring to confirm our accommodation... which I never do.. They had "lost" my booking and were full.  So I am here with my family and a plane leaving at 9am the next morning and nowhere to stay!  Could not believe the attitude of the three different people I spoke to..  They were polite always said sorry before they told me they couldn't accommodate us.... will never ever stay here again or recommend!
Manager Response: Dear AngelaCalver. I am very sorry to hear about what sounds like an unfortunate booking problem. Please email me directly so that I can find out if there is anything I can do to help. Although you may not need a room at this point, I want to find out what happened and ensure that we learn from this situation and not repeat it again if it was within our control. Thank you kindly. Abdul: abdelrahman.aboushadi@wyn.com.

Summary Heading: It states a three star, but should be a five star! Clean Hotel.
Summary: I am a educator from Northern California. I frequent Disneyland at least four times every year. I have stayed at hotels in Anaheim as well as hotels in the surrounding area for the past 15 years. I have never been met by such friendly professional people, as I did at this hotel. This hotel is data driven. Upon leaving they are collecting data and bringing the feedback to management to ensure your stay is a wonderful experience. Great leadership makes a great hotel. This is a condo-style hotel which does not provide daily housekeeping, but I had access if I needed anything literally within minutes. Everything was organized, extremely clean, and well planned out. I did not once have to call the desk for anything. The room is well stocked and even comes with a flashlight. I read
Manager Response: Dear LaunaBean! You are awesome. I truly appreciate your kind words. We shared your comments with our Team all week and everyone was buzzing with excitement to hear about your wonderful stay. I am happy to hear that you were able to multi-task your mom duties and studying for your Doctorate. My best wishes to you and the family, and I warmly invite you and the family to visit us again soon! Yours in Hospitality, Abdul.

Summary Heading: Didn't think it could get any better and then it did!!!
Summary: I have stayed at the Peacock Suites several times over the years. You can't beat the proximity to Disneyland and the great rooms. Now I even stay when I am visiting family in Huntington Beach, even when are not going to Disneyland. Such is the case with this trip.  There are bbqs on site and the pool has a water fountain/play area in addition to the pool and 2 Jacuzzis which my son loves! The beds (even the sofa beds) are comfortable and the rooms are always clean.There have been so many upgrades since the last visit with the re-designed sun deck now boasting views of the Disneyland fireworks each night, new carpeting and wall paper. But one thing that hasn't changed is the great staff! I was excited to see Karan at the front desk this morning. A friendly face I remember from
Manager Response: Hi jezzyrabit! I loved reading your comments and sharing them with my entire Team. Everyone, especially Karan, were so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites. Honestly, that is why we do what we do. We can't wait until you and the family visit us again for more fun and memorable times! Yours in Service, Abdul.

Summary: First of all, the staff is so well trained that any minor deficiency in your room is quickly and cheerfully remedied. We bought a can of baked beans to serve with dinner and realized we had no can opener. When I mentioned this to the front desk, they promised to send one to the room, which arrived within minutes--an electric no less. The laundry room requires a bunch of quarters, but these were available from the front desk. An absence of a kitchen sink was a real pain, but the staff quickly replaced our dirty dishes with a clean set. The car valets were always willing to bring your car at a moment's notice--well worth the $10 daily charge. Our grand kids loved the Ping pong in the rec area. Mercifully, the swimming pool area was shaded from the hot California sun. All in all,
Manager Response: Dear RotaryChuck! Thank you for your wonderful review. I am glad that our Associates were helpful to you during your stay, and that you enjoyed our covered pool. I look forward to your future visits to the Peacock Suites! Warm Regards, Abdul.

Summary: Simply put, I would stay here for your Disneyland trip.  Great location, only a moderate walk from the park.  Some of the most comfortable beds we've slept in!  The only drawback is the small breakfast room and the lack of adequate laundry facilities--just too small an eating area and too few washers/dryers for a facility this large.  I didn't really like the required valet parking either--much rather park myself.  Also close to great restaurants and the Angels!  Overall, though, we liked it and we plan on booking here again when we return to southern Cali.
Manager Response: Dear 4tiresngas. I really appreciate your comments, and I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed our property. It is true that some of our suites can be more on the small-ish side. However, I hope you found our mini-fridges, toaster, microwave, and coffeemaker helpful during your stay. I look forward to your future visits to Southern Cali at the wonderful Peacock Suites! Yours in Great Times, Abdul.

Summary: First and foremost this place is way close the Disneyland.  Liked being able to come and go.  Had a few issues the first few days.  Reported issues to management (which is new, in fact was the first week for the one I spoke with)  Did everything he could to make up for it.  Even later sent a gift box to our room.  Hotel is clear and save.  I've stead in nicer but again you can walk to Disneyland.  Staff is nice and helpful.  FYI they no longer do breakfast.
Manager Response: Hello Rogich24! I am happy to hear that you had a good stay at the Peacock Suites. Our goal is to provide World-Class service to our Guests because we take pride in what we do. I invite you to return back to the 'Peacock' for more Disney adventures soon. Hope to see you around! Abdul.

Summary Heading: They are doing a good jub upgrading
Summary: Have been here a few times. This definitely not one of their more lavish properties, but the convenience of getting to and from Disneyland is amazing and it is so nice to have some sort of a fridge and kitchen area.  The beds are comfortable and it is clean.  They are in the midst of upgrading and have a few issues with the cleaning staff but the manager of the hotel was awesome and said they are fixing the problems.  I would stay here again and hope that they fix their staff problems.
Manager Response: Hi MEK-21! I want to thank you for staying with us at our property. Your feedback means a lot to me and to my team and we will continue to strive to deliver a great property at a great value to all our Guests. Abdul.

Summary Heading: Good place to crash, not much more
Summary: The good:  Once inside the room, it is great.  Clean, comfy beds, nice decor.  There is  a hidden sun deck on the roof that was awesome - we had coffee up there every morning.  It's an easy drive to the Disneyland parking structure.  The hallways were sketchy - they are renovating the halls, so there were construction workers and tarps all over.  The bad:  The mandatory valet parking stinks.  It's $10/night - even if you don't have a car.  They scratched the bumper of our rental car.  The "pool" is really small and awkward - stuck in an old parking structure - no sun.  However, there is a fun gaming place next to the pool with a pool table, ping pong, and 2 BBQs for guests to use.  Both were in high demand.  Overall, this place is decent if you can get a good rate and just need
Manager Response: Dear Cleander. Thank you for sharing your feedback with me. Please feel free to reach out to me at 714-535-8255 as I would like to ensure that we have discussed any incident with the vehicle. I hope that you give us another opportunity in the future for your visits to Anaheim. Yours in Hospitality, Abdul - Resort Manager.

Summary Heading: Nice resort! Needs a few minor adjustments
Summary: First off...the parking arrangements are a disaster just waiting to happen. Way too many people coming and going all day and night...too crowded are the parking areas...definitely not enough space for parking and to top it off they charge 10 per day mandatory for valet parking. NO (you can not park your own car) at this Resort . Would love to see better parking facilities in the future. Then  upon heading up to our room , seen that the hotel was under construction inside and  the place looked very shabby!. But.....Can't wait to see  all the new improvements when we come back again. And  my final concern was the  huge lack of communication during our stay with housekeeping.   But Manager on site Abdul quickly rectified the issues and took Care of our concerns quickly and with
Manager Response: Dear Hesaves. Thank you for your candid feedback. I am glad to hear that you are excited to see the finished product at the Peacock Suites, and so are we! We will probably be done with renovations in early September. I look forward to your future visits to the wonderful Peacock Suites.

Summary: a few blocks from Disneyland - easy walk.  ART bus (with purchase of a pass) picks you up right in front.  SUPER clean hotel, friendly staff, good continental breakfast, nice room.  Pool is a bit on the smallish side (not for laps/ swimming) but the kids loved to play in it.  lots of deck chairs to lounge on.  pop and snack machines along with a BBQ area, fooseball table and group seating.  our room had a great kitchenette, mini fridge, microwave, huge sink, all utensils and basic kitchen stuff.  2 large TV's (one in the master suite) comfy bed, pull out couch was just fine for the kiddo!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your experience at the Peacock Suites. I'm happy to know that you and your family had a great time staying with us while embarking on a Disney adventure! I invite you to come back and stay with us the next time your plan on visiting Anaheim again.

Summary Heading: Great time at the Peacock Suites
Summary: First thing I want to say is the staff at the Peacock Suites are top-notch.  Everyone we came in contact with was so friendly and helpful: front desk, housekeeping, bell staff, concierge, valet.  They offer a limited grocery delivery, but my husband has celiac and must eat gluten free, so there really wasn't anything for him on the list.  I called the Peacock Suites and inquired about other stores that might deliver.  They gave me some names and said they could put the groceries away for us if they arrived before we did.  We placed the order and called and told them the timeframe in which it would arrive (4-8pm).  When we arrived at 1am, the food was all store for us, refrigerated items in the fridge, the rest on the counter.  It was so wonderful to have it done for us.  We
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying at the Peacock Suites. I thoroughly enjoyed your wonderful comments, and I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I will make sure to share your positive feedback with my Team and I know they will be very excited to hear it too! I look forward to your future visits at the Peacock Suites.

Summary: Overall it was good.  1.2 mile walk to Disneygates or a 5 minute bus ride - that comes every 20 minutes.  $5 a day for an adult, $2 for children. $10 a day for valet parking.  They discontinued their breakfast service a couple days before we arrived.  Very dissapointed but was already booked.  Target is about 5 minute drive away to get some groceries if needed.  Room has microwave, bar fridge, toaster and small counter. Had a 2 Q on bedroom room.  The Q beds were comfy - firm but not too hard.  Bedroom is at back of room.  Away from the hallways.  Has sliding door with frosted glass between the rooms - doesn't block enough light from the living area.  Door is very noisy to open and close descretely. Living area has a sofa bed - not a traditional spring matress. We had an adult
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your very detailed review. I truly appreciate your honest feedback and it will help us continually provide the level of service that we aim for inside our units and at the desk. I invite you and your family to visit us again next time you visit Anaheim!

Summary Heading: room was not what was expected
Summary: My room description was a king accessible, I was assured that it was a king size bed, when I got there, it was a queen. It was a very comfortable bed, but you could hear the people walking around upstairs, or doing jumping jacks at all hours. Shower was great, but no where to put your things, they had one of the older sinks with no counterspace space for toiletries. They give you coffee, but charge extra if you want more than one for 4 days. Really not impressed with the check in staff, concierge and bellman were very helpful and friendly though. May go back because I am a timeshare owner, but will definitely get the bigger room. Oh yea, booked thinking they had breakfast 2 weeks before we went they called and had discontinued it. :-(
Manager Response: Dear Marcie, Thank you for your feedback. We will continue to focus our efforts on delivering exceptional service to all our Guests. I invite you to return back to the Peacock Suites on your next visit to Anaheim and we will strive to deliver a relaxing and enjoyable stay to you and your party.

Summary: Just a few city blocks away from Disneyland. ATA shuttle picks up right in front and only has 2 other stops before it takes you to Disneyland. Peacock is the 1st stop when you return from Disneyland. Purchase your ATA pass right at kiosk near the lobby. No full kitchen - so if you plan on preparing meals, be prepared to use a microwave. We didn't even have a sink in the kitchen area, we had to rinse the dishes in the bathroom. They offer a free carb breakfast (powdered donuts, frozen waffles, cereal, toast). Staff is friendly. Mandatory Valet Parking - daily rate of $10 plus tax - whether you have a vehicle or not. Parking attendants were quick and courteous. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Good water pressure in the shower. Free internet. Make sure to visit the gift shop on
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed review! I truly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience and I'm very happy that you found the Peacock Suites convenient for your Disney adventures. My team and I look forward to your future visits with us.

Summary: This is the to stay if you "LOVE" Disneyland.  Peacock Suites has an awesome staff to help in way they can.  The rooms are laid out very efficiently, with a table for four, a couch with a big flat screen, and a roomy bedroom that is separate from the front room.  All the amenities that you expect and too close to Disneyland.  What puts this place over the top is the STAFF!  We got first class service from the them, they helped out with Mom. Being handicapped isn't easy and they jumped in when needed.  She uses a walker, when she had trouble with some baggage the maid jumped in and helped out.  Never expected that one.  The whole staff is on board not just a few of them, like the big name hotels out there.  When you stay here, you can't help having a great time.  You got to stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review. Our team members are truly what makes the Peacock Suites a memorable place for our Guests. I am happy to hear about your experience, and I look forward to many more visits by you and your family.

Summary: The Peacock Suites was the perfect location for our Family Disney Adventure.  We traveled there on Spring Break (a very busy time), but it was well worth it.  The shuttle directly to the Disney gates was a definite benefit, especially with a 2 and 5 year old that still take naps in the middle of the day.  We were able to catch the shuttle back to the hotel for their naps and head back into the park afterwards.  The breakfast was a bonus...I wasn't expecting it, but it was nice.  The fact that there was a fridge and microwave made it easier to pack snacks for the park and even take home some leftovers from the restaurant.  The accommodations were clean and spacious, and it was nice to have separate sleeping quarters from the living area/kitchen...so while the kids napped, I was
Manager Response: I really appreciate your review. Thank you for choosing the Peacock Suites for your Disney adventure. I am glad that our location was convenient and met your needs as a comfortable spring board for your family! I would love to welcome you again at the Peacock Suites in your future travels to Disney.

Summary: Peacock Suites are a great place to stay at a very economical price.  The rooms are decent size and well-appointed.  It is just blocks from Disneyland and from I-5.  Rooms are modern, the place is clean and the prices cannot be beat.  We had a suite-room, where a bedroom was separated by sliding doors from a kitchenette and a sofa that turned into a bed.  Normally sofa beds are not that comfortable, but the mattress on this one was great.  So it is good, if you are traveling with kids.  They have a pool which is outdoors, but surrounded by walls on 3 sides.  It is in a nice area, and provides easy access to Disneyland, I-5 and the A's stadium.  You could spend a lot more and not get what we had at Peacock suites.  The only comment I would have to improve things is that the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us at the Peacock Suites. We pride ourselves in providing our Guests with a comfortable and convenient destination for your family.
