I invite you to make the Peacock Suites your choice for future accommodations on your next Disney adventure!

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased with our stay.  The hotel room was nicely appointed and had everything we needed. The 4 seat table was a nice touch and it was nice to have enough electrical outlets for our devices. The beds were comfortable and our 5 year old was excited to sleep on the fold out sofa and have her "own" TV in her "room".  Had we not been there solely for the purpose of going to DLand we would have enjoyed a fuller kitchen like many of the other timeshare properties we have visited, but this suited our needs perfectly.   The continental breakfast was perfect to get the day going.  A quick and FREE way to feed the family before heading out to the crowds and the excitement.  Valet was quick and easy and we opted to brave the 5 minute drive and pay to
Manager Response: I appreciate your feedback about the Peacocks Suites. I am very happy to hear that the room was comfortable and provided your family with a relaxing destination to explore Disneyland. I invite you to return back for all your future adventures!

Summary: We had a 1 bedroom that includes a king size bed that is partitioned from the living room.  Everything is compact, but we had 2 big flat screen televisions! They only have a microwave oven and a small refrigerator, but we took advantage of the 2 BBQ grills down by the pool area.  The front desk even provided all the utensils we needed to cook our food.  If you are going to Disneyland, this is an excellent location.  But it is a very long drive up to LA downtown and Hollywood.  I-5 construction makes it a very poor option for travelling, so look for alternates.  They do have a breakfast room, but it's all carbs except for the hard boiled eggs.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing! We appreciate your time and feedback and we hope to have you and your family stay wth us again in the future!

Summary: Peacock Suites arrival 1230pm. Lisa, Miriam, Adam, Caesar  Staff was found to be very polite, helpful and accommodating.  Construction is completed. Yeah!!! There is still some repainting of the external common areas.  The rooms are exactly as they are presented on the website. The room to which we were assigned was ready when we got there and we were able to check in early. Great! However, this was not the room we requested and paid for. I immediately called the desk. Miriam immediately apologized and stated that our room would not be ready until 4 pm which is regular check in time. We brought our bags back to the lobby where they were tagged and stored for us. She told us that the housekeeper was at lunch and she will check the status of our room and update us after she
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent experience at our resort. We are happy to hear you had such a great vacation experience and we will be sure to share your positive feedback with our staff!  We hope to see you again soon and thank you again!

Summary Heading: A thank you to all staff
Summary: I have been to this Hotel several times and I had always a great experience, I and my girlfriend who is from Brazil enjoyed the stay not to mention at one point we stayed a whole month and everyday we had such a wonderful  service specially from the front desk staff. We like to thank Rashanda , Tina and Karan all managers staff were amazing and we appreciate all the great service and hospitality.  Ligia & George
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreiciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites! Ligia and George, your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and we will definitely share your review with the staff!

Summary Heading: Great staff, great room, a few issues
Summary: Let me begin by saying that I was very impressed by the staff on this visit. First, they allowed us to check in almost six hours early when our flight got in at 9 AM (their normal check-in isn't until 4 PM), which was absolutely wonderful. Even better, they left a beautiful "bouquet" of balloons, activities, and a special signed card for my daughters welcoming them to the hotel and to Disneyland (I had corresponded with one of the managers via email about needing a crib and a top-floor room ahead of time, so he knew the ages and genders of my children). That was a wow moment, and above and beyond, no doubt about it. All of the staff members I spoke with, from the front desk to the supervisors to the night auditor (more on that later) to the concierge to the valets were
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments and for giving an honest review. Feedback these days is priceless and without it we cannot continue to grow and get better at what we do. I wanted to apologize for the billing issue you experienced during your stay. I do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future so we may show you the service in which we are known for!

Summary: We booked this hotel though Hotwire (therefore as a "secret" hotel) and were afraid after we read the reviews in TripAdvisor. Thankfully, Peacock Suites turned out to be a great option for us, a family with a toddler going to Disneyland. The parks are nearby, and the (municipality) shuttle service is excellent, right in front of the hotel. The renovation works at the hotel seemed to be over. Our room was new, clean and well appointed (too bad there was only a microwave, not a cooktop). Breakfast was kind of depressing, with sugary/industrialized items in a very plain room. Parking was paid. Overall, the hotel was a bargain and, despite having no charm, suited our needs.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to complete a Trip Advisor review.  We are happy to hear that overall you enjoyed your stay.  I hope that although you did not enjoy the breakfast selection we provided, you would give us another chance and visit us again.

Summary: We were really surprised at how nice our room was.  Even the studio couch had a great mattress on it.  The breakfast is definitely continental but it is adequate.   Our grandson used the pool and had a great time.  Parking is by valet at $10 a day.  All in all it was a good experience.
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreiciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites!  Your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us! Please visit us again soon!

Summary: Helpful staff and receptive toward our needs. One problem is we could not exchange rooms after finding out the room was too small for four adults.  When asked if we could was told no because all rooms are booked. The moral of the story is do not have a room that sleeps four people only too small. Go for the six person for more room!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond on TripAdvisor.  We appreciate any and all comments.  This will allow us to continue to enhance the vacation experience at our resort. Please let us know if there are opportunities to make your stay better in the future.

Summary Heading: Great for Disneyland with lots of kids
Summary: We have stayed here 4 times over the last year, we get a sweet deal through sun or snow vacations, maybe sun and snow? Anyway about 80 a night, fantastic deal for a room that sleeps up to 8. We stayed in each of the room types and for us the Murphy bed suite is best, we have 5 kids. But for less kids request the rooms with separate bedroom with door for more privacy and quiet. It feels more like a suite and more spacious even though it's actually smaller than the long galley style two bedroom room.   The staff is amazing! Honestly! They remember us between visits, give prizes to my kids for daily activities, help out with 2am vomiting! Provide balloons and a gift upon arrival if you tell them it's a special occasion, birthday etc.  The art bus works well for Disney, the number
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!  We are so happy to hear that you had such a nice visit and that our staff was high on your list of what you enjoyed while you were here!  We hope you will consider staying with us again on any future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: I stayed at this hotel so that I can attend a seminar at the Anaheim Convention Center from March 22nd to 24th.  The room was very well furnished with a separate living room from the bedroom.  The room and bathroom were very clean and well maintained.  Having a microwave and small refrigerator to store drinks came in handy.  I have to agree with other reviewers that the rooms were not very sound proofed as I would have liked; but, was fine for the most part.  The hotel location is very convenient to a nearby 7-11 store which is about half a block away, restaurants, and a movie theater.  The staff at the front desk and the housekeeping were very friendly and helpful.  The continental breakfast is pretty limited to bagels, cereal, hard boil eggs, toast, yogurt, orange juice and
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites! Our staff looks forward to any and all comments regarding the property and especially our service.  Your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!

Summary Heading: We liked it enough to stay 31 nights!
Summary: Over the past year we have stayed here a total of approximately 31 nights, all Disneyland related. A week in May of 2013, 2 weeks in August 2013, and we just finished a 10 night stay in March-April 2014.  We keep staying here because the room occupancy is 6 and we have several kids. For the price it's a pretty good value. I think next time we may try one of their bigger rooms just for more space.  We use the ART to get back and forth to the park. We get the ART passes ahead of time, usually at a discount through Getawaytoday.com (sometimes they offer free kids ART passes with adult ART pass purchase). I have tried walking, it's a bit far after a long day at the park. I have also driven ourselves but it seemed to me to be much more of a hassle to pack everyone into our van just
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for taking the time to give such a thorough review regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites!  Sharing your thoughts on all of our amenities and property, is greatly appreciated.  I will forward your comments to each of the deparments so that we can try and work on the areas in need of improvement.  We thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you stay with us again sometime in the future!!!

Summary Heading: A good choice for your Disney vacation
Summary: We have stayed here twice in the last two years for our annual week long trips to Disneyland and would come back again.  The valet parking is efficient and professional.  The pool and 2 hot tubs are clean.  Overall the property is well maintained and the rooms we stayed in were newly renovated.  The beds are comfortable and having 2 adjoining suites for our 2 families was enough space for 5 of us.  It made for a really nice place to relax after walking endlessly through the parks.  Breakfast is sparse (bagels, frozen waffles, cereal) and we bring our own food to supplement.  Conveniently, there is a fridge, toaster, microwave and coffee maker in your room.  Your room is cleaned only occasionally during a week long stay.  This is a family hotel and it can be loud in the pool
Manager Response: Thank you for posting a review!  We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your vacation experience with us!  We do appreciate the feedback and will pass this along to our associates.  Thank you again!

Summary: I felt the need to review this hotel because I was worried to stay here with all the bad reviews I read! Firstly, people would be much better off to do some reading on the hotel website before booking and staying somewhere, all the problems of 'no self parking!' And 'no cleaning service!' Are stated right on the website, so that's not the hotel's fault it's the people who book and stay there seemingly without any research on the hotel at all which I find strange, I never stay somewhere without reading up on it first. Anyways, yes there is no cleaning service unless you stay four nights or more because it is a timeshare hotel. We don't care about that because we never have housekeeping come to any of the rooms when we stay anywhere, call me paranoid but I'd rather have an undone
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review.  We will share these with our staff!  We also appreciate your tips for other guests who might want to book with us here at the Peacock Suites.  Again, thank you for reaching out and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: First, the staff was very friendly.  I would rate them as 5 stars.  The facility has missed what I would classify as core competencies.  My room was not serviced during my stay.  This is typically not a big deal since I re-use my towels, etc.  But, it is nice to come back to my room with a freshly made bed, trash taken out, etc.  I was also frustrated that the vending machines on 3 of the floors was "sold out."  Again, not a horrible offence, but it is nice to have the ability to purchase a soda when you want one.  My biggest frustration was the reservation process.  I took the reservation of a colleague who could not travel.  My stay was 2 days shorter than the original reservation.  I called the day before my arrival to change the reservation.  I was told to notify the front
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We will be making some changes to our in house processes for reservation changes to ensure that all guest changes and requests are immediately handled. With your feedback we can continue to enhance the guest experience. Thank you for guiding us on what needs improving.

Summary: I recently stayed there with my daughter and 3 grandchildren.  What I did like was  the room was nicely decorated, it had 2 tv's and 2 DVD players and the beds were very comfortable.  Also the staff was very friendly.  Now my dislikes.   I was unhappy with the pillows they were hard.   The walls are very thin.  We heard all the conversations in the room next to us and in the hallway.  And let's not forget about the alarm clock that went off in the room on the other side of us, we had to call the front desk at 1am to go turn it off.  My biggest complaint was no maid service!  I love coming back to the room and my bed being maid and the garbage emptied and towels replaced.  Luckily the maids were easily found cleaning the rooms of people checking out so I could empty our garbage
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review, we appreciate the time you have taken to offer your honest feedback regarding your recent visit. As a timeshare resort we offer maid service only after your 3rd night with us, this is also part of our ongoing effort to reduce our carbon footprint. However if new towels or trash pickup are needed we are always here to help with that and make your stay a positive memorable experience. We apologize this was an inconvenience and hope to see you and your family again on future visits to Anaheim.

Summary: HHhhhhmmmmm......I kinda confused on some of these reviews...I think we are talking about the same place. Peacock Suites in Anaheim?  Anyways,  I will talk about our stay.  I knew before we went that there was a little construction going on so I asked to have a room as far away from the construction as possible and they accommodated us completely. Before we arrived, I had asked if I could have a couple of things delivered to the Hotel before we got there and they had no problem at all, and they had my 3 packages waiting for me when we arrived. We arrived quite late and my little ones were hungry but everything in the hotel was closed.  When I called the front desk and asked if there was anything around, the extremely nice girl at the desk asked what I was looking for and I said
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words regarding your visit with us! It is our number one priority to have all of our guests leave with a positive impression and a lasting memory of their time at Peacock Suites. We pride ourselves on service and it is exciting to see that our team was able to create a wonderful moment for you and your family! We look forward to seeing you on your next visit and thank you again for your posting.

Summary: The staff at Peacock suites was outstanding and the whole place is very clean.  Disney was a 20 minute walk through a little bit of a sketchy area.  The breakfast area was above average with cereal, doughnuts, yogurt, toast, bagels, fruit, juice and coffee.  However, the room we were in, after asking for a quiet room, was the loudest room we've ever stayed in.  We are timeshare owners and have traded to many places and we stay in hotels often when not using our timeshare units but have never dealt with so much noise.  The street noise is awful with nonstop horns, police sirens, screeching tires and cars accelerating trying to make the nearby traffic light.  There would be no sound difference if we had slept on a cot in the highway median.  We had a room with a large, floor to
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, noise from other guests is sometimes out of our control, but none the less we will do everything we can to make sure everyone who stays at the hotel adheres to our posted quiet times. We apologize for your experience and look forward to hosting you and your family on your return visit to Anaheim. Thank you.

Summary Heading: I can't believe these reviews either
Summary: The one bedroom room is simple a Comfort Inn with a partition to create a bedroom and added a sink, refrigerator, and microwave along the wall.  Beds are average comfort and the pillow are horrible.  The room had an adjoining door to open to make into a suite.  That door is not well insulated and the person in the other room kept there TV on all night.  I asked customer service to ask them to lower the TV between 2AM and 6AM.  Nothing happened.  I have never had a problem with adjoining door letting in noise as clear as if the door was open.  Consequently, no real sleep.  I asked again but again nothing happened.  The room had been recently remodeled so it was clean.  The floor pattern was crazy weird.  The hall door opened between the vanity and the shower/toilet area.  So if
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, noise from other guests is sometimes out of our control, but none the less we will do everything we can to make sure everyone who stays at the hotel adheres to our posted quiet times. We apologize for your experience and look forward to hosting you and your family on your return visit to Anaheim. Thank you.

Summary: I should start by saying that I should be more upset that Hotwire had this place rated as the 3 star hotel with...95% customer recommended!  Unreal. Can't believe that TripAdvisor has it rated so high either.  In fact, I can't understand ANYONE recommending this place after what I just witnessed with my own eyes (AND EARS).  Based on the rates I wasn't expecting this place to be on the same level as Embassy Suites, but DAAAANG!!!  It took the word "suite" to a new low.  I will break this place down for both the experience with customer service, hotel amenities, and then the rooms.  Customer Service - Nothing bad to complain about here.  They all were friendly, helpful and efficient.  Enough said on that, because that's were the experience takes a nose dive.  Rooms - This has to
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback, it is our goal to exceed our guest’s expectations and continue to provide a wonderful vacation. I want to offer my deepest apologies for your experiences with us on your most recent trip to Anaheim. Although several of the comments were geared toward the building and design layout, i will meet with my team to address any areas we feel we could have improved. Thank you again for your comments and hopefully we will have a chance to provide you with amazing service as we have been noted!

Summary: My wife and I stayed at Peacock Suites from February 7 to February 14. From the moment we checked in, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful in every way. Initially, I was annoyed about paying $10 a day for valet parking, but at the end of my stay I was glad that they also did a fabulous job! Everyone we met made our stay special, but I must single out three people in particular that made my trip memorable. Stephanie at the front desk was awesome! I spoke to her before I left for California and it was a joy to meet her in person! Caesar, the bellman, showed great concern and compassion when my wife had an accident in the room, and he made both of us feel so much better. Finally, Rochanda, the guest services supervisor, made me feel like a head of state! She even gave me a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing the Peacock Suites for your recent stay in Anaheim AND for taking the time to put your comments about that stay in writing! We have forwarded your comments to the individuals you have mentioned, and have made sure to recognize them for the outstanding service they provided.  We appreciate all you had to say and are so glad to hear that you would return to see us again on your next trip to Anaheim!!!

Summary: An amazing time was had by all! Myself, husband, 2 children ages 2 and 6 months and mother in law, to be exact. We booked a 2 queen suite and it was perfect. The 2 beds were separate from the living area and a pull out bed was provided. We didn't need anything fancy since we were to spend most of our time at Disney but the accommodations were very nice. My number 1 priority is cleanliness and I was pleased. The beds were freshly made with clean sheets, tub an toilet were scrubbed clean and the kitchen area was spotless. The housekeeping staff were in their job! My number 2 priority is service and we all were pleased. We were in a rush to check in since the kids were restless and they provided small toys for them to keep occupied. Major kudos! The location is very close. If we
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites! Your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!

Summary: Me an my family have been staying at here for past 10 years.we love this hotel! An the staff is very friendly.the only bad thing I would say is u have to pay 10 dollars a day for parking other wise this is amazing place to stay with your  family an loved ones !♡♡♡
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to hear that you really enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites earlier this month! Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments in writing!!!

Summary: I am currently saying at the hotel. I don't usually write reviews but I always read them when deciding on where to stay. Due to travelling a lot I am a hotel snob and have extremely high standards, mostly when it comes cleanliness. The hotel is newly renovated, modern and most importantly very clean. Staff all seem very friendly, valet service is quick and efficient and breakfast is a high standard continental. Overall I'd rate this hotel 4 stars, perfect for families.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing! We appreciate your time and feedback and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  Thank you again for your thoughts and we look forward to having you come and stay wth us again in the future!

Summary: I travel quite a bit for work, but this trip was for some quality one on one time with my son. Travelling alone with a toddler is never easy, but the Peacock Suites staff was incredible! From the moment I arrive, all of the staff was offering helping hands. The Valet staff was friendly, holding open the doors for me to the lobby and Karan at the front desk was knowledgeable and friendly both checking in and out. The manger even gave my son a Mickey Mouse puzzle and took a picture of my son and I together! When I arrived at the room, I was shocked. It looked just like the pictures (which is rarely the case anymore). The room was spacious, clean, and beautifully decorated. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. What's more, my son loved the pool, 2 jacuzzis and the water
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit to the Peacock Suites! Thank you for your comments about the room and especially about our staff! We are always thrilled to hear good things about all of our staff members and they do get passed on so that everyone knows they have been recognized!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you stay with us again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice little hotel close to Disney and all you need
Summary: They were undergoing renovations during our stay so the rooftop patio wasn't open. They made sure that the renos did not affect our stay which was nice. The garden walk with tons of restaurants and shops is right around the corner and the shuttle bus to Disney right out front so all in all good place to stay for our first Disney trip!
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites!  Your comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I and my son and his girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights from Jan. 21 to Jan. 24, 2014. Rather than get a 2 bedroom suite, we were offered two one bedroom suites that gave each party some privacy. I requested suites that were next to each other and the hotel accommodated my request.  We stayed in suites 227 and 228. Even though both suites were one bedroom and next to each other, their floor plans were very different and nice. But both suites were recently remodeled, very clean, and had the same basic amenities. The beds very extremely comfortable is you like firm beds. Both the bedroom and the living area each had new 40" flat screen televisions.   First let me say that this hotel is a perfect place to stay for people with small children and on a budget. It was
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Peacock Suites for your trip to Disneyland.  We are please to hear that you enjoyed your stay.  Thank you for posting a Trip Advisor review, and we look forward to seeing your family again when your travels bringy ou back to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Enjoyable Stay But a Little Far from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last May when we went back to Disneyland.  This hotel has recently been renovated so it has a boutique feel to it which was nice.  We were looking for a hotel room that offered a suite so we could put our son down earlier at night.  Unfortunately this wasn't really what we had in mind.  Yes, there was a separate sleeping area but it was separated with just a sliding French door which unfortunately didn't slide so easily.  The placement of the bathroom and kitchenette was off as well.  You had to go through the area with the beds to use the bathroom.  The area with the two queen beds was beside the suite entrance.  So not what we had in mind, but we were so tired most nights it didn't matter much anyway.  The continental breakfast room was pretty limited
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time to complete a review.  We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the amenities we offer here at the Peacock Suites.  Thank you for reaching out and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I just read a review on the Peacock Suites titled "Currently under Renovation - Think Twice".  This very well written review reflects out experiences very closely so there isn't much point in me repeating it...to summarise - the hotel is under renovation - there is lots of scaffolding and plywood walls etc and it is hard to find reception, however the noise from the renovations was minimal. - the breakfast was terrible and didn't change in the week we were there - we brought our own after the first couple of days.  Even under renovation they could offer some better cereals and some bagels and muffins to toast without too much difficulty. - the pool had a very strong chlorine smell - we didn't notice any bleaching but I wouldn't be surprised. - the rooms were nice and renovated
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  We understand that the scaffolding and plywood can be an eyesore for our guests, however, we are happy to announce that they have been removed!  We are in the final stages of our renovation and hope that you will be able to enjoy the property after its completion on your next trip to Anaheim!

Summary: First of all, I want to say that we booked the Peacock Suites as a value-priced hotel and I am reviewing it with this in mind. However, we did not know when we booked our vacation a couple of months earlier that it was under renovation.   I had read some recent reviews prior to leaving complaining but as always with reviews we came with an open mind. We travel frequently and have a wide range of expectations given the prices we are paying at each property, and our expectations were not super high for the Peacock - we were expecting larger rooms, further from the park, and good value.   I will start with the positive: The check in was quick, the room was clean, the decor was modern (our room I believe was one that had been recently refurbished). It is the first shuttle stop. It
Manager Response: none

Summary: PROS:  This is our third stay at the Peacock Suites,, It's an inviting place  to stay .. rooms our awesome compared to other neighboring hotels even with the  ongoing remodel  , valet parking is also a plus the guys are great and friendly ,nice way to send Christmas with your family , gift shop , laundry and gym was a plus as well ..however due to the remodeling the breakfast is moved to the outside area by the east of the pool side..  CONS : would appreciate a larger variety at breakfast No Santa Claus this time
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the positive review!  We are always happy to hear that our guests return year after year to the Peacock Suites.  We are definitely looking forward to having our breakfast served in our newly renovated breakfast room in March and are looking at different options for our menu.  Thank you again for your time, and we hope to see you next year!

Summary: Will return again, rooms are clean, staffs were pleasant, and although they were remodeling at the time, it was never an inconvinience for us! Loved that there was a sliding door from the bedroom to the living area. We didn't even hear the usual doors slamming at 5 or 6 in the morning. We had three active little boys with us (6, 4 and 2) and felt we had enough space. Will definately return and will alway recommend it to friends and families! Can't wait to return and see how the remodel will look like!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review on Trip Advisor for the Peacock Suites. We have passed on your positive reviews to the staff and are happy to hear that you will return to visit us again after the renovations are complete.  We hope to see you soon!

Summary: I have stayed at the Peacock before but definitely had a different experience. First there were absolutely no choices for kids on the TV. You can purchase a movie but there was no Disney or Nick. We had scaffolding on our window so there was no option to open the curtains. The biggest thing is THEY DO NOT CLEAN THE ROOMS. Nowhere on the web site or Hotels.com did it say this. We were told on our last night that the rooms are cleaned every 4th night.  No clean towels or sheets.  They also give one thin blanket on the bed, no comforter or bed spread.I called and asked for a couple more pillows (there are none provided for the pull out bed.) The front desk person asked me how many. I said a couple and she said she needed to know many I needed.....uh 2. Then there is the parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a Trip Advisor review.  I am sorry to hear that your  experience was not the "great vacation" we strive to give all our guests.  As you have stayed with us before, I am sure you are aware that we did make some changes on our cable lineup, and with the large amount of channels, it may have just been difficult to find, but we have many channels geared towards children, including; ABC Family, Cartoon Network, Nickelodeon, and Starz Kids & Family.        We do have a different cleaning schedule than most hotels, however we are a timeshare property, and we always try our best to accomodate any requests from our valued guests.        As for the valet parking, due to the limited space available and the safety of our guests and their vehicles, valet parking is our only option.  Thank you again for your honest review.

Summary: I am a long time Disney lover and have been to many hotels/motels around the resort.  Having a family of 5, it becomes a challenge as they get older to find a room with enough space and still be close enough to the park to allow us to get back to the room quickly for a break.  This was our first visit, and though they were renovating the outside of the hotel when we stayed there, we still really enjoyed our stay.  The staff was very friendly.  The Anaheim shuttle stop is right in front of the hotel and the first stop back from the park.  The breakfast was not that great because of the remodel they were doing, having outside in their outdoor common/bbq area, but the room was large enough for us and close to other restaurants.  Once the construction is done, we plan to possible
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback!  It sounds as though the layout of our spacious suites was a great fit for your getaway.  We look forward to seeing and your family again in the future.

Summary: This was our second year to stay at The Peacock Suites in Anaheim. We take an annual family trip to Disneyland and have found paradise at this hotel! They have it all; friendly and efficient customer service, clean and comfortable accommodations, a fabulous free breakfast and a shuttle to the park!  Peacock Suites will continue to be a part of our annual trip.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review of the Peacock Suites!  We are happy that we were able to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. We look forward to having you stay with us again!

Summary: Peacock Suites in Anaheim is weird.  It's under construction, so they do the best for safety reasons, but even then, it's still weird. For one thing, there isn't a sign anywhere on the building, on the street, or anywhere indicating where it is. We drove around the block twice to find it. And armed with a GPS, smartphone with a GPS, and a tablet with GPS, we had a hard time locating it. Put a sign out front ya'll!  The lobby is small, but nice. Check in went smooth. Everyone is very nice. Valet is nice, fast, and friendly.  Pool is weird. Breakfast area was weird. Room was nice but weird.  Noise. Everyone talks about it and rightfully so. Tiled entryway and desk area. Here's the thing, it's a pretty brilliant layout, except they put the noisiest furniture right on the tile. All
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to complete a Trip Advisor review for our property.  We pride ourselves on the service we provide for our guests and will pass on the kind comments to our team.  Due to the construction, our breakfast has been moved but after the renovation is complete, we hope that all of our guests will be able to enjoy a newly renovated and expanded Breakfast Room!  Thank you again for staying with us, if you are in the Anaheim area again, we would love to have a second chance to impress!

Summary: I sent my daughter and husband this last week (12/3 - 5) with their children to this hotel.  The room was fine but the hotel was very noisy (elevator, ice machines, people in halls at 2am etc.)  They couldn't  use the pool because it was blocked for construction.  They stayed under our time share plan but if they hadn't, I would want a refund.  Might want to look elsewhere.
Manager Response: We are disappointed to hear that your family's experience was not a positive one. While we are disappointed to hear that you felt your stay was only mediocre, we appreciate your comments.

Summary: My family of four (2 adults and 2 teens, ages 16 & 17) stayed here two nights on 11/17 and 11/18 of 2013.  I am a Shell Vacation member and used my points for this place (only reason I chose this property). It is true that this property is under construction, but in my opinion here are the negatives despite construction:  Service was mediocre, Front Desk staff seemed uninterested in their customers. Location was not very good for Disneyland.  It is a long walk, even for individuals that can walk 3 miles briskly and easily.  You can purchase an ART Shuttle pass but that was $20/day for us.  Parking is valet only and charges daily.  I will say that our room was good, beds were comfortable and although we didn't use it, the room was equipped with a nice kitchenette and dining
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback.  We apologize that your expectations were not met.  Your comments have been forwarded to the Guest Service team. Going forward, we hope that we can continue to strive for the highest customer service standards and give our guests a memorable vacation.  Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Rooms are very nice, but location not so much...
Summary: We usually stay right across the street from Disneyland so unfortunately for us the shuttle/parking at Disneyland took away from enjoying more time at the park and you don't have the convenience of heading back to your hotel for a break.  The rooms are beautiful newly remodeled with a great layout, pool/hot tubs are nice with a ping pong table our kids enjoyed.  The breakfast menu changed the day we arrived due to the breakfast room location moving and it was awful (packaged pastries/juice).  However, the room has basic utensils/toaster/microwave so we headed to Vons up the street and picked up our own breakfast items.  The construction going on isn't annoying but between that and valet it isn't pretty.  My recommendation is if you don't mind shuttling to the parks then stay
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some information regarding the current on-site construction. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the newly remodeled units and your kids enjoyed the pool and ping pong table. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We had 2 nights comp'ed to us. So we used them on Nov 3rd and 4th. When we checked in and got into our room we were totally taken back. It was beautiful.  We had a king suite and it was very nicely laid out. We had windows and it was great. I love light. The bedroom was very nice and we had plenty of room to unpack and hang everything up. I loved having an inroom safe. The bathroom had a jacuzzi tub and it was deep. Loved the shower head. All the staff that we encounted, i.e. car valet, front desk, maids, ect. were fantastic. They had great customer service.  The breakfast was just ok. But it filled you up. The room had plently of tables and we did not have a large crowd in there. Could be because we were there on a Monday and Tuesday.  Although there was construction going on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the unit amenities and resort accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Pretty great! Walkable to Disney, not walkable for multiple days in a row after 10 hr days at Disney though!
Summary: Really cute place! Great price, stainless appliances.Super cute decor. It literally has everything we needed, Kitchenette was super helpful. Staff were FANTASTIC, great customer service to us!!! Breakfast was good. Wish the curtains were closer to the window & darker. Construction didnt really effect us. It will be great when its done. pool was kinda small & covered, we wished they had a toddler pool. I totally understand why they have valet parking...the cars are squeezed in pretty tight so its best to leave it to the valets.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the unit amenities and resort accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Our family stayed in the Peacock Suites for seven days the first week in November 2013. When I first walked down the hallway, I wondered how the rooms would be as it was apparent that this was an old property. When we arrived in the room we were pleasantly surprised. It was beautifully decorated and very clean. Each room had two queen beds. We had two rooms with a door in-between. Both rooms had a sofa that made out into a bed. I did not sleep on one, but my son-in-law did and he said it was a miracle foam mattress and quite comfortable.  There was a armoir to hang clothes and a lot of drawers. We put the suitcases on top of the armoir after we unpacked and really felt at home.  There was a "kitchen area" in both rooms, containing a microwave, small fridge, cupboard with four
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some transportation tips for future guests. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the unit amenities and resort accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We wanted a hotel that had separate bedroom, and living space, as our 3 yr old is in bed by 8. The Peacock was nice as it has a full separation. A tip, the glass doors are only frosted, so we took some black garbage bags and taped them up so the light would not bleed into the bedroom when the little one was sleeping.    Upon check-in, you are given a welcome package, which has maps etc of the area. They also do ask you to participate in their timeshare demo, and offer you $100 in Disney Dollars. We were only there for 3 days, so were not interested at all. They do not pressure you on this, which is nice to see. Other reviewers have said their room was not cleaned as they were part of the timeshare. We paid full rate, which was still discounted to $89cdn/night, and that included
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some tips for future guests. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed the unit amenities and resort accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Wife and I went for a quick anniversary weekend trip to Disneyland.  Used my points to book the stay in a 1 bedroom.  Room looked liked it was updated and was very comfortable!  Only 1 bathroom in the 1 bedroom suite so if you have more than 2 people, be prepared as the bathroom is located in the main sleeping area.   Disneyland was really close by though!  We plan on staying there early next year for a family trip so the location will be convenient for my niece and nephew to recharge if they need to.  The breakfast room was located directly across our room and we couldn't hear any noise at all when our door was closed!  Can't say that about other hotels.  The breakfast itself wasn't all that great but it did have enough choices to be able to find something to eat.    We left a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your anniversary trip at our location and the unit accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: There is a lot of construction going on but the rooms are very clean and the pool and hot tubs are fun with great hours (I think it was 8am until 11pm).  The one bedroom is pretty small but the two bedrooms are very spacious with 2 bathroom also.  We stayed in late October 2013 and there was a lot of construction going on but it didn't really get in our way.  The walk to Disneyland is just as fast as the shuttle (about a 10-15 min walk).
Manager Response: Hi Keith,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some tips for future guests. We are  glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The staff was great!  The room was spacious and clean. I loved having a fridge and microwave in the room. We had 4 adults and two toddlers and there was plenty of room. There was a little table that seats 4 to have snacks.  There was a door that separated the rooms. It was frosted to it still let light and sound through but gave us privacy. The resort is about 15 walk or 4 minute drive to parking lot for Disneyland. There is a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland too. I will stay again!
Manager Response: Hi Lesa,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some tips for future guests. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Cramped if planning on spending any length of time in room.
Summary: Clean pleasant room but small if needing or planning to spend anytime in the room. Can defiantly see the appeal if visiting Disney.  However took over 24 hrs for us to get a sink plug & it wasn't a new one so regularly fell to pieces. Our son came to join us 4 days into our stay making 5 of us which they knew from the booking but we only had 4 of everything is plates glasses etc I. I am sure they would have supplied extra but we shouldn't have needed to request extra. Didn't like the fact everything was plastic either glasses mugs etc either but appreciate way. Breakfast plentiful but very basic nothing available that our 8yr old would eat but has been the same at very hotel we've stayed in with continental breakfast provided in California. We don't have the same problem in the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some tips for future guests. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We apologize for any delay in receiving your utensil request. Your feedback will allow us to continue improving the guest experience. Again, thanks for reaching out.

Summary: This was our second trip to this hotel. During this trip I went to a nearby mall and purchased over $400 worth of brand-new clothes. I left them (accidentally) in the closet in our room. The housekeeping staff are very honest and turned it all in. Another very helpful staff member had it mailed to me in a flat rate box through the US Postal Service and I received it within a couple of days.   We love this hotel because it has a small kitchenette which allows us to cook our own meals. It is within a 10 minute walking distance to Disneyland which we also enjoy since we have a large stroller to push. There is a shuttle that will take you to nearby attractions for a low rate and picks up directly in front of the hotel, but we prefer to walk.  During this trip we were able to use the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We appreciate your kind words and will share them with our staff. We are so glad to hear your enjoyed your unit amenities and spa. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The purpose of our trip was different than most that stay at this resort.  We were attending to a family funeral.  From the time we were greeted at the front desk by JJ, I felt that our needs were attended to and that they were consciencious of our visit  We found the location excellent.  If we were planning on a family adventure to Disneyland, it would have been great.  As it was, it provided easy access to the local freeways and we found it easy to get around.   There are several restaurants in the vicinity that are easily within walking distance.  The rooms were very nicely decorated and modern.  The layout of the room was very functional and clean.  I thought the noise level would be higher due to the fact that the facility is currently going through remodeling.
Manager Response: Hi Rhonda,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We are so glad your needs were met when you visited our property. We look forward to your next trip to our property for a fun-filled vacation.

Summary: We came here on a five day trip with Disneyland as our focus. We didn't need to rent a car because the shuttle picks you up right in front of the resort to the theme park. The resort also offers continental breakfast which was very convenient in starting our day early at Disney. Rooms are beautiful (recently renovated) and my children loved the pool/recreation area. Even more so, the staff here is awesome. Andrew, Jessica, Jeff, Rochanda, Karan, Adam, Paula and the entire staff treated us like family which made our vacation even more memorable.
Manager Response: Hi Monica,  Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback including some helpful information for future guests. We are so glad you enjoyed the resort accommodations. It’s always great to hear about positive encounters with our friendly staff. We hope you come back and visit us!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with the Disneyland parks being the main purpose of our trip. The hotel is undergoing extensive renovations with most areas blocked off which they ingeniously disguised with Halloween decorations. The rooms are a good size with enough room for 5 people. The sofa bed in the living room is quite comfortable. The kitchenette was convenient. The room looks exactly like the picture, new, modern and clean . Got a good rate because of the ongoing construction. Breakfast was adequate, and we got there 30 min before it ended so most of the people were done but there was still a good selection of items. They are adding a new breakfast room so it should be great when they are done with their renovations. We drove to the parks each day as it is too far to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback. We are so glad you enjoyed the unit accommodations. We appreciate the feedback regarding the pool and parking concerns as we are always looking for ways to improve. We hope you come back and visit us!

Summary: Came here for a conference and used my timeshare points.  Good location for Disneyland. There is a shuttle that picks up in front of the hotel. You could also walk to the park which is three blocks away.  The complex is under construction right now. There is valet parking. Driving in and out of the parking can be a little tight at times.  Rooms were clean. There are no views to speak of out of the window.  They have complimentary continental breakfast but get there before 8 or else it becomes a zoo.  Breakfast area is small and they ask that you not bring food back to your room.  Staff is friendly and helpful. Don't know if I would come back due to the nature of my trip but this place wasn't bad.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such great feedback including information about the area. We are glad you enjoyed your overall stay with us and we hope to see you again!

Summary Heading: Decent hotel in the armpit that is Anaheim
Summary: We've stayed here on two separate occasions. The prior time was before the recent change in management. Our experience mostly mirrored the prior stay.  The breakfast here was the worst of any on our 3 week trip. The food choices are poor, and the traffic flow in the room is awful. This is pretty much the same as our prior stay.  While in the pool area, my wife was hit by a piece of metal that fell from what seemed to be the hotel roof. We reported this, but no one seemed to know how this happened or where it came from, and we never heard anything more about it. Fortunately she wasn't seriously hurt.  Outside of these issues, the room was very good, the valets very accommodating, and the staff helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for a week near Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed here for an 8-day vacation to Anaheim.  We booked through RCI as an exchange.  There are lots of things included here that you do not expect when booking at a resort property such as a continental breakfast each morning and maid services twice during the week.  The breakfast was a standard hotel continental breakfast and is held in a room much too small for the number of guests, so we tended to go down and pick something up to take back to the room.  Most of the outside of the property is currently covered by construction materials and scaffolding, but the visible parts looked nice.  The rooms have obviously been recently renovated as everything is clean, fresh, and appears newer.  They are fairly large compared to standard hotel suites, but a little smaller
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such great feedback regarding the area amenities and location. We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your unit accommodations. We apologize for your concerns regarding the valet parking. Please know we are always looking for way to improve and your feedback will help us to do so. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Based on other travelers' reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked the Peacock Suites for our Disney and Knotts vacation for these main reasons:  rating for Anaheim properties, spacious rooms, room rate, recent renovations, kitchenette, and free wifi.  I was not disappointed at all!  Another big thing that readers should know is that exceptional customer service is the norm here. How refreshing to see and feel consistent service.    They are going through additional renovations to the sun deck and exterior painting and guess what?  They called me before I departed Hawaii to inform me! I was wowed.   Like many reviewers mentioned, we were first on and first off for the Anaheim Resort Transit (huge plus) red route to and from Disneyland.  During our stay, one has to pass the game area to
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such great feedback regarding your stay. We are so glad to hear of your positive encounters with our staff. We are also happy to hear you were fully satisfied with the unit accommodations during your vacation. We look forward to your next visit with us!

Summary: We planned to go to Disneyland for 3 days and this place was perfect. There are currently renovations happening which worried me but there was absolutely no loud noises waking us up at a horrible hour of the morning nor any other problems. There is a heated pool and spa as well as included breakfast. Plenty of baked goods, waffles, toast and cereal. The rooms were huge too. Plenty of space to relax after a long day of walking around. It was a short walk to some places to eat and there is a shuttle bus stop right out the front which will take you straight to Disneyland. The staff here were really nice too. JJ (I think that was his name) was really nice and had a good chat while we were waiting for our shuttle bus to the airport. Highly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Hi Karen,  Thank you for providing such great feedback including area location information. We are so glad you enjoyed the resort accommodations and staff. We hope you come back to visit us!

Summary: The Peacock Suites is currently under renovation, but is going to be wonderful when it's finished. It's about the extras that make it better than average. Customer service was great, right from check in. They offer a yummy flavored water in the lobby area. A concierge was helpful regarding things in the area and Disney. The rooms were super clean and very spacious. They had a separate kitchenette/living room area from the bedroom, separated by French doors. Nice for when kids fell asleep and parents still wanted to watch TV. Very clean room. There is daily maid service. We had a bag of microwave popcorn and a couple lemonade packets in a basket, which was fun, besides the usual coffee packets. Bathroom could use a little brighter light, but it appeared to get brighter the longer
Manager Response: Thank you for providing such useful feedback for our guests. We are so glad you enjoyed the area and resort accommodations. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Stayed at this resort with my husband and our two kids using my parents' timeshare points. We had a two bedroom suite. Our room was very well appointed, quiet, and spacious. The breakfast was simple but plentiful and our kids loved it. The exterior of the hotel is dated, and it's too far to walk to Disneyland with kids, but there is a shuttle available. Overall, a pleasant stay and would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am a self-confessed 'hotel snob', and when our plans changed at the end of our holiday I resigned myself to what I thought would be sub-standard accommodation. Was I wrong! From the moment I had contact with the Peacock Suites staff the service was great. I called on my way from the airport to request that the crib for my infant son be ready for our late arrival, and voila! It was comfortable and clean. The rooms are beautiful and above all, extremely clean. The official photos are a real reflection of the rooms. There was plenty of room, and the fridge/microwave was very handy. The breakfast was adequate and a good start to the day. The valet always got our car very quickly. The renovations didn't really bother us, and i do look forward to coming back once they are completed.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this great feedback. We will share this with our staff. We are glad to hear you enjoyed the unit accommodations and experienced satisfactory service from our staff. We hope you come back to stay with us.

Summary: Stay in hotel from September 15-21, 2013.  Room was clean, well stocked; plenty of towels, and so near Disneyland.  I only wished the renovation had been finished.  The interestd thing is if I had not seen the work, I never would have known there were workers at the hotel.  The staff was friendly, very helpful and knowledgeable.  All questions were answered or directed to someone who could provide the answer.  One thing, the breakfast needs to be upgraded.  They serve lots of sugar, which is strange to me because so many children are in the hotel.  They are already excited that they may be going to Disneyland, and to have injested all of the sugarey items must have them bouncing off the wall.  I recommend the suites for couples and family and friends.  It's a very nice place in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to write about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites.  We are happy to hear that you had such a nice visit and that our staff was helpful and friendly!  In response to your concerns about the breakfast, we do offer a variety of healthy options such as hard boiled eggs, toast, yogurt, fruit (apples or oranges), cereal, oatmeal, and bagels.   Thank you again for your time.  We hope you will consider staying with us again in the future to see our wonderful completed renovations.

Summary Heading: Lovely rooms, great location and friendly staff
Summary: We stayed here 4 nights whilst visiting Disneyland and Peacock Suites are very well located. Had we not been travelling with friends we would have tried the walk to the Disney parks as it doesn't look to be too far, but we ended up driving each day. The room was fantastic, with a mini kitchenette which proved very handy, would have been nice if the maid service had replenished the tea and coffee facilities but no major drama. We only had breakfast on one morning and it was pretty hectic in the breakfast room, we clearly went at the busiest time, but they do have plans to expand this area in the next 6 months or so. The laundry facility was very handy, but could do with more machines as everything was in use on two occasions that I went to use them. The pillows were a little too
Manager Response: We are pleased that you titled your visit as “Lovely rooms, great location and friendly staff”.  That is certainly our goal!  We do appreciate your detailed feedback.  We look to reviews to guide us on not only what we are doing well, but what we can do to continue to improve our services and amenities.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Great Sevice, Clean Rooms
Summary: I am a Shell Vacations owner and I have been coming to the Peacock since 2008.  The have gotten better each time.  The hotel has had a recent room makeover and the are very nice now.  Housekeeping kept my room clean and stocked with towels and soap.  The front desk agents were very friendly and helpful.  Plus the Peacock has a shuttle that stops right in front for Disneyland.  The best part is the Peacock stop is first on to Disneyland so you don't have to worry about it filling up and when you are tired and ready to get some rest Peacock stop is the first off coming back from Disneyland.
Manager Response: WOW!  What a great review and thank you very much for your kind words!  I have shared your wonderful comments with the staff here at Peacock Suites. We truly look forward to serving you and your family again in the future!

Summary: rooms were up to date. direct tv gives so many choices. Breakfast was unsatisfying though. Hard boiled eggs. Frozen waffles that you have to toast. But at least there is juice, donuts & yogurt. If you are an owner, they only clean your room every 3 days. But they do give clean towels, shampoo when you request. Have to dump your own trash.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your honest feedback.  We appreciate your concerns and want you to know that we take all comments to our management team for discussion.  We are happy to see that you enjoyed our newly renovated suites and upgraded TV package.  As far as our breakfast is concerned, we are constantly brainstorming on ways to improve.  Recently, we’ve added yogurt, waffles, bagels and cream cheese, making it an extensive continental breakfast.  As far as housekeeping, we always fulfill any service requests that guests make, such as emptying trash.  Our goal is to make you feel like you’re at your home away from home.  Thank you again for your response and we hope to see you again.

Summary: We stayed three nights and it was an amazing experience. Our suite was very clean!  The staff was very helpful and extremely nice!  We felt vey comfortable there. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly and willing to answer all questions!  Parking is valet only and we never waited long for our car. The valet workers had our car to us within 2 minutes and they were always very friendly and happy!  Great place to stay if you are going to Disneyland and only 20 minutes to the beach!!  We will go back for sure!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for Disney vacation
Summary: When we arrived we were happy to see the rooms been remodeled and updated. The bed was comfortable and I noticed it had an organic mattress. Nice! He pull out sofa was comfortable for my son. Pros: free breakfast but very basic; nice pool that we enjoyed; hotel overall very clean; cheap shuttle to Disney; big screen TVs; DVD players in each room; stocked with plates fridge microwave some snacks Cons:parking $10 a day and there is nowhere else to park but valets were quick;  floors and walls thin; could hear people above us walking and taking showers. I am a light sleeper so that was annoying especially when the other family seemed to wake up quite early.    There is also a fitness room but never went. My body was too sore from walking at Disney all day. I loved the onsite
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at Peacock and from the moment we drove up, we were greeted by the most nicest valet staff, to the moment we checked in and was promptly checked in by the sweetest gal. The rooms were very clean and every one we had encounter with were just amazing!  We will definitely return !!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed 4 nights from aug 20 to 24. The front desk staff are super nice and helpful.  We stay in room 328 and it is very clean. It has microwave, fridge, plates and bowls and utensil. I love the bed and pillows. Although our room is right across the elevator, we do not hear any sounds. We had good sleep during the stay.  The only thing I need to complaint was the housekeeping. We left our dirty bowls and spoon in the kitchen in the morning. At night we came back, the bowls and spoons are placed back to thr cabinet but they were unwashed. The housekeeper did not notice they were used or she was just too lazy to wash them? So plz be careful when you need to use.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we selected the peacock suites it had a very special meaning our one year wedding anniversary for our peacock themed wedding. When we walked in lobby we were impressed with the gorgeous front doors etched with peacocks. The front desk reps were friendly and ask if we were celebrating anything and we told them about our wed theme and they seemed so excited to hear. When we got to room we didn't expect to have such an amazing room. We have stayed at many high end hotels paying 3 times the amount and this cute 2 room suite complete with comfy sofa,2 flat screens,fridge, microwave and snacks exceeded our  expectations. Now on the best part!! I made a casual inquiry on hotels web site about extras in suite for our anniversary and what came about not only impressed me but made a
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a timeshare that we purchased into. It is close to Disney but, we knew at some point we would visit the beach. We brought ice chests and food in addition to our regular travel gear. It has recently been purchased by Wyndham and has many room upgrades, which was aesthetically pleasing. However, with a kitchenette one would hope to have a kitchen sink. The room description boasts room for 4. There were two beds, however, there was just enough space for one person to walk along the sides of the furniture and not enough storage space for luggage and ice chests. With only one sink, the fruits and veggies we brought had to be washed in the bathroom. Additionally, At one of our trips to the valet, the keys to a Mercedes were delivered. We do not own a Mercedes. While that mix
Manager Response: Thank you for the review, Jo. We are sorry to hear you were unsatisfied with the room and resort accommodations. Our goal is to make each guest feel at home with a kitchen. Because we a have condo-style resort, space is limited in our kitchen areas. We also apologize for your negative experience with our valet service. Feedback is crucial to making the experience more positive for you and future guests, so we appreciate the time you took to leave your review.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay for Disney and the beach!
Summary: We have been at this resort 5 times now.  We keep returning b/c it is part of our timeshare.  It is close enough to Disney, beaches, Knottsberry and Universal studios to make it a good stopping place for the night.  When we checked in this time, and got to our rooms, they had been remodeled.  They were very nice and clean.  (I even took a picture of the shower b/c I may want to redo our shower in that same tile).  Also, when we checked in, for a total of 5 nights, we were told that we would have our room serviced on day #3.  Our family of 4 are the ones that have the Do Not Disturb sign on our door at every hotel when we stay anywhere.  We can change our own toilet paper and use the same towels for more than one day.  To have our room serviced just once was perfect for us.  When
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the worst Disneyland vacation I have ever had and it is because of this establishment. We come here every year, and have no idea what is going on with them. Upon Arrival , they failed to tell us that they have changed their policies and no longer service the rooms in anyway.  And true to their word...they never touched our room. We were shocked to come home at midnight and find our room untouched and un-serviced in any way. We went down to the front desk.  They said it is their new policy and they won't even COME in the room to change towels, empty trash or put in new toilet paper unless we specifically request it, and they refuse to make beds.  They actually told us that they can't make beds or they would have to charge us 25$ a day to do so.  So, we specifically
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to leave us such a detailed review.  I want to assure you that we have addressed your concerns.  We constantly strive to provide 5-Star Service and are sincerely concerned that we fell short of your expectations.  Regarding the housekeeping issue, I do want to apologize if the procedure wasn’t explained in detail, upon check in.  It is our policy to inform all Timeshare guests of their cleaning days and they must initial that they are aware of this policy.  With that being said, we are always willing and able provide fresh towels and empty trash upon request, as it is our goal to provide the best service possible.  When this issue was brought up to management at check out, we did address the situation.  Again, I do apologize that we did not meet your expectations during this visit.  We hope we will have the chance to provide you and your family a more memorable experience when you return to Anaheim.

Summary: Good points : Rooms were clean and perfectly spacious, staff were friendly and informative. Nice Sun Balcony on top floor. Laundrette available on site. Walking Distance to Disneyland (15mins) and Anaheim Gardens centre for restaurants (cheesecake factory particularly good). Valet parking quick and efficient ($10 a night not so good!.) Not so good : swimming Pool wasn't very nice, small and internal to building. The stairs and hallways always smelt of barbecued food as some families cooked BBQ in the meeting/patio area downstairs. BBQ not a problem (but inside?). Hallways and general decor a bit tired. Breakfasts were poor. Bread, cheap waffles, cheap dough rings, some cereal, milk , juice, coffee. One toasting machine between 500! Three stars is about right and for 6 nights we
Manager Response: none

Summary: For only $129 a night, we had a spacious room with a kitchenette that was within walking distance to Disney and many restaurant options. We spent two nights in Anaheim to take in  Disneyland. The beds were comfortable and the shuttle picked us up right outside the hotel.  The Peacock is the first of the hotel stops and the first drop off so you have the shortest ride. You can buy your $5 all day bus pass from a terminal outside of the hotel.  The continental breakfast was average - toast, cereal, and donuts. The concierge does a slightly hard sell of the time share.. we always politely say no thank you to the offer of free tickets and cash.  We would rather pay and use the time to enjoy our vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland and had a very pleasant experience. The room itself was GREAT! Comfy beds and great living room/kitchenette. The theme park shuttle picked us up right outside the hotel and it was awesome being the first ones on and first ones off from Disney. There are a bunch of places to eat within a short driving distance of the hotel as well. The only thing that kept our stay from being 5 stars was the continental breakfast. The selection of foods was very disappointing. Still, we were close to a grocery store and stocked our room fridge with breakfast goodies...so it still worked out fine. All in all I highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not up to timeshare standards but decent hotel
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for a week on family vacation.  The room was a little small, but it did the job.  The lack of towels in the room, and at the pool were a little annoying.  It was tidy, but not very clean.  The staff itself was helpful.   It was close to Disneyland and the Stadium, but there really wasn't much to do within walking distance.  The Garden Walk was ok, but really empty, and not was really open.   It definitely did not meet my timeshare expectations, and needs to be made bigger, and cleaner.  The pool area was dirty, the hot tub was green, and the common area was pretty much an open space of the parking garage.  The $10 valet parking was kind of a rip off also.  If you are staying at a hotel they should at least give you free parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Well located and good value for money in this area
Summary: We stayed for four nights in April 2013 in a two bedroom suite.  Was about 20 minutes walk to Disneyland, and a 10 min drive to Knotts Berry Farm.  We were also about 10 minutes walk to the nearby mall thing (Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen) which was great for easy dinners.    We had to boil water in the microwave, no jug in sight, although there was a drip coffee machine.  Not so good for making tea though, when you need the water hotter.  This seems to be a common problem in the US though it seems.  We kept all our valuables in the one safe in the master bedroom.  Was big enough for two large cameras, 3 ipad devices, wallets...etc, and had no problems.  Re the breakfast - they will close and lock the door right on 10am, and they stop restocking well before that -
Manager Response: none

Summary: We left a ipod on the table next to the lounge and left the room at 10.30am on 7/5/13. We returned at 3pm that afternoon and the room was cleaned and the ipod gone. Hotel staff really weren't that concerned and almost spoke as if"oh well". The stealing along with just over low average facilities i would find somewhere else to stay if you are already booked in dont take anything the cleaners might like for themself
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights June 24 through June 27 and had a great time. We arrived way before check in and the hotel took care of storing our luggage then taking it all to our room while we spent the day at Disneyland. The room was super clean, and the door separating the sleeping area from the dining/living/bath area was a great addition, and there was plenty of room to move around, without feeling like we were on top of each other. The hotel staff was pleasant: from check in, to the valet parking, to check out everyone we encountered was friendly.  The hotel is close enough to the Disneyland parks to walk (about 15 minutes), but we chose to purchase a 3-day ART card and rode the shuttle to and from the park each day. We even came back to the resort in the middle of the day
Manager Response: none

Summary: While the rooms are nice in that there is a pocket door to separate the bedroom from the couch/TV/dining area, this property seems somewhat rundown and communication from the staff was poor. For example, they told us that the reason there was duct tape on the door to an adjoining room because it was being remodeled and yet we saw a family coming in & out of the room repeatedly. Our electricity went out for about 10 minutes on two separate mornings and the fire alarm went off briefly one night. Continental breakfast was more extensive than some, but not great quality (i.e., generic unsweetened cheerios or corn flakes; hard boiled eggs; plain bagels). Also, the pool, while covered, is very small for a hotel this size. The hotel is very close to Disney, so you hear fireworks every
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not a bad hotel for the price
Summary: We stayed here from June 2nd through the 8, 2013 on a trip to Disneyland.  All of the rooms have been refurbished and look very nice.  Our room had two queen beds, a hide-away sofa, and a full-sized murphy bed.  That combination worked well for our family of six so we were very pleased with that aspect of our stay.  Our room had two flat-panel TV's, a microwave, decent sized refrigerator, table/chairs, and a counter-top for fixing meals on.  The mini-kitchenette also had dishes and cups we were able to utilize.    For the price, I'd say we were pretty happy with the place.  Our room was cleaned daily, and requests to the front desk were courteously handled.  My wife had a minor complaint in that she did not feel the lighting in the bathroom area was adequate, but overall, we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Peacock between Thursday, May 9th to Sunday May 12.  The room was excellent, comfortable bed, stylish decor, very clean. The bedroom is separated from the living room/ kitchenette area and bathroom.  The hotel is very busy and full of kids. Overall, it was great. The downfall being that you can hear the people above you walking, and there are lots of running, screaming kids down the hallway - sleeping in can be challenging.  There is at least one BBQ available (there may be more) near the elevators towards the back by the pool table.  Laundry is available on the 4th floor until 10pm. You need your room key to get into the laundry room. If I'm not mistaken it was 1.50 for wash, 1.25 for dryer.  There is a gift shop available on the third floor. You can buy detergent
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent size rooms for the area
Summary: We stayed here with a 1 yr old and overall enjoyed our stay.   The good: the price was great compared to other smaller rooms in the area, the mandatory valet was very friendly, helpful and very fast which is good when they require $10 a day per car, the style of the rooms were modern, the front desk was friendly. The bad: was it was fairly noisy due to all the families, smaller rooms but large compared to others in the immediate area, checkout process took too long as the desk had the mistakes all over the bill, small pool which looked bigger in the pictures.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property was great for the price,had a 1 bedroom suite,one room had two comfortable queen beds,and in the living room part a queen size sofa bed,that was also extremely comfortable for a sofa bed. Rooms were always keep clean by cheery and happy staff. Continental breakfast was great,oranges,apples,waffles,bagels,yogurt,donuts hard boiled eggs,porridge milk,juices and coffee,thought it was great!if I wanted a hot made to order breakfast I would be paying a lot more for the stay. We did use the parking facility at the hotel,and for a $10 fee per day,was impressed by the valet service it gave you,when you needed your car they personally drove it to you,and when it was returned back to the hotel they parked it for you! Major hotels in anaheim charge way more without the valet
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfortable rooms but some cutbacks since Wyndham took over!
Summary: We are Shell Vacations Club owners and stay here anytime we come in town.
