Each bedroom had its own spacious bathroom and TV.  1 room had 2 queen beds and the other a king bed.  Main area had a table with 4 chairs, and a sofa and chair, and a tv.  There is a small fridge ( dorm size)  , microwave, and dishes.  The part of the room that I was disappointed with was that there was no sink there.  It was awkward having to wash dishes in a bathroom!  The resort does provide a continental breakfast.  It has cereals, donuts, oranges, and hard boiled eggs.  After 7 days it got very typical.  There was never much of a variety and the eating area is very small.  The pool is very small too.  My girls still enjoyed swimming and it is nice that
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for the time you took to write a review about your stay at the Peacock Suites!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Freshly Remodled, No Complaints.
Summary: Stayed @ this property Oct 24 and Oct 25th. They were just finishing a 8-12 month remodel of the property which finished with the remodel of the lobby. Everything is as to be expected from a very new looking property.  Rooms:  Big "suites". You know the ones with the sleeper sofa in the living room and then one or two beds seperated by a slider in the other room. However in the room with the sleeper sofa was a  mini kitchen with a oven/microwave and fridge all in nice stainless steel. Plenty of towels and really great decorative touches throughout the room.  Parking: $10 day plus Tax. Its Valet service because when the hotel is packed there just isnt enough room to park everyone so it takes some double parking to get it all done. However they are super courteous and its not an
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing!  We appreciate your time and feedback and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  Thank you again for your thoughts and we look forward to having you come and stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We were meeting friends from Australia at Disneyland for just one day and didn't want to spend alot of money.  Typically, you "get what you pay for" so we didn't expect much.  What a surprise!  Peacock Suites is, in my opinion, Anaheim's best kept secret!  The check-in was quick and easy.  The room was spotlessly clean.  The furniture was comfortable.  We ended up getting annual passes to Disneyland and this will be our home away from home each time we go.  Highly recommended for singles, couples or families!
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to hear that you really enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites!  Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments in writing!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: I always enjoy staying with you. The rooms are clean and nice and we are always greater by your very nice staff. Hope to get back there again soon. With three kids, the location is perfect and the swimming pool area is appreciated by them.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments about the Peacock Suites on TripAdvisor!  We appreciate any and all comments (especially good ones) and pass them along to the staff!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This was my families first time overseas. We arrived at Peacock Suites at 12.30pm, we knew we couldn't check in till 4 pm , but they gladly stowed our bags , gave us pre check in and advised us of where we could find some lunch and do some shopping to pass the time. Rooms were small but very adequate, clean, and all staff members were very attentive and helpful. All in all we stayed for 13 nights. We were actually very sad to leave and would definitely stay here again. We stayed on the 4th floor in a 2 double bed suite with a fold out as well. Laundry facilities were great as well.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughts about the stay you and your family experienced here at the Peacock Suites!  We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit and truly appreciate the time you took to write your review.  We look forward to having you visit again in the future.

Summary Heading: not a resort - but will do
Summary: Time Share trade here.  Looking for Newport Coast, this was our trade.  Ok, we can deal with this.  The place is actually nice, decorated very modern and fashionable.  Continental breakfast was probably the worse I have ever had, but again we can deal with this.  This place is definitely for families (we are a older, newly married couple, no children).  Walking distance to Disneyland, restaurants.  Downfall, mandatory valet parking each day of $10 plus tax...didn't really like that, but you know what I'm going to say, we can deal with this.  The room that we had didn't have a view, faced a factory or something, but it was peace and quiet.  We were right outside an elevator, so short periods of loudness, but not so bad.    Laundry on the 4th floor, pool on bottom and view deck
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing us with your honest feedback.  We appreciate it, and we also want you to know that we take all comments right to our management team for discussion.  We are happy to see that overall you enjoyed your stay.  I would also like to note that our Breakfast Department has been alerted and we are working to improve the selection.  Thank you again.

Summary: At first look from the outside and lobby, didn't think the rooms would be as nice as they were. We had a 1 King bed room with a separate living room.  Beautiful room and GREAT family amenities.  There were two TV's and two DVD players in each room which helped out when the little one wanted to watch a movie and mom/dad wanted to too.  The room has a sliding door that separates the bedroom from the living room for privacy.  The living room has a pull out bed. Hotel offers free internet.  The room also had flatware, tableware, dishwashing soap, cups, paper towels, coffee maker, toaster, microwave, big fridge, and blowdryer.  The bed was VERY comfy.  Only dislikes about the hotel: bedroom ran a little chillier than expected and the heater made a lot of noise right before it would
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Peacock Suites, we are happy to hear that you enjoyed the amenities that our guestrooms provide.  We thank you again for the review, and look forward to having you stay with us again should you return to the Anaheim area.

Summary: This was my second stay with this property and I highly recommend as it is clean, economical and just a short distance from Disney properties.  We walked to the park each morning and then took the ART buses back in the evening since this property is the first stop on the route 7 leaving the park.  The hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast provided in the morning was just enough to get us going.  The refrigerator and microwave are a huge plus, in addition to the 7-Eleven next door for late night snacks after returning from a long day at the parks.  Rooms are spacious and clean, free wireless allowed me to stay connected with work issues as needed, and having the separated room allowed my daughter a bit of quite time in her own space.  This has quickly
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for the high marks.  Every guest who comes to the property is an opportunity for us  to leave a lasting impression in hopes that you will return, and I am happy to see that you will consider us for your future trips to Anaheim.

Summary: We are shell owners and this property is a great place. Renovated rooms covered all of our needs. Clean and comfortable with everything you need. Staff very helpful and nice.ART right outside the door for disneyland convenience. We even sat in our room and watched the fireworks. Loved it enough that we are returning in December.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and compliments to the staff, it is always the goal for all guests to be comfortable, and we are happy to see that we achieved that for you and your family.

Summary: These rooms are tiny. Technically, it's a suite (separate sitting and sleeping areas), but it does feel a bit cramped. However, the location is great. Very close to the freeway and walking distance from Disneyland (20 minutes). Mandatory valet parking, which costs $10 per day.
Manager Response: Thank you for the honest review.  Hopefully we will see you on your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: OK, but don't expect real service
Summary: The room was nice enough. Had myself and my 8 year old son and 12 year old daughter, so it was nice to have a separate room. The pool is small with ice cold water. Ordered a pizza one night, and found out after it was delivered that I had to go to the lobby and pick it up. Defeats the delivery purpose and wish this was known ahead of time. The front desk and Concierge don't communicate, which caused me to get an overpriced tour package that the assoicate sold me -no refunds. An hour later the concierge gave me a coupon for a better deal. wrote to corporate- no response. Commented in a survey -no response. If you go in with no expectations you'll be good. Just don't ask the desk to go out of there way,
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for staying with us at Peacock Suites. I am so sorry to hear about the mix up regarding the tour you tried to book during your visit. It is always our goal to not only meet but exceed our guest’s expectations and if we fail to do so it is extremely important that we are notified so the problem can be corrected. We have addressed any communication errors with the Guests Services and Concierge staff and hope to show you the great service we are known for on your return visits to Anaheim!

Summary: I have stayed here a couple times before and now is the time for the review, they have remodeled this resort recently and boy have they done a great job. This time we stayed in a one bedroom, and I was "stuck" sleeping on the sofa bed, and although the couch wasn't super comfy when you just sat on it (I think its probably so new its needs to be worn in) the bed portion was memory foam so no squeaky noises, no bar in you back, it was by far the most comfortable sleeper sofa I have ever slept on and I have slept on a lot! The pool area is great, it was really hot when we went to visit and the pool is completely covered so you don't have to worry about sunscreen, although that made the pool a little chilly it was a worth it. Sun deck is awesome plenty of sun up there, also you can
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughts about the stay you and your family experienced here at the Peacock Suites! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit and truly appreciate the time you took to write your review. We look forward to having you visit again in the future!

Summary: Our wedding party reserved 4 suites and had a great time.The newly remodeled rooms were great and the new sofa bed was as comfortabl as it can get,this is a huge improvement over the old style spring and bar in your back sofa beds.One of the a/c units wasn't working properly and the staff took care of it pronto.The pack and play bed was 1 st thing on the list of our weants when we arrived and we didn't havee to say a word-done and done.This is a great location and the resort is always clean,staff very helpfull and I will continue to stay here and reccommend!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at the Peacock Suites! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed a week. The staff was terrific. When we needed something the response was quick and efficient. One of our grandsons had a small "accident " late at night. When we called for a bed change they were there in less than 2 minutes and had our room back in order within 15 min of our call.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments about the Peacock Suites on TripAdvisor!  We appreciate any and all comments (especially good ones) and pass them along to the staff!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: This is a great property, clean, practically new.  The units are owned by timeshare owners, so there is money to keep it like new and keep it clean.  Another hotel I went to during the same trip, for the same price, was dirty, and I could really appreciate the difference.  Peacock Suites is superb.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing! We appreciate your time and feedback and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  Thank you again for your thoughts and we look forward to having you come and stay wth us again in the future!

Summary Heading: Would stay here every time we go to  Disneyland
Summary: Only 2 things was there was a little kitchen with dishes but no sink to wash them, it was kinda wired to wash them in the bathroom sink, also hated that had to pay for parking! but overall we loved it here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently Renovated.  Clean and Neat.  Nice for a family.  This isn't the Four Seasons or a Disney Resort,  but it's a nice clean place to hang your hat for an Anaheim/Disney Vacation.  But I think you get alot more than you would at all of the similarly priced hotels in the area.  The valet parking is a nice touch.  It is $10 a day additional and is NOT an option.  It's mandatory.  But it's also well worth it.  Most hotels charge $10-20 for self park in Anaheim.   Small little private pool with (2) hot tubs.  Pool area was immaculate.  Honestly, everything was super clean.  Some stuff was dated, but it was clean!!! We pulled out of another hotel because of reviews on here about bugs/ants etc.  Nothing like that here at all.  Didn't see so much as a fly the whole time.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay - Close to Disney, Knotts & Convention center
Summary: Close to Disney(is about a 10-15 minute walk), The Convention Center, Anaheim Stadium & bout 15 min from Knotts. While owned by a timeshare company(Shell) it is just a normal hotel room (1,2 or 3 bdrm). on the scale of a Best Western or Holiday exp. The rooms & pool area have been nicely refurbished. Beds & furniture are comfortable.   The rooms have a nice living room with pullout sofa bed as well as micro. & refrig. Both rooms have Flat screen TVs.  We stay here a few times a year & the the staff here has always been friendly.  Unlike many of the smaller independent hotel/motels on the Blvd that are rundown & house county perolees & county welfare cases, this place is very well kept up & a safe family environment. Our only complaint is the valet parking (req.-$10).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our stay here was exactly what I expected.  Through internet research and a general knowledge of hotels near Disneyland, I knew it would not but a glitzy timeshare resort.  The room was great, new furnishings and spacious.  The noise level was bareable, but the walls are a little thin.  We didn't partake of the breakfast so I don't know about that.  The valet parking went a lot more smoothly than expected.  In my opinion, this is a nicer hotel than most of the standard hotels near Disneyland and is priced comparably if not better than the others.  The best thing was the room cleaning service. We traveled with two 1-year old babies and every day we came back to our room and all of their Disney souvenirs were laid out on the bed or couch throughout the room.  We will definitely be
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Does not qualify as a timeshare.  It's just a hotel.
Summary: Let me start by saying this was not a bad place. BUT this falls far short of a true timeshare condo.  This is just a hotel that worked its way into the timeshare market.  The positives: Our room was not bad. The new remodel was nice.  The furniture was comfortable, and the beds were nice. In our 2 bedroom unit, there were a total of 3 large flatscreen LED Tv's. Nice.   The staff was very friendly and courteous.  But that is all. As we checked in, we were also hit with the softsell on a timeshare presentation.  I'll get to that in a few. When we entered our room, we were surprised that they looked as nice as they did. But that quickly disappeared as we found a box of leftover food left in the fridge from the people before us.  That left speculation as to what else was overlooked.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We come back year after year
Summary: We really like this place and try to come back every year.  I have read several reviews about the fact that the rooms are not what you normally expect in a time share exchange and this is true, you don't have a full kitchen, but if you know this going in you will find this is an excellent place to spend a week.  The resort is well maintained and the rooms have recently been updated (although we didn't think the old style was out of date or worn or dated).  It's close to all the theme parks, Hollywood and beaches.  The valet is convenient and they are nice young men that take good care of us and our car.  Also it's nice to have the car in a secure garage at night.  The staff are helpful and accomodating and will do anything to make us feel welcome and comfortable.  The breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value for a short stay
Summary: We checked in late (after 10pm) and checked out before 9am. The rooms were surprisingly well appointed, even though the walls were thin. Continental breakfast was about as expected for the amount we paid for the room -- store-bought, packaged type of pastries, cold cereal, fresh oranges. They fit two queen beds in a very small room (we asked for a king, but it wasn't available). The only real complaint we had was with our check-in, which took over 20 minutes! The reservation was made through Bloomspot (I don't recommend that "discount" site) and apparently we didn't have a reservation after all! (I don't blame the hotel for that one), but one lone desk person was trying to research our reservation, answer phones, assist us -- while there was someone in the back room the whole
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Amenities, Quiet Location, Clean Rooms
Summary: Being a Shell Vacations Owner for a few years, having this location in the Disney area makes it convenient, yet quiet away from all the crowds. The continental breakfast is decent, the rooms have been recently remodeled in more fresh and updated colors. Having a small kitchenette with mini fridge and micro makes it a lot cheaper to bring food/leftovers back to the room instead of having to eat out all the time. Only disappointment is the shades in the bedroom do nothing to block out the light so makes it hard to sleep in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here the week of August 4 and exchanged it through our timeshare. Not a good timeshare fit. We traded a 2 bedroom timeshare for a dorm size fridge and microwave, some plates and cups. Sorry, not even close to meeting timeshare minimums for a kitchenette. Essentials were non-existent. Called the front desk asking for a pitcher to make crystal light drink. Struck out! The plates & cups are all that's provided.  We had 2 queens in the bedroom & a sofa sleeper in the living/kitchen area. Average decor, nothing special. The big draw is the close proximity to Disneyland. A shuttle costs $10 for a 3 day consecutive pass. It comes every 20 minutes & most of the time they stayed on schedule. Beware of the mandatory valet parking fee. 10 bucks a day & we saw the valet staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very clean, updated rooms.  Convenient location with shuttle bus to Disneyland every 20 minutes.  Walking distance to several good restraunts and shops.  Friendly staff.  The only bad part was the continental breakfast, it was not good at all.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Better than we thought it would be
Summary: We chose to stay here for our timeshare trade.  We had a room 417 and could see the fireworks at Disneyland at night.  The room was clean but small.  We had two beds and a sofa bed and it was have been hard to six.  I am glad we just had 4, two adults and two teens.  As this was a timeshare trade, housekeeping was to be on Wednesdays, however, if the housekeeping staff has time to clean more rooms they will do that at no extra charge.  They do charge 10.00 per night for parking as it is valet.  The reason for the valet parking is they do not have enough spaces for the number of rooms they have.  They have gift shop that have Disney t-shirts for much cheaper that in the park.  The pool is small but nice. Hot tub small too.  The staff is very nice and helpful.  The breakfast is
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a pleasant surprise!  We expected a standard hotel room but instead were delighted to have an updated room with modern decor, sliding french doors separating the sleeping and living areas, kitchen area with micro, sink, refrig. & dishes, 2 flat screen tv's, dinette set and sufficient counter space to place our things.  We were a family of 5 and did not feel crowded at all.    The front desk staff and valet folks were friendly and efficient.  The breakfast was the standard fare of pastries, coffee, cereal, etc.  Because most of our time was spent in Disneyland, we did not experience the pool or fitness areas.    The hotel is conveniently located near Disneyland but not within walking distance which wasn't an issue for us.  It is minutes from restaurants and a 7-11 store is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Modern rooms, clean, central, excellent service and staff.
Summary: Very clean and family friendly. Super comfortable rooms. Has all the amenities you could want or need in a hotel.   The hotel has a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland ($4 return trip) or you could walk.   Breakfast is nice and the breakfast room has a clean friendly atmosphere.   Within 4 minutes walking distance you can find restaurants, shops, bowling and cinemas. Car rental and gas station around the corner too. It is a very central safe area.   Pool and spas are lovely too, there's a tv and lounges there to relax on. Also provided are arcade games and BBQ and picnic tables so the family can spend time together.    My husband and I only stayed for 2 nights and thought very highly of Peacock Suites. I recommend it wholeheartedly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Gotta give it a chance, you wont regret it!
Summary: I spend I week here with my wife, we loved it.The room looked like the pictures!. Two plasma tv's, a living area with microwave, mini-fridge, a comfortable king bed. Spacious bathroom with jacuzzi tub. I not kidding, we had a blast. Complimentary breakfast was not the best thing but helps make it to lunch. You dont need a car to move around. Just get the passes for ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) outside in the kiosk and move around. Management was helpful although they could have been a little bit friendly. So give it a chance you really wont regret it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A friend and I stayed at the peacock a few months ago when we went on a Disneyland trip. I have to say that we very much enjoyed our stay. I have stayed at a few hotels there around Disneyland but this was the first time there and definitely wont be the last. The staff at the hotel was very friendly, especially with a late check-in. The rooms there are newly renovated and very comfortable. The hotel was close enough to everything that we wanted to do during our stay in California. I am planning another trip to Disneyland at the end of the year and will definitely try and stay at this hotel again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for the last couple of days or our Disneyland visit.  This hotel is part of our timeshare group.  We will never stay here again!  It felt dirty even though I don't think it actually was.  The breakfast was awful.  Just gross and crowded. So, in my opinion, you really can't count the included breakfast as a benefit.  We couldn't sleep well at night because of noise from the road and/or freeway.  The room did have a nice kitchen area.  The location of the property is inconvenient for trips to Disneyland if you plan to come and go from the parks throughout the day.  And, the area where the hotel sits is not nice.  We have stayed in many hotels in Anaheim and to this one we won't go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here while visiting family. At first glance, I was concerned. The outside seems a little dated, however, the inside was great! The rooms are suites with a small kitchenette. It would be perfect for a family of four or five. The beds were comfortable, the sleeper sofa was ok for a sleeper sofa. The continental breakfast was a carb overload, and deffinitly not good for someone who has gluten issues, but its free!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value for quality service, rooms and central location.
Summary: This my second time staying at Peacock Suites. My family and I  stayed in an one bedroom room on the second floor. Beautifully renovated and spacious. Living room with small kitchen ( microwave, sink, cutlery, dishes and glasses). King size bed comfortable and a sofa sleeper in living room. We took a shuttle bus to Disneyland very convienent. As always the front desk (Candy) and the parking valet( Nebrasha, Issy: the guys from Jordan) you guys are the best. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable :D
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have to start this review by saying that my experience at the Peacock Suites was by no means a bad one. The room was large and quite clean. It was a little on the dark side but that didn't really bother me. Now once you ventured outside the room, the property became a little bit dusty and by dusty I mean cracks in the walls, worn carpets, and some dirt along the walls. Again, nothing too extreme but present. The swimming pool is in a very strange location adjacent to the parking garage. It is also underneath the rest of the hotel so even though it is, by identification, an outdoor pool, you will never benefit from sunlight. It was also always quite crowded but this WAS August in Anaheim. The breakfast had a decent selection but almost none of it was healthy. There were a lot
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all, the rooms are fantastic. We had a 2bedroom suite on the first floor and it fit the bill completely. Each bedroom had its own bath, one room had a king and the other had two queens. There was also a pullout bed I the living room. We slept 5 of us very comfortably. We stayed for a full week and this is where we had some issues. Most are minor but still annoyances.  First there is no sink or stovetop. This makes it a bit hard to keep the counter cleaned and dishes, all of which are plastic, but the cleaning crew will clean them if you leave them out. We couldn't do more than toast or cereal in the mornings but we made due. Just seemed weird to fill water bottles in the bathroom sink.  Second the walls are paper thin. We were not in our room all the time but when we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got to Peacock Suites on a Friday afternoon two hours before check in and they were able to get us in our room within a half hour...the valet was very nice asked if we needed help unloading also parked our car every time. That night walked one block to Garden walk to eat at Bubba gumps not a bad walk at all also a 7-11 is on the corner. Saturday night went to a concert at the Anaheim Angels stadium and the front desk call us a cab and it only cost $10 for six people. Every morning they had doughnuts , 3 different cereals , breakfast pastries, minute maid juice machine, milk , & hard boiled eggs. It had enough to start out the day without weighing you down. Monday we took A.R.T. to Disneyland which you can purchase a day pass in front of the office for $4 for adult and it picks
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family only stayed here for one night. We were looking for a hotel nearish to Disneyland for a base rate at or below $100. Not easy to find, especially when you don't want to stay in a total dive. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. The room was pretty small but had everything we needed, a king bed for us and a queen size sleeper sofa for the kids. There was also a microwave, fridge, and some dishes in the room. We were planning on an early morning, out by 6am so we weren't going to be able to partake of the hotel's breakfast. What we did instead was walk over to the 7-11 about a block away and pick up breakfast supplies. That worked really well for us and I recommend it for anyone staying at this property and visiting Disney when the parks open at 8am. I was told that
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Peacock Suites resorts units have the best bedrooms ever seen.
Summary: When I got a call to attend a presentation from Shell Vacation Club, I accepted and decided to extend my days into a full week so that I could bring my 16 year-old grandson to Disneyland.  I had upgraded the presentation days from an efficiency room to a one bedroom for my grandson (could not book a two bedroom) and paid the difference.  I then made reservations to upgrade to two bedrooms on the extension of our stay and paid the difference at a very reasonable price.  When we got there, I found that they upgraded us to a two bedroom unit from day one of our stay at no extra cost.  The two bedrooms were large with their own full size bathroom.  I was impressed by the size of the rooms.  All TV's were large.  The dining table was also large and the living room area average but
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff is GREAT! My family and I arrived about 2:00 am and Larry at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. When we woke up next morning our remote wasn't working maintenance was there within 15 min to replace batteries. (this is not a must have I just didn't want to be charged for remotes that were already broken) Then we realized bath tub stopper was broken called down to report and maintenance was there within minutes to fix it. The room was spotless and huge! We actually liked it so much we wanted to stay a few more nights but unfortunately they were sold out! If I ever get to return to Disneyland this will be my first choice! The only complaint would be how slow the elevator is.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Quick, efficient, knowledgable and friendly front desk staff upon arrival.  Our room (2 queen beds plus sofa bed) was clean. Free wi fi excellent connection. Complimentary breakfast ( basic, quick foods, self serve, nothing fancy)  Valet parking staff excellent service but be aware of daily parking fee because space is limited. My family and I enjoyed our stay at Peacock Suites. We have already booked another stay in July, 2012. This is great basic, clean and comfortable place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Why I will NEVER own a time share
Summary: All talk and big sales, little in follow through.... I have had better service and continental breakfast at Motel 6. Valet service attendants very friendly , I think I would voluntarily pay them .... But beware mandatory valet parking. ( most likely due to limited space) Swimming area over chlorinated ( most likely because of high kids ... But watch out for red eye after 15 minutes) Room updates fair with nice size flat screens, but mattresses are lumpy and old. Overall noice level not the worst ever, but certainly not the best.... High traffic area with kids running around through night.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review as we appreciate any and all feedback regarding your visit. I am so pleased to hear the Valet Attendants were friendly and the service was great. As far as your comments regarding the pool and breakfast, we do check the chlorine levels multiple times a day to verify we are compliant with the standard health code, sometimes it might seem like there is more if it was recently changed. As far as the breakfast we advertise only a standard continental breakfast, but have gone above that by offering hard boiled eggs, different kinds of juice, several options of pastries as well as milk, oatmeal and cereal and many other items that change throughout the week. Again we do appreciate your feedback and hope we will be able to accommodate you and your family on your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: Nice hotel - but remember: this isn't Mexicor or Hawaii, so dont expect anything elaborate.   PROS:  Clean Rooms.  Nice, private sun deck.  Comp. Internet Access.  15 min walk to Disneyland.  Close (driving distance) to grocery.  Driving distance to great shopping.  Very good comp. breakfast. Surprisingly quiet for a family hotel. CONS: Rooms are small, but adequate.  No sink in kitchen.  Small bathroom.  Small pool (yet, we liked that because it never got too noisey!)  Valet Parking costs $11/day. TIPS:  Groceries:  Food-For-Less on Katella - very affordable.  Target also has a lot of simple & affordable food items.  Shopping; Westminster Mall - great variety.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been staying here for the past 4 years for semi annual vacations.  The new remodel has made such a difference.  2 bedroom units are perfect for 2 families to stay together.  Pool area is nice, but offers no sunbathing area.  They have a new picnic area near the pool where you can even bbq if you like.  Got a few car dings while there, but that could happen anywhere.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's the perfect place for a family with 2 small kids. It's a 2-mile walk to Disneyland front gate but we're distance runners so we don't mind (just keep the kids in strollers). There's a shuttle that comes and goes at a fixed schedule but we opted walking.There's a pool and a kiddie water spray zone when you want to relax. There were comments about the laundry noise being loud? Not sure about that. Either I just sleep in any situation and too tired to care or we got lucky and the laundry industry wasn't running at the time we were sleeping. The rating would have been excellent if the rooms were roomier, but we only stayed at the room to sleep and vegetate so I didn't really care. All in all, it was awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Peacock Suites is newly remodeled and everything is clean and new.  We enjoyed staying here very much.  The rooms have microwaves,mini refrig,plates,bowls and silverware.  It was nice to have 2 televisions and a table to eat at.  The staff was very friendly and the valets are very professional at parking and helping out.  I highly recommend this hotel is you are going to any attractions in Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the resort for two weeks in December 11.  The renovation started during our second week.  The room was a little dated but was very clean and well maintained.  The staff was friendly, housekeeping was exceptional, and the valets were very quick pulling the car around to the front.  The continental breakfast was as advertised, and nice for a quick bite and a cup of coffee or juice in the morning.  The park is about a 15 to 20 minute walk without the little ones, or you can opt for the ART.    The floors are little loud especially with excited little ones, so you may want to ask for a room on the top floor if noise bothers you.  This is not a 5 star hotel, however it was a very good value for the price.  We will return on our next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The suite was not spacious, but enough for 5- 6 people to sleep.  We had a remodeled one bedroom unit with double beds and a very comfortable sofa bed. I was impressed they even stock plates, bowls, silver wares, and dish soap.  The extra sink was great.   Even though the breakfast was included, we did not go down there for we so much enjoying great food outside of the hotel.  Free Wifi was convenient.  There were many shops and restaurants nearby.  Disney downtown was fun and within 5 minutes drive.  You will have to pay around $10 a day for valet parking due to limited space.  Their pool is really small, but heated.  Overall, we thought the place was nice and we will come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for the good review and positive comments, as we come to a close on our renovation we are always pleased to see the positive feedback that the project is generating. Hopefully we will see you on your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: Here are the things we like. You can purchase Anaheim Resort Transportation bus tickets at the resort and the bus stop is located just outside the hotel. There is a 7 eleven just next to the resort if you need to satisfy those late nite cravings. Valet parking is $10 a day but they are quite fast. There is an elevator  which you can use to get to your room. The wifi didn't work the first two days but it worked when we needed it on the last day. But the staff were apologetic and we were quite near the lobby, so we brought our laptop down at night.Oh and there is a printer in the lobby for you to print those tickets, coupons or boarding passes.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review and we are happy to see that you felt you received a good value for your money. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: While aware that resort is being refurbished, we found our room to be small and cramped and nothing like the pictures displayed on the web site. It was rather drab and old looking, and the furnishings looked like something that had been obtained in a garage sale. It was ok for sleeping, but not much else. The smell of paint from the floor above us was so strong that my wife was nauseous most of the time. We had to sleep with windows open. We only stay here because it is the only option on Shell near Disney (Interval has no exchange options convenient to the area). It is sad that this is Shell's feature resort in Southern Ca.
Manager Response: First and foremost I want to thank you for your honest review and apologize to you and your wife for the inconvenience of undergoing a renovation. At times despite our best efforts the construction “dust” or in this case odor are inevitable. However having said that the rooms have been completely remodeled and I am confident that all of your concerns about the furnishings to the overall design will be more than your expectations. It is a huge undertaking to completely remodel all rooms including the layout of most of the units and we are very excited for you to see the finished product. Again thank you for your feedback and we hope we can have another chance to create a wonderful memory for your family and yourself on future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: This was an all around great place to stay.  The price was one of the cheapest in the Disneyland area, especially if you booked and paid in advance, with no chance at cancellation, which is a little risky.  Some of the pros were we had 3 queen size beds, 2 different TVs, a mini-fridge, a microwave and a room safe.  The beds were comfortable and bathroom was decent, nothing fancy.  Easy access to Disney Parks.  The staff were very accomodating, and arranged for us to have adjoining rooms with the family we were traveling with.  The pool was heated, and the hot tubs were very nice. They do offer a breakfast every morning, but it's nothing to write home about.  It's not bad, but it didn't change the entire week we were there, and it was getting a little old by the last day.
Manager Response: We thank you for the recommendation and your positive comments. Valet parking is a necessity at our property due to the size of the parking available and we hope that although it is at an additional fee the service was of the highest caliber. Thank you again for your positive review and we hope to see you and your family again soon!

Summary: We were a group of 7, 4 adults, 2 boys and a 4 month old baby. We had adjacent first floor rooms at the end of a hallway and right opposite the breakfast room. The extra room in each suite was very useful. Beds are comfortable, showers worked well and were hot if needed to be so. The included breakfast had reasonable choices, including oatmeal and oranges, and provided a microwave and toaster. Have had better coffee, but tea, juices and milk were good and plentiful alternatives. The floor by floor renos had only reached the second floor, and so were not really a factor for us. Reception and maid service both very good, as was the Concierge. She works unusual hours but was very helpful. Shuttle bus service to the parks was right at the door and if one books multiple days' tickets
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the positive review, it is a huge compliment that after 38years when you returned you felt Peacock was a good place to stay when you return to the Anaheim area. We strive to provide the best experience possible and both the staff and I appreciate the acknowledgement of our efforts!

Summary Heading: Probably most suitable for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were too early to get access to our rooms so dropped off luggage at the reception.  Staff were very friendly and the reception was really nice.  There was 4 adults and we had booked 2 suites.  We headed out for the day, went for dinner and headed back to get our room keys at around 10pm.  We were given directions to our rooms - back outside away from the nice reception are and round the outside of the building, past the bars seperating the swimming pool from the pasthway on one side and the car park on the other.  First impressions weren't looking too good and unfortunately we had not been allocated the newly renovated ones as we were told there were none available.  We got to our rooms on the 2nd floor, not far from the lift and therefore the main thoroughfare for others
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review, I am glad to see the staff was friendly and helpful when learning of the challenge you faced upon entering your first units. I agree fully with your comment that there is no excuse for lack of cleanliness and rest assure when this situation was brought to light we followed up with all of our staff to ensure these things do not happen again. Furthermore I am also happy to see that you enjoyed the new rooms and I hope we are able to make a lasting impression on you and your family on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed in an "older" room. It was clean and comfortable. We had a King bed and sofa pull-out for 2 adults nad 2 children. It was adequate. There are 2 important things for me when I travel. A comfortable bed and a nice shower. This room had both. The hotel is under renovation and the construction started above us at 7am. We were aware of the renovation, so it was not a big deal. The valet parking is now $10/day plus tax. It is approx. $12/day. We were also aware of this extra cost, so it was noa big deal. The valet drivers were nice and very fast and could be see running to get the cars. We also took advantage of the ART shuttle. it is inexpensive and it drops off of at the enrty of Disneyland. You can use it all day and it is nice to be able to come back in the afternoon and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for the high marks. Every guest who comes to the property is an opportunity for us to leave a lasting impression in hopes that you will return, and I am happy to see that you will consider us for your future trips to Anaheim. I am very excited to announce that the renovation is drawing to a close and I am confident that you will love the new showers!

Summary: Spent 1 night there after a 11 hour flight, reception staff were very helpful and allowed us to check in early which was a bonus, a shower and change of clothes were desperately needed.  Room was comfortable, and suited our needs.  The main bed was very comfortable and gave a great night sleep.  The renovations did not impact on our stay so I cannot comment.  The  location is close to everything, and having arrived with no knowledge of the area it was great to start walking and see what we could find, the proxmity to Disneyland, Downtown Disney and local stores (Mini markets), restaurants was well within walking distance.  The pool and BBQ area area appeared to be well kept and  a great area for families to relax in.  Very impressed with the children activities that they have
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and compliments to the staff, it is always the goal for all guests to be comfortable and I am happy to see we were able to achieve that for you and your family.

Summary: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Peacock Suites.  We had a few Shell Vacation Explorer points left to use and had planned to go to Disneyland, so it worked out perfect.  The hotel is currently under renovation. We knew this prior to arrival. We never had any disruption from the construction, however, we were usually gone by 10am and back after 8p. So I cannot attest to any complaints regarding the construction.  We had a one-bedroom suite. I would describe this room as a divided suite rather than a 1 bedroom suite. As you enter the room, you immediately encounter the bathroom vanity/sink, and the toliet/shower in it's own room directly across from the vanity. The "bedroom" is close to follow and then the "living room" area. A sliding glass/wood door and curtain divide
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback, all of us here at the property enjoy reading reviews that are both detailed and informative. A small insight into your experience is invaluable and we appreciate you sharing this not only with the management here at the property but also our potential future guests and owners. The rooms have in fact been renovated and I am confident that you will be very excited and proud of what we have done! We look forward to seeing you and your family on future visits to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed for a sports tournament. We have stayed here before because of the location to the American sports center. Disappointed with not being told of water shutoff and times which unfortunately was in afternoon one day after tournament with tired sweaty high school boys. It was off about 3 hours for 2 days of the 4 we stayed. Laundry room not open, had to go offsite to wash teams uniforms every night. Internet difficult to access, gave up sending my son's homework to teacher on email. And lastly, drywall screw gun installation noise made it difficult to take afternoon nap. Room clean, decent, but don't think it was worth 144.00/day. On checkout, I was asked about the stay and told them I was disappointed and should have been told about the construction when making reservations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a find this place is! Amazing room, so clean, brilliant breakfast included, free wifi and parking! All for under $80 per night! Less than a mile to Disneyland ! These rooms have a woman's touch to them and have been well thought out! Great place! Equivalent to a three to four star in Australia!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and i stayed at the Peacock Suites a few months back for the Halloween Holiday specials at Disneyland. We took a gamble on this hotel not knowing anything about it or knowing anyone who's stayed there. We were so pleased with our stay! We stayed for a week and we were a bit concerned with what to do the day's we would not be a Disneyland. Candy at the front desk told us about the hotel's activities program. She gave us a copy of the weeks schedule and introduced us to Cami (spelling?) who was a wonderful lady. She immediatley greeted my two kids who love her! She invited us to each days events and even told us of some fun things to do outside the hotel that were of little to no cost! Which was such a wonderful gesture. My kids loved all the ice cream events and we
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a 1 bedroom for 1 night.  It slept 4 very comfortably.  The TV lounge area in the suite was perfect...kids could have a bit of their own space that way.  Check in and out was easy.  If you are going to Disneyland the location is great, with it being only a couple blocks away from main gate.  From what I understand there was a breakfast included however we didn't have it.  Free wifi was nice.  The beds were very comfy and the room was very clean.  the bathroom was however very small and the sink area was in the entrance to the unit which was not easy to work around.  I think it will be very nice once the renos are finished.  All in all a good place for a couple nights, anymore than that you may feel to cramped
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for 1 week. First we got this hotel at a very cheap price as it was my in laws time share. So price wise i cant really complain (we paid just over $300 for our one week stay). So positives are: 1. Location - its a short drive to Disneyland and if you want to ride the shuttle bus it comes every 30 minutes and costs $4 for a full day ticket. The bus stops at another 3 hotels from memory on the way to Disneyland (Peacock being the first stop) and on the way home it is the first stop also on its route. So yes very convenient and the bus drivers are very friendly and helpful. also nearby is the Cheesecake Factory and some other restaurants and shops. 2. The breakfast - i know its just boiled eggs and toast and juice and pastries but when Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were open and spacous,clean, and the staff was really great. The lady in the gift store was really sweet and helpful. Valet men were very quick to get my car and very accurate of information of what was in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a one bedroom unit for 4 nights booking through Shell Vacations as we are Direct Member and found the room a bit smaller than we expected but it did have everything we need. Free wifi works fine and there is a computer with printer for guest use at the lobby. The 4th floor is under renovation but we don't find any noise or any inconvenience.   The staff are very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. It's a good choice if you plan to visit Disneyland as its just few minutes away. There is a fee for compulsory valet parking but the service was good and efficient.   The complimentary breakfast was fine but you want something else after having it for the first couple of days. There is McDonald's and IHOP just minutes away if you choose to eat somewhere else.   It
Manager Response: We appreciate the kind words about the staff and service you received during your visit to the property! We look forward to seeing you and your family again soon!

Summary: stayed in a 1 bedroom that said it fit 6, yes it did have bed space for 6 but it was very tight not much room between the bed and the wall. Not extra room for luggage or standing bodies. breakfast was pretty bad. We got  a reasonable rate and not a bad walk to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a nice resort but with very small rooms.  Convenient to Disneyland via a paid shuttle bus.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  They were just beginning a total refurbishing of the property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite for a week through a timeshare gift from my grandparents. Checking in was great - the staff were helpful and friendly, and even though we checked in at about 8am, they were still able to find us a room to go straight into. I was a little disappointed with the room - was expecting more of an apartment style room like we have here in Australia, but it was just like a normal hotel room but with the bedroom separate. There was a microwave and kettle, but we certainly weren't able to make our own meals or anything. The water pipes were very noisy, and anytime any of our neighbours had a shower or went to the toilet it woke us up. Our bathroom door wouldn't close, but they organised for someone to come up to fix it for us. It was a decent walk to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: How can you say you have an amenity if it is not available?
Summary: This hotel is not worth the price. First, when we booked our stay one of the stated amenities was a laundry room. This is pretty important to us since we have three kids and we cannot possibly pack all the clothes they would need for a week. However, AFTER we checked in they informed us that they are under construction and the laundry room was unavailable! We were never informed of this prior to reserving this hotel. Had we been we would have reserved another hotel. The solution they offered to us, after we complained about this, was that there is a laundromat a few blocks away. They offered no restition or true apology for having lied to us about such an important amenity. Second, the room we stood in was very poorly layed out. When you walk into the room you walked into a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here with another couple while 2 of our group attended a conference nearby. We really could not find anything to complain about. We are Shell Vacations owners and while most Shell resorts we have stayed in have had more amenities ( eg. full kitchen) this was partly offset by the complimentary breakfast. We had a 2 bdrm. which was very spacious and the service provided by both the cleaning and front desk staff was excellent. The location was close to stores and restaurants and while a shuttle could take you to Disney, it was only a 20 min. (adult) walk. The breakfast provided did become a little repetitive if you were staying for a number of days and there were lots of kids around , but it is near Disneyland so what would you expect.The nearby restaurants would satisfy
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of four stayed for eight nights in October and we thought Peacock Suites offered excellent value.  Our room had two queen beds and a separate lounge area which had a brand new pull out sofa bed (did not use this).  The lounge area was great and meant if someone was sleeping they were not disturbed.  We found this set up a million times better than one hotel room.  Our room was quiet and very clean. The pool was great for a cool down during the heat of the day, kids loved it. The service at reception was fantastic and the valet was just as good.    Breakfast was a bit odd, we are not used to donuts and pastries for breakfast but there was cereal, toast and fruit which was something to start the day with.  ART shuttle leaves right out the front but the best part is
Manager Response: none

Summary: First stay at the Peacock in September. Loved the location Tram stop right in front! Easy walk to Gardenwalk shops and resteraunts Great staff!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a timeshare with shell here. The hotel is great except that the halls are open and the community smoking areas are underneath them. This causes the halls to reek of cigarette smoke. It's a shame because the staff and valets are so awesome!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here with my husband and two young children for a week. I thought it was a good value for the price. The pool is small but heated and the kids actually loved the fact that they could swim from one side to the other. The rooms were pretty big with the sofa sleeper put away and about average-size with it out. The sofa sleeper was new and remarkably comfortable. The rooms were also quite clean. You have to pay for parking (common in California) and they don't have a free shuttle to the theme parks but they do have a stop for the public shuttle right outside the hotel and it comes quite frequently. If you have kids staying in the room above you plan on hearing the pitter-patter of little feet. We got a lot of it but were sympathetic, as we had wound-up kids as well. It can
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rooms clean and close to Disneyland.
Summary: Stayed here for 7 nights. Room had 2 double beds and pull out sofa bed. Microwave, toaster, and refrigerator. Heated pool was a bit cold and pool area was undercover. Continental breakfast was fine, cereal, toast, muffins, pastries and hard boiled eggs. Staff were helpful, although I found 1 to be very pushy wanting us to book a Hollywood tour through her rather than helping us with our enquiry about taking the train to hollywood. We ended up googling directions because she was so insistent on us booking the tour - ended up saving about $300 doing it our way!! Housekeeping were absolutely wonderful and very accommodating when we neededAmoretti shampoo ect. Shuttle bus to disney stops right outside hotel and is the first drop off destination from disney. Cheesecake Factory is
Manager Response: none

Summary: good place, staff was nice rooms were good and walking distance to the park. For the price you cant beat it we paid 69.00 a night plus 8.00 dollars a day to park . I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when you go to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed at Peacock Suites for 5 days for a family vacation to Disneyland.  We had a great time.  The shuttle picks you up and drops you off right in front.  They pool was great when we needed a rest from Disneyland.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  The only issue we had was the noisy people above us, we could hear then running around all night.  Kind of frustrating when you are tired.  I would definitely recommend Peacock Suites, and when we come back to Disneyland again, we will definitely stay here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Made this our HQ for a trip to Disneyland.  Nice size rooms, clean, and good continental breakfast.  Anaheim Resort Transportation stops right outside the hotel, every 20 minutes.  The Peacock Suites are the first stop going to the park and the first stop leaving the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We own a week at Peacock Suites, and at first, we were grateful for the proximity to Disneyland, but after this fourth stay, we are happy with our ownership for so many reasons: the staff is very accommodating, the entire hotel is family friendly, and even though they try to get you to attend an owner's update, the concierge isn't pushy and doesn't make us feel like horrible people for preferring to enjoy our vacation instead of sitting in a presentation for three hours. We love that the rooms (and especially the bathrooms for me!) are clean with enough space for everyone to stretch out. We appreciate that improvements to the hotel are continuously happening (the pool area and Peacock Park looked great!), and we are looking forward to staying there again next year! My son calls
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spacious rooms, great location, service oriented staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have a timeshare there. Only thing I don't like is they push the timeshare stuff.  Rooms nice and clean, breakfast good, variety. Really close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved staying here (we stayed Dec '09) and found it a great base for Disneyland, LA and Hollywood.    The rooms are spacious and clean, the breakfast is free, there is a guest laundry and, best of all, the room rates were VERY reasonable!  We walked to Disney every day - why wait for the shuttle bus when it's just a 10 min walk?  At the time our boys were 9 and 11 and they handled the walk easily.  Let's face it, if you have a hard time walking for 10 mins you shouldn't be going to Disneyland where you'll be walking all day long.  I read all the reviews on Tripadvisor before booking this hotel and many suggested that you ask for a room in the back of the hotel as there is a commercial laundry next door that is operational all night.  We asked for a room at the back, got one

Summary Heading: Clean, Reasonably priced and Well Managed with an Awesome Staff
Summary: We recently visited Anaheim to celebrate my Mothers 80th birthday and considering the significance of the event and the fact she had never been to California it was very important to us that the accommodations be appropriate. We were not disappointed by this property, from the moment we arrived the facility staff were warm, helpful and professional. Given the extraordinary competition that exists for holiday accommodations in the Anaheim area, it is clear that the manageable variable that can and does make the difference is customer service. Without exception the staff at Peacock Suites were outstanding, regardless of the position on the staff or the shift being worked (a smile from the night shift workers at 0530 was notable) they provided great service with a genuine concern

Summary Heading: MAN WE MISS THIS PLACE & THE PEOPLE!!!
Summary: This is one awesome hotel! Nice rooms & Great people! You just can't beat it! This place takes such good care of us! that even with business and we have to stay elsewhere...we still always try to stop by & say hi to the staff! they are like our extended family! we miss them when we are not there! great location from disney! angels stadium! ducks stadium! few minutes to huntington beach/surf city with the best surfing! knotts berry farm is right up the freeway! Whatever you want is within reach and then you can come back and relax!  don't  hesitate to stay here! the breakfast is nice out on the balcony to start your day off right! grab an orange for the day and just have fun here!!! tell them ray & susan sent you!!! and the girls like chocolate & starbucks! LOL

Summary: From the moment we arrived this hotel has let us down.  Our room was not ready even though they knew we were in the area for 4 hours (apparently it takes that long to clean one room) and then the people above us could not contain their silly children. The hotel would only call them and request they calm down.  The stomping lasted literally 4 days and was loud enough to wake the dead.  The recommended Hollywood Express tour was a huge let down and NOT WORTH the $55 per person we paid.  He left us stranded at a dinner show and said that is what we wanted it that way.  He was totally rude at the end too.  Stay SOMEWHERE ELSE!!

Summary Heading: A great place close to disneyland and family oriented
Summary: Peacock Suites is close to Disneyland and  in walking distance to great restaurants. You can have wonderful suites with huge beds and a separate living room for watching TV. After a full day, i can either swim in the heated pool or spa. The rooms are spacious. I have been coming to Peacock Suites for vacation and relaxation for years.

Summary: I stayed here because i got a great deal through a Groupon-type Email and we were thrilled with the little suite. I didn't care for the $8 mandatory valet parking, but this hotel is squeezed into a space on a block that clearly has less parking than rooms, and I can see why they do it. The staff are very formal, which is odd since they are so closely associated with the casual Disneyland experience. The pool is open late, which is nice although we didn't get to take advantage of it. There was quite a bit of activity from families checking in late at night and the hotel didn't quiet down until midnight, again probably due to family activities associated with Disneyland.

Summary: Myself, husband, 19yr son, 14yr daughter, and another adult couple stayed one week at Peacock Suites and had a great time.    Our room was updated and clean.  Everything we needed for the week and room for all of us (6 people) Two queen beds, 1 couch pullout, and a pull down from the wall Queen size bed.  We are more about enjoying the surroundings and normally don't care where we stay as long as we can just sleep comfortably and it surpassed all that.  Two TV's, privacy with that amount of people, room to move and comfortable and clean.  Breakfast was fine for us: Hard boiled eggs, pastries, cereal & milk, coffee, juices, toast and jelly.    The sunroof was really really nice.  Head out with a beer and just relax.  Only complaint I have was the hours.  Everything closed down at

Summary: I felt really cramped and sufficated in the space provided. There is a window overlooking roof tops! The room is long narrow path. Summary: WIth every hotel there are pros and cons.  I found more pros than cons with this place.  I am a Shell owner, so that is why we stayed.  We booked two rooms because there were two adults and FIVE children in our party.  Con was the kids room was not close, which is a pro depending on how you look at it.  Pros' the rooms were large enough to accomodate us.  The kids had double beds and a couch easily sleep 6 in that room.  We had the King and couch easily sleeps 4 comfy. Summary: We a family of five from Australia went on our annual family vacation to the USA for one month. We spent two weeks at Disneyland in California. This can make it quite expensive when you are away from home for so long. Plus it's not quite the same when you are not altogether. Peacock Suites is great.
