Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved our stay! can't Wait to come Back!
Summary: My family and i stayed here for a week and how glad are we that we did! Upon check in a very friendly young man helped us out from Brea with brown short spiked hair (can't remember name, maybe ) who was wonderful! The valet was so kind and cheerful and such a breath of fresh air after our long road trip. The room was fine, but we didn't spend much time in it, we were having too much fun at Disney and down by the pool. for the time we did spend at the hotel, my kids really enjoyed themselves, such a blessing to us parents! Not only was the pool and ping pong table great activities, but the Activities Coordinator Kami was just wonderful! She saw my son peeping into the Breakfast Room and offered him a Root Beer float, he ran downstairs with such a grin and had his sister and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites as part of a family reunion and the hotel and staff were wonderful!  The rooms, pool, hot tub, pink pong table, fooseball table as well as the proximity to Disneyland and the shuttle made for a great vacation.  The area is undergoing a bit of reconstruction, so it's a little rough right now, but we also walked to Anaheim Marketplace which was a great shopping experience.    We would absolutely stay there again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We liked it, would stay there again
Summary: Booked this through online travel service, recommened. We had hard time finding a nice hotel for 5 people. The suites were OK sized, but there is a sliding door between our 2 queen beds and the other room had a pull out sofa. Youngest daughter had this room all to herself, she must have felt royal. Plus, TV in each area, larger than normal room fridge, decent sized armoire and had just enough drawer space. Was very clean. You can tell it is a family suite though and probably used hard, some of the drawers were scuffed, minor scratches on table, but this is not a Hyatt. For the price, location and overall quality, this is above PAR on most places we have stayed at. Weigh in the price, and it tops some of the most expensive places we stayed at. You do pay for parking, but it is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, but nothing special
Summary: We spent a week at the Peacock Suites Hotel while enjoying all of the Southern California attractions.  After checking in and unpacking, someone else opened our door with their own card-key.  Needless to say we were not impressed and called down to the front desk.  We were told we had to move rooms and had to argue to keep the room we had already unpacked in. The continental breakfast was pretty good, but not environmentally friendly at all as everything was plastic and styrofoam.  The shuttle stop was right outside the hotel, which was very convenient, making our stay better over the long run, but I don't think we'd stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, roomy and close to Disney!
Summary: We just got home from a 2 night stay at the Peacock Suites. This was our 3rd stay.   We stayed with our three young children in a two-bedroom suite while spending two days at Disneyland.   Upon check in the staff was friendly, the valet fast and courteous (opening the door for me every time), and the room was wonderful! Nice to have separate sleeping quarters for us away from the kids.    Location was close to Disney, they do offer a shuttle but we drove our car since we have passes and parking was included.  Room was clean, tons of towels (important!), and really nothing to complain about except that the couch could be replaced in our little living area. No biggie to me, we were there solely to sleep and be close to the park!  We will return again! Great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We traded for a timeshare week at this Shell Vacations Property.  We have stayed at many of the hotels close to Disneyland and this one was one of the nice.  By timeshare standards, the suite is small, however nicely appointed and very comfortable.  2 rooms separated by a sliding 'french door' which shut out noise between the sleeping area & living area.  Although the room sleeps 6 (2 Queens & sofa sleeper in separate 'living room') I don't see how 6 people would have enough room to share the suite.  It is just fine for 4 people.  The pool is super small ~ we weren't motivated to use it after seeing it, but kids looked like they were enjoying it.  Josh @ check in was wonderful and accomodated my need for 2 Queens (vs. 1 King bed).  Our room was along the back of the property and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to call home for a week!
Summary: Our group ranged in age from 6 months to 82 years old.  All of us were very happy with our accommodations, and would choose to stay at Peacock Suites anytime we travel to Anaheim.  I wasn't real sure going in how the mandatory valet service would be, but let me tell you, those guys are great!  Any time we needed our cars, they had them up front in just a matter of minutes.  We purchased a 3 day pass on the shuttle service, and it was wonderful to get back and forth to Disneyland.  Our next trip we will plan better, and make use of the grills that they have.  The continental breakfasts were fine, could always find something that would fill you up.  A great place to stay, and everyone was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good value hotel in a handy location
Summary: Rooms are very much like they are on the website, small for 4 people but manageable.  Very clean and rooms include tv, fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and hairdryer.  Comfortable double bed with 3/4th bed being a pull-out sofa which did have a rather thin mattress.  Quite small swimming pool and roof-top sun area which looked lovely but we did not use.  Location was close enough to walk to Disney and a short drive to Knotts Berry Farm, Medieval Knights etc and right by the motorway for access in to LA itself - be warned that the traffic in to LA is very heavy and it is a slow slow drive at all times of the day.  Breakfast was provided and consisted of cereals, pastries, toast facilities, juices and tea/coffee, fruit.  The biggest downside for us was that you had to use
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a nice time at Peacock Suites. It was about a mile to Disneyland walking, but the nice thing was that there was a shuttle right in front of Hotel parking lot, which was $4 ea. or you could get a discount for more days in the office. The room was just ok. There is a laundry service next to the hotel that during the weekdays a very loud noise wakes you up and scares the crap out of you!!!!!! O at 3:00 am!!!! Service was great and they changed our room right away. The cont. breakfast was good. The pool was fun and the little activities were cute too.  Loved the gift shop actually bought my gifts there. Prices were great!!!! I would stay there again with my family!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Another good stay at the Peacock Suites
Summary: This was my third stay at the Peacock Suites and once again it was a very nice trip.  We had a Two bedroom suite which we booked with our Bluegreen points.  The suite (Room 322) was very large, with a Master bedroom with it's own full bath and another bedroom with two double beds and a hall bathroom.  In the living room, there is a mini fridge, microwave and dinette.   I'll assume that the couch pulled out to a bed, but we didn't need it, so I'm not sure.  There is a heated pool and two hottubs, that aren't anything super fancy, but we didn't use them this trip.  In the past, they have been good.   The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the Disney main gate.    The only problem at all this trip was that an indrustrial dry cleaning facility that is nearby made an excessive
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A short walk to Disney, Close to Gardenwalk, Free Breakfast, Free Wi-Fi, Pool/Hot tub, what else do you need?
Summary: This hotel covers the basics well, be advised of the mandatory $8 per day valet charge, but since the hotel has very tight parking, I guess it is better than ending up with a big dent or scrape on your car.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient, nice rooms, friendly, good breakfast
Summary: The concierge was very helpful. Location is great, Disneyland bus stops right in front. Rooms are large and comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Peacock suites was a great value. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. My husband and I really enjoyed the roof deck it was a very nice addition and a great place to hang out. We didn't use the pool but we were surprised by it. It's not just a pool. They have two spas, an awesome mural and what looked like a kids fountain thing. And a flat screen tv!! We appreciated the extra step they took to make that space fun. The garden walk is very close and had so many choices of restruants. We ate at bubba gumps, by recommendation of one of the front desk staff. It was great. Our last night there we took advantage of the BBQ which was free to use (including the utensils) after we ate, we played fooseball. We were so blown away by the "extras" we would recommend this hotel to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed there for 7 nights over spring break.   The front desk staff was not the most friendly or helpful I've ever met. We arrived mid-morning and while we didn't expect to be able to check in then, we were very frustrated that they didn't have our room ready until after the stated 4 p.m. check in time. If they knew we were there and ready to check in, couldn't they have gotten our room ready in a more timely fashion? At least they let our kids swim in the pool for some of the time we were waiting.   Also at check in time, they had a hard time finding our phone and e-mail request of moving to a larger room. With much pressure from us, they finally "found" one of those requests. But it still wasn't the room we had requested.  The next day we asked to purchase 3-day ART passes.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don’t Waste Your Time or Money on this Clueless Dive / Many Better Options Are Available / ABUSE OF CREDIT CARD / RODENT
Summary: I am a Tour Operator with 25 years experience in booking groups into hotels across the USA.  When a hotel tells me that they are a “Student Friendly” hotel and that they are well versed in the needs of accommodating high school bands, it would automatically be assumed that they have actually worked with “Student Groups” in the past and would be well aware of the needs and requirements that a student group, or any other “group” would need.  I told my hotel contact in an email three weeks prior to our check in that the group would be arriving by 2 motor coaches.  There are no accommodations whatsoever for the transportation requirements for groups or any auxiliary equipment vehicles.  I was not made aware of this fact until 2 days before the group arrival when I did a pre-arrival
Manager Response: I would like to take the time to address the comments listed in the above review. Here at Peacock Suites we value the feedback from our guests and appreciate all negative, positive, or indifferent responses, as it will only continue to help us better serve our guests. However it is equally important to decipher the true from the false so that all of our potential guests will have a clear view of our property and the service for which we are noted.  To explain in detail a group recently visited Peacock Suites and during this visit there were some miss communications with the parking situation of the (2) two tour busses that would be arriving. However per the group contract every term and condition was fulfilled regarding these buses. Having touched on that it is important that the fallacies of this review are explained as well. In no conversation with the contact for this group during or after the stay was there any mention of bugs or rodents in our rooms. We pride ourselves on cleanliness and work hard to uphold the standard to which our guests have become accustom. As stated above we appreciate honest reviews that are meant to help both the hotel as well as future guests, unfortunately we do not receive the same valid information we all deserve from this particular review. As we spoke many times before, I am always available to discuss this situation in further detail in hopes that you can walk away satisfied.  In closing I hope that all past and potential future guests who may stumble across these comments are able to look further at the many other reviews that have earned us the 4 out of 5 rating. We look forward to being able to offer you and your family a positive vacation experience in the future.

Summary: I'm here with a girls volleyball team, we're here for a huge tournament. We were able to negotiate a very nice rate. The hotel is very convenient to our venues and, of course, the Disney parks. The rooms are large and there's a nice living area with kitchen amenities, fridge, microwave, toaster, plates and utensils. The staff has been very helpful and accommodating. It's unfortunate about the valet parking but it's fine ($8 per night). The beds are comfortable and the sheets are nice and crisp. All in all the Peacock exceeded my expectations, I'll be back when the opportunity arises.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service.  Will stay here again.
Summary: I, like other reviewers, have chosen this hotel soley based on the fact that it is the only option in our timeshare for the LA area.  We have stayed here possibly 4-5 times and have not had a bad experience.  In the past, we were able to use the the tram to get to Disneyland.  The 1 mile walk is not too far in the am, but by the afternoon, with tired kiddos, it is better to use the tram.   With this visit, when we went to check in we were informed that b/c of a maintenance issue, we did not have a room avail, but that reservations were already made for us at another hotel only about 5 mins away.  This could have been a huge inconvenience, but the staff were trying very hard to make the transition easy.  Things happen and it is surely not the guy behind the counter's fault.  The
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife, me, daughter, son-in-law, and 2 yr old grandson stayed at the Peacock Suites for 3 nights arriving Mar 3 and departing Mar 6.  My daughter had stayed there before and recommended it as a close place to stay near Disneyland, our destination for the weekend.  All seemed fine when we checked in.....the front desk staff was friendly & efficient and the valet parking staff was same.  OBTW, if you stay there you must valet the car at $8.00/night + tips.  We got to our room (No. 238) which faced the parking area, and it was fine with a small living area and a bedroom section with a king bed.  There is a dorm refrigerator and microwave in every room.  It seemed o.k.  This hotel caters to families with kids and has an outdoor heated pool and 2 jacuzzis but the big disapointment
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, I would like to take this time to personally apologize for the experience you and your family had with us. As a management team we take guest feedback seriously and appreciate you taking the time to share your experiences on your recent visit with us.  In response to your above comments I want to clarify some of what you listed. First and foremost thank you for the kind words about the staff, we always strive to be friendly and exceed expectations, having said that my biggest concern was your question regarding the concrete sealant that was applied during your stay.  The sealant did have an odor and for that we apologize, however the sealant used was in fact non-toxic and was applied in an open air environment. It was done by a professional crew and we were provided with an MSDS (Material Safety Data Sheets) to assure the non-toxicity of the sealant. As stated above although the smell of the sealant was not pleasant, it was a necessary part of the finished product and we took every step to make it as seamless as possible for our guests. Again I offer an apology to you and your family for having to endure the smell, but be assured we would never put you or any of our guests in harm’s way.    Lastly I want to acknowledge the housekeeping issues you have explained. Cleanliness is our top priority and we do everything we can to maintain pristine standards. I have personally followed up with every comment you have listed and I truly do appreciate your feedback. If you would like to speak in more detail please do not hesitate to call me at the property directly. Thank you again for staying with us, we hope you might visit us again and see the service for which we are noted.

Summary: Stayed for 8 nights through our RCI timeshare. Didn't really want to stay at this property but was all that was available in the L.A area for the dates we wanted. Very, very close to Disney but very far for L.A attractions. Rented a hybrid so gas wasn't as much of an issue as it would have normally been, if staying at this hotel and want to do more than disney highly reccomend a hybrid. The staff is really friendly and everyone seems more than willing to help with your needs.   Hotel was about a 40 minute drive from LAX, check-in was quick and easy, we had two separate reservations but it was easily sorted out by the front desk. After reading many reviews we were concerned about previous comments with the laundry company that is located right next door to the resort, it was said
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay at the Peacock Suites from Feb 13-20.  We had a group of 12, that ranged in age from 2 preschoolers, 2 teens, 2 in their early 20's, 2 30 year olds, 2 40 year olds and a couple in their 60's.  This place had something to offer everyone, and we were all very comfortable in our three suites.  All public spaces were well kept, staff friendly, suites met our needs and the hot tub a treat at the end of a long day of walking.  I don't want to repeat a lot of what has been said, but have a couple of things to add that I hope will help you with your stay:  Taxi from John Wayne Airport - less than $40 for six of us.  7-11 - the prices at this location were quite good compared to grocery stores in the area.  They have a wide variety of options, including sushi (which
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't understand what other reviewers are complaining about,, We stayed there feb.11th    thru the 17th. We got a 2 bedroom suite with plenty of space and 2 bathrooms that were good size.. There was a dining table, toaster, microwave, mini refrigerator and dishes for 4. the roof deck was beautiful and what a great view after dark and you see all the lights. Hot tubs, the jets all worked and the water was hot. The pool was heated and not a bad size. There was a hugh flat screen you can watch from the hot tubs. The laundry room was clean and all machines worked. The breakfast is continental. I don't know what people expect there was boiled eggs, toast, cereal, croussants, donuts, danish, and muffins. milk, orange juice, coffee, hot tea and fresh oranges..Also I was one of those
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Sweet to have a suite, but know the pluses and minues before booking
Summary: This was my second, possibly third stay at Peacock Suites. I have a Disneyland season pass and live in Northern California so am always looking for good value in hotels, and I have had some awesome deals at Peacock Suites. This time, an adult was to sleep on the sofabed so I asked for a room with a newish one, if possible. We were given a room with a regular sofa and a double-sized Murphy (pull-down) bed, which turned out to be quite comfortable.   However, I had forgotten TripAdvisor warnings about the linen laundry on one side of the hotel. Luckily they are closed weekends, but on Friday when we got there and starting early Monday there was an extremely loud whistle, think giant tea kettle, which puts an end to any plans for sleep. Bear that in mind! Also right now the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Adequate but wouldn't go there again
Summary: The apartment was comfortable, beds, good bathrooms, etc however the general facilities (eg laundry, breakfast room, etc) were very average.  Breakfast was included but was awful so we didn't bother. We arrived on a Saturday and found the room quite which was good, until Monday morning when we were woken by a terrible noise that did not stop.  That's when we found out we were right next door to a commercial laundry.  Don't stay on that side of the building during the week.  The other parts of the complex (and it was huge) may be ok.  It was a reasonable price and served its purpsoe but I'm sure there are better options in Anaheim.  I would not recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay!  Good Value while visiting Disney
Summary: Enjoyed our week stay at the Peacock Suites while visiting Disneyland!  The continental breakfast that was included with our room was very handy in the morning.  The breakfast room had a nice assortment of cereal, danishes, hard bolied eggs, toast, juices and oranges.  The shuttle to Disneyland stops at the hotel every 20 mintues and was easy to take (even though we had rented a car we ended up just taking the shuttle to Disney).  Our King bed was very comfortable and the room spacious.  The staff at the hotel and valet was very friendly.  We also found the laundry facility very handy.  Our only complaint with the room would be the pull out sofa matress, they are in need of beign replaced.  Other than that we had an excellent stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: For the rate, don't expect too much!
Summary: I booked this room for my 3 year old son, husband and I  for 1 night while visiting Disneyland. We couldn't beat the government rate of $69. With that being said.... you get what you pay for so dont expect too much from this hotel. The hotel is a bit out of the way from Disneyland so dont expect to walk but will drop you off at the gate for a nominal fee. There is also an $8 mandatory valet fee and the valet service are very quick to get your car out to you whenever you need it. The hotel is old and the furniture is in desperate need of some upgrading. The rooms were clean. The rooms were small but bed was very comfortable. The room had 2 large tv's and dvd players which we really liked. The pool area is very nice with a small heated pool and 2 jacuzzi's. It also had nice chaise
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to make a comment about your recent stay, we are happy to hear it was enjoyable. Your comments mean a lot to us and we pride ourselves on listening to our guests and continuing to strive to provide the best experience possible. I hope we are able to accommodate you during your future visits to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights at the Peacock Suites to be close to Disneyland.  The location is close and there is a hotel/disneyland shuttle that stops right outside the hotel (daily fee required).  Also pretty close to Anaheim GardenWalk with access to restaurants and other activities (shopping).  The rooms are a little cramped and inconveniently arranged.  The living room is on the opposite end of the suite from the restroom, separated by the sleeping room.  This can be disturbing in the morning or late night "potty breaks".  The decor is a little dated as well, but adequate.  The beds are comfortable.  The breakfast is simple at best.  Danishes, toast, cereal, boiled eggs, juice and coffee is the extent of the 'free' items.  Hot breakfast sandwiches can be purchased.  The pool is covered
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback we appreciate your nice comments in regards to the Valet service and the hotel. We hope to see you and your family during your future visits to Anaheim!

Summary Heading: They had a very good web photographer!
Summary: Our overall stay was a good one, but the photos on the web made the hotel seem more upscale than it actually was.  One thing that the web failed to mention was there is an $8.00 mandatory valet fee if you have a car.  The rooms are a somewhat tattered with furniture from the late '80's early '90's.   The continental breakfast consists of "Hostess" powdered sugar donuts, cheerios, and hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee,  milk, toast......Bedding: the pillows were misshapen fiber filled pillows and there was "pilling" on the pillow cases not being of a decent thread count.  There is a concierge who will call you for your free certificate if you and your spouse are present....it's similar to the sales people in Mexico trying to get you to buy into their resort...you sit for a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments and for giving an honest review. Feedback these days is priceless and without it we cannot continue to grow and get better at what we do. I wanted to apologize for the noise you experienced during your stay as it is always our goal to create a relaxing yet exciting environment for our guests. I hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future so we may show you the service in which we are known for.

Summary Heading: I can't say enough good things about this hotel!
Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites the week before Christmas and the staff was amazing.  I had groceries and strollers delivered to the hotel and they took them up to our room and even unloaded the groceries.  Amazing customer service!!  The rooms were a bit small but they at least had the separate living area. It also helped that my parents were in the adjoining room.  I also would say I would not sleep on the sofa bed.  It was fine for my 6 year olds but I am not sure any adult would find them comfortable.  The beds were very nice though.    Plenty of room to make lunch to take to Disneyland and dishes to eat in the room if we wished.  We were there the week of the torrential downpours in Southern California.  The staff was so courteous and helpful  The maid staff gave us extra
Manager Response: Wow! What a great review and thank you very much for your kind words! I have shared all of your comments with the staff and we truly look forward to serving you and your family again in the future!

Summary: The Peacock Suites is located nice and close to Disneyland, there is an Anaheim Resort Shuttle that stops at the hotel that will take you to Disneyland. (tickets can be bought at the front desk) There is donuts/danishes that are served every morning that makes things extremely easy for breakfast in the morning. The service levels of all staff members was at a high level, it is clear that management has trained/recognized them well! I would recommend this resort to any friend that was going to be in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and compliments of the staff and their training. It has always been and will remain our main focus to serve our Guests and Owners to the best of our ability! We look forward to seeing you and your family again on future visits to Anaheim!

Summary: A friend and I recently spent 4 nights at Peacock Suites so that we could go to Disneyland. The location was wonderful. It was a .6 mile walk to the entrance to the parks according to Mapquest. We bought the 3 day bus pass from the hotel and felt it was good value ($10). The bus picked us up in front of the hotel and then made stops at two more hotels to pick up passengers. It took between ten and fifteen minutes to get from the hotel to the park. When coming home, Peacock was the first stop again,so we were home in five minutes. Talk about convenient!!! We bought the Disney passes from the hotel. They were less than it would have been to buy them at the parks, but about 5 dollars more than it would have been to buy them online and print them out. However, this way we did not
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Peacock is our new hotel in Anaheim!!
Summary: My family of 5 arrived early afternoon after a long drive, Candy was at the front desk and was extremely helpful and friendly.  It was hours before check in and she went out of her way to come tell us while waiting at the ART stop that the room would be ready in ten minutes....what a relief!  This allowed us to get changed and relax for a few before entering the parks.  The room was very clean and not as small as I had expected based on other reviews.  Valet parking was fine and they were more than accomodating every time we needed our car pulled out.  Breakfast was fine, the typical continental but they did have hard boiled eggs which made it complete for us!  My children enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi each night and they were very clean.  I cant say that it was perfect but it
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay on a small budget
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in November.  The staff was excellent & the breakfast was fine.  The rooms were clean and we saved a wad- I would stay here again in a heartbeat.  Close to the Cheesecake Factory....yum!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Slightly dated, but large rooms and good location
Summary: Good value, friendly staff, good parking.  15 mins walk to Disney, wouldn't bother getting shuttle unless you have small kids.  Very large rooms with lounge and bedroom, dated proably early - mid nineties style but very clean and comfortable.  Quiet also.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in November 2010 in room 133.  The front desk staff were very nice and helpful.  The hotel, however, is in need of some serious work.  The fire alarm was hanging off the ceiling in our room.  We were also right next to the elevator, so you could hear it all night long going up and down.  The walls are very thin, and you can hear your neighbours, beside you and above you.  The windows also pretty porous to sound and noise.  The location is good, about 15 mins to the maingate of Disneyland.    All in all, I wouldn't stay here again, even if it was very inexpensive for a basic suite.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was hesitant to book this hotel, but I'm glad I did. We went for a sort of weekend getaway and Peacock was perfect for that. Granted, I did feel a little cramped at times and was not too impressed with the continental breakfast, but really it was perfect for couples or families who want to do Disney without spending too much. Plus, who hangs out in their room anyway? The shuttle is only four bucks a day and very convenient, but beware, get to the stop at least 5 min before it arrives. We missed the bus once and had to wait 20 min for the next one. The front desk is even really nice about letting you know when the next bus arrives. P.s. If you haven't checked out their website, do. They have a "book ahead" option that saved us even more cash.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good hotel for the price , but all the other reviews are right , the sofa sleeper mattress's need to be replaced they are so bad . My grandchildren made beds on the floor ,rather then sleeping on the sofa sleeper, Hotel told us they are being replaced, that would be my only real complaint. We took the shuttle to disneyland , $4.00 for the day and that worked great for us, That way we could go back and fourth from the park when ever we wanted to.The pool is small but the kids loved it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: OK room, boring and scanty breakfast
Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites during the second week of Oct. 2010.  I found the room on redweek.com and booked it through a private party.  Upon checking in, the front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating.  The only problem was they didn't have enough Disney flex passports to sell me.  The girl told me I could purchase them at the same reduced price at the park entrance.  Wrong!  I ended up spended more that $100 to cover the difference.  Back to the hotel.  They were great about letting us check in early, comped our parking fee (normally $8/day), had a few little gifts and snacks waiting in the room for us based on the status level of the lady I booked the room with.  The room itself is very small compared to other timeshares.  My son attempted to sleep on the fold
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an all suite hotel. It is not like the Shell Vacation Club on Kauai but being the only timeshare type it is very good. It is about one mile from Disneyland.  We flew into John Wayne airport and took SuperShuttle to the resort (15 minutes ride).  The desk staff was very nice and we we checked quickly.  We purchased the ART shuttle bus pass from the desk personnel and it picks up right in front of the resort.  Breakfast was included but the selection was only fair---cereal, rolls, coffee, juice etc.  The room did include a small microwave, small fridge and some plates in a drawer.  The only drawback was that you had to wash the dishes in the only sink--next to the bathroom.  The room was very clean and the service on site was outstanding.  Like I said--it is what it is
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Peacock Suites. Our kids are 8 & 5 yr old so we chose not to have the kids walk to Disneyland but took advantage of the 15 minutes parking (which valet told us about) and dropped them and a parent off. The other parent walked to the Park within 10 minutes. The Valet was very quick and courteous and not inconvenient at all. The breakfast each morning was the same but a nice inexpensive start to the day. Always had adequete food. The accomodations had two rooms - one with beds and one with couch, TV, fridge, micro. All was in good order. We would totally choose to stay at this location again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We got the good the bad & the FORREST
Summary: We are Shell Elite owners and as so we are promised a free room upgrade if available. When we checked in I asked about the possibility of a bigger room and was told nothing was available but to keep checking back. The following day I phoned Shell-elite number while at Disneyland to see if there were any 2 bedrooms available. I was told yes. I stopped in at the front desk a short time later and spoke with a man named Forrest. He seemed very confused and perhaps even untrained. Having vacationed at Peacock Suites more times than I can count and have usually enjoyed the caliber of employees that assist us. That unfortunately was not the case with this man. After being told quite curtly that there was no availability for a room upgrade I asked to speak with the manager. He was not
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear of the complications when trying to upgrade to a larger unit. I understand that it can be frustrating when the response is two different stories. Our availability is reflected at the hotel and should be completely transparent to Member Services and the Elite Member line as well. Ultimately I wanted to apologize for service you received at your first point of contact. As you mentioned at the end of your review you have stayed with us many times and have become familiar with Shelly one of our agents. I am pleased that she was able to assist you with your room change, as you have seen in the past this is the service we always strive to provide. Thank you very much for your feedback as it can only help to improve the property.   Thank you again for choosing the Peacock Suites!

Summary Heading: Don't be afraid, it's a good hotel and great value
Summary: Anytime we vary from mainstream, known quality hotels we are a little skeptical as we were after booking this one for 79/night. It's all good. The breakfast is donuts, hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal, juice, milk, coffee. The pool is nothing special, but clean and the kids loved it (2 hot tubs). It is located under the building, so there will never be full sun at the pool (they do have a rooftop sundeck). The valet works hard and access to the vehicle was no problem, the staff here is genuinely helpful. We enjoyed our stay and even added a day, because we were already here, the rate was tough to beat. Free WiFi, all phone calls .50. We shuttled our group of 9 to Disney in our van- then the driver took the shuttle back to the hotel and shuttle back ($4 per day/pp for shuttle).
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the second time my children & I have stayed at the Peacock Suites. It is off the main Disneyland drag so is a lot cheaper than most Anaheim hotels. The front counter staff were courteous & very helpful, and the cleaning staff were great! We would come back after a full day at Disneyland to find a lovely clean room and our stuffed animals sitting on our pilows to greet us...such a simple thing, but a very nice touch! We are coming back again next October & will be staying here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here with other couples and friends and were very happy with our stay. There is a good continental breakfast included. If you hate children, don't stay here, because they are everywhere. The pool is not that inviting with the concrete roof over it and tons of kids. Clean rooms, nice big comfy bed.

Yes the breakfast was basic & we chose to eat out,but thought if u had young kids & wanted to give them something quick & light before you set off for parks it would have been ideal(u could choose not to go for the donuts! Summary: Every time I stay at the Peacock Suites in Anaheim, CA, I am treated as if I am family. The staff is extremely friendly and conscientious about making your stay absolutely perfect. The rooms are cozy and tidy.  You won't have trouble have a good night's sleep.  The rooms we usually stay in have at least 2 queen size beds, a sitting room, and a spacious bath area.  There is usually at least 1 flat screen t.v. and another t.v. in the sitting room.  A refrigerator, microwave, flatware, dishes are available for your convenience too.  Another perk is free-wifi! The included breakfast was just average. I would like to have more than oranges and some pastries included, but hey! it was included so I did not complain. The rooms served their purpose and the bed was super comfy.  The pool wasn't real big, but it was fine for us since we were usually the only ones there when we used it.  Disney was a 10-15 minute walk and our 11 and 7 year olds did fine.  There is a mandatory $8/day valet parking fee, but it beats the alternative of parking at DL. Summary Heading: I thought the place was ok until I saw my bed bug bites....
Summary: I stayed here at the end of February with my 12 year old and my sister, her daughter and her grand daughter.  The staff was pleasant and didn't push the timeshare point much.  The room seemed to be clean although there were some marks on my sheet that I couldn't identify.  It was two blocks from the Gardenwalk where there are lots of restaurants and about a 25 minute walk to Disneyland.  However, after I returned home a found several bed bug bites.  This really grossed me out!  My sister says they are really common in Anaheim, but we go to DL almost twice a year and I have never had any before.  Sorry, but the Peacock Suites are permanently off my list.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!  We are sorry to hear about your experience when you returned home. Summary Heading: great staff, clean rooms, great location
Summary: Hi, stayed with my wife and 2 young children in a 2 queen suite, room had tv area with fold out queen bed so kids stayed in this room which was great, we were able to shut roller door over and watch tv without waking kids up. Staff were excellent, very friendly and helpfull, they booked a baseball game for me and my wife went on a tour to LA, we also purchased Disneyland tickets there also. We had a rental car so cant comment on the shuttle bus to disney. Rooms were clean and ready when we checked in, the valet service is brilliant at a more that fair price. Dont know how anybody could complain about the breakfast for one its complimentry, there is a limited chose of cereals,juice, danish,donuts,plus hot tea and coffee, its a buffet so you can eat as much as you like which is
Manager Response: We wanted to take a moment to thank you for taking the time to write about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!  We are so happy to hear that had such a nice  visit and that our staff was high on your list of what you enjoyed while here!   Thank you again for your time! We hope you will consider staying with us again on any further vistis to Anaheim!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: The ART shuttle to Disneyland stops right outside and comes every 20 minutes, and the best thing, there are only 3 stops total before getting to Disneyland - first on, first off!  The suite is the way to go with young children, and are spacious.  Cont breakfast is muffins, donuts, fruit on weekends, cereal, oatmeal, and juices. Small pool and no computer, just wifi. Best stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place if you don't value sleep ...
Summary: Ok, I'm writing this review on our third consecutive night of being kept awake til midnight from noise above our room, so I'll do my very best to be objective ...  Our initial impression of Peacock suites was fantastic ... lovely exterior, a warm friendly welcome from the gentleman at the counter and an equally warm greeting from Sandra the concierge.  We were able to check in an hour early and the room, while a little dated, was perfectly laid out for a family like ours with a seperate lounge area and a fold-out couch that our teenage daughter promptly claimed so she wouldn't have to share a bed with her little sister.  The rooms are appointed with everything we could possibly need, from two televisions and a microwave to a toaster and various items of crockery and cutlery ...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great staff, sweet suites, good price, great location.
Summary: I just returned from a two week stay in the Peacock Suites, one of the best hotel stays I've had. The staff are welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, well appointed and larger than most in the fact that all rooms are suites; that is they have a separate living and sleeping room.  When I first arrived there was a few problems (created by the last guest; they'd left the safe locked and set a parental control on the TV and left that locked). I reported the problems and a guy from maintenance come up within five minutes and fixed them. He also replaced a door handle that was sticking when he noticed it on the spot.  My room had two TVs (one in the living area and a large flat screen in the bedroom), a bath with an in bath shower (very good pressure and hot water) and
Manager Response: Hi There,  Thank you so much for the taking the time to write such nice comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites!  We truly appreciate all of the time you took to touch on the several items you did and are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you for mentioning the laundry facility next door. As you can imagine, if we had a choice of neighbors, they would not have  necessarily been our first choice but we are glad to hear that they were fairly quite during your stay!  Thank you again for your time! We look forward to having you stay with us the next time you are in Anaheim from Australia!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family!
Summary: We stayed in September, 2009. The staff is very professional and courteous at the front desk. The rooms are clean and new. A shuttle is available to and from Disneyland at a very low price. We stayed in a suite room with 3 kids and 3 adults. There is a large refrigerator in the room with a toaster, microwave, and wolfgang pucks coffee. Freshly baked chocolate chip cookies were served in the check-in room and fresh oranges. There are daily activities, like a bbq with hamburgers and hot-dogs for $1.00 each. I highly recommend this family-friendly hotel, and plan to stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the comments about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!!! We are so pleased to hear that you and your family enjoyed your visit and that you would plan to return for another stay!  We look forward to having you stay with us   again in the future! Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great hotel at a great price
Summary: Our family ( 2 adults, a 4 year old and a 5 month old ) stayed at the Peacock Suites during our recent trip to Disney and the surrounding area. We loved it. I think it is the best value for the money in Anaheim. We were specifically looking for a suite so that our two young children could have their own room. We weren't sure what to expect for the price but were pleasantly surprised. The staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, and the location was convenient. Each room in the suite has a TV / DVD player. They even stocked the room with a microwave, toaster, plates, bowls, utensils, etc.   My only minor gripes were that the continental breakfast was not that great and the A/C was a little overpowering but overall not a big deal.  Staff was great. We called for more
Manager Response: We wanted to thank you for the comments you posted about your stay at the Peacock Suites in September. .  We have passed along your thought about our staff to all of the managers to pass on to the staff, as we like for them to be aware whenever we get positive comments about them!  As far as your gripes go, I am sorry to hear that you thought our continental breakfast was "not great". It is, exactly what we say it is, a continental breakfast with cereal, oatmeal, toast, muffins, danish, donuts, fruit, coffee, juice and milk. We feel that it is a great way to start the day but understand that everyone has their own opinions about it!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Regards,  Peacock Suites Management

Summary: My daughter & I stayed for 7 nights. We could not have picked a better hotel. The Staff were amazing, very helpful & couldnt do enough for you. We arrived at 9.00am after a 14 hour flight, but check in wasnt til 4.00pm. They took pity on us & let us check in straight away, we were very impressed. When we got to the room we found it had total blockout curtains, so we slept very soundly for a few hours. The beds were so comfortable and the rooms were very spacious.  The cookies & ice water in the lobby was a nice touch. The ART bus is right outside the door and you can change buses at Disneyland for a lot of local attractions, all for $4.00 a day
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post comments about your stay in September at the Peacock Suites.  We are so pleased to hear that after you long flight, that our staff was able to accomodate you and get you into your room early! We have passed on your nice note about the staff so they are aware of the nice things you said!  Thank you again for your time and comments. We hope that if you return to the Anaheim area in the future, you will come back and stay with us!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Had a great stay at the Peacock!!!
Summary: We are a young couple with no kids visiting Disneyland and stayed at the Peacock for 7 nights. The stay was perfect. We were in a room on the top floor and it was very quiet. Never were we awaken in the morning by kids running around or loud noises. We also walked to the Disneyland with no problems but I could see how it would be a hassle for some people. It was probably a 15 minute walk. Its just much easier then waiting the 20 minutes for the shuttle and spending the $4 a person.  The 7-11 on the corner was great, especially for the cheap bottled water! Also a great place to buy snacks and even some frozen dinners we ate one night at the hotel to save money.   I also must say I enjoyed the continental breakfast. I know it got a lot of complaints but having a couple of donuts
Manager Response: We wanted to take few minutes to thank you for the comments you made regarding your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!  We appreciate your remarks about the continental breakfast! As we have said in other responses, it is just that, a continental breakfast, something to start your day so we are glad that that is exactly what you said it was!  We hope that when you come back to Anaheim in the future, you will choose the Peacock Suites, again, for your stay!  Thank you again!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: After all the news on infectious diseases and Swine Flue, I was amazed to see that housekeeping still washed coffee mugs, plastic drinking cups and coffee pot in the bathroom sink using cold water and a dirty wet cloth. Management didn't seem to know their own policy or didn't care. Spent your money where they care.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place, walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: I brought my wife, two year old and infant to this property for 15 days.  The staff was awesome, learning our names, and childs names, and spending time with all of us.  Lots of activities for even my toddler.    The property is walking distance to Disneyland, and I absolutely hated the Anaheim run transport shuttle.  It was totally unreliable.  The pool is small, but uncrowded.  An overall awesome experience.
Manager Response: Hi There,  Thank you so much for your kind comments about our staff and your stay at the Peacock Suites! We pride ourselves in learning our guests names and being able to recognize and socialize with you all during your stay!    We have noted your unhappiness with the Anaheim Resort Transit Service and while it is not an excuse, we can tell you that they were at the tail end of a reorganization so that could have been the cause for some of the confusion!  Thank you again for your time! We hope you will choose the Peacock Suites for your next visit to Anaheim!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: My Husband and I took our son to Disneyland and stayed at the Peacock.  Staff was friendly and very helpful.  Our room was on the third floor, view wasn't spectacular but that's okay we weren't in it much since we spent most of our time at the Parks.  The A/C was loud and kept me awake at times but it certainly cooled the room down well.  We arrived on a Friday and left Tuesday, by Sunday evening  we were running low on toilet paper. So we assumed that when we got back from the Parks on Monday evening there would be toilet paper filled, there wasn't, so we had to go ask a housekeeper to give us a roll which was annoying since they had cleaned our room that morning.  Nice to have a refridgerator in our room even though it froze our food.  Coffee maker, microwave and toaster were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to put your comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites in August in writing!  We have passed along your comments about Housekeeping and the toilet paper on to the Head Housekeeper to look into and apologize for the oversite!!!  We are glad to hear that although you would like to have seen more variety in the continental breakfast, you found it fit your needs each day!!   We are also glad to hear that you participated in the BBQ. Hopefully, you were able to participate in some of the other activities that took place on property while you were here!  Thank you again for your time and comments!!! We look forward to your return to the Peacock Suites in the future!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Peacock Suites.  We had a one bedroom suite for our family of four (2 teenagers).  The room was good size...nice to have the fridge, microwave, and toaster in the room.  7-11 is 1/2 block away so easy to stock up on goodies to save for those midnight snacks.  Also, can buy large quantities of bottled water to bring into Disney.    There is a shuttle that picks you up at the hotel to take to you to Disney every 20 min.  Although the park is about 1 mile away and you can walk it...after walking around the park all day, it is nice to have the shuttle.  Shuttle tickets are $4/per person for unlimited rides per day.  There is also a nice mall about 1/3 mile away (easy walk) lots of shopping and dining.  Hotel staff was great...personable.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites in July!!! Thank you so much for all of your comments!!!!   We have notified the supervisors in each are where we received such  positive comments about our staff and the valet staff. We like everyone to know when nice things are said about them!  We are happy to hear that you found the continental breakfast to fit your needs, and the needs of your family, each day!!!  Unfortunately, the complaint you have about the bedrooms being first, is something that we can not fix. When the property was built, that is how it was done and the although we have tried, there is not an easy way to swtich the rooms around!  Thank you for your suggestions though!!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Thank you again for your comments!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: I was a little unsure what I was getting for the price I paid in the area I wanted, but to my surprise it turned out to be a wonderful place to stay. The service was excellent and the price in our budget. It is a family hotel and many kids running around but that what you expect if your there for Disneyland. It is not walkable to  Disney unless you been in a marathon. A shuttle picks you up every 20 min right in front of the hotel and drops you off there also. It cost $3.00 per person per day but well worth it. I reccommend this for any family and will stay there again.
Manager Response: We wanted to thank you for your time in writing comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites in July!!! We are so pleased to hear that the service was up to our standards for you and that you would recommend it, as well as stay with us again!!!  We are also happy to hear that you utilized the ART shuttle while you were here. While it does take approximately 15 to 20 minutes to walk to the Disney parks, the shuttle is very convenient since it does pick up and drop off right at the end of our driveway!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Peacock Suites - Great Place Near Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at Peacock Suites July 13-17 during a visit to Disneyland.  Very nice room, especially appreciated the micro and frig for in-room meals (walked 1/2 block to 7-11 one night for TV dinners, fruit, etc.)  There's a gift shop on the 2nd floor that offers lots of Disneyana merchandise...for up to 1/3rd less than the same thing retails for at Disneyland.        The staff was especially courteous - when we checked out there was a glitch with the amount charged due to a room upgrade (the room we'd reserved was not available); Anthony (?) was very understanding and helpful.  When I called back later that evening (on return home), the manager told me Anthony had actually come back to the hotel on his time off because he had promised me he would make sure things were made
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Reasonably priced and comfortable, we would stay again
Summary: We stayed at Peacock Suites on our 2nd trip to Disneyland, and were very pleased overall.  The price is lower since they are about 1/2 mile from the park - with our older kids, we are able to walk that easily so enjoyed the discount.  Compared to similar hotels that face Disneyland, we found this a great alternative - both in comfort and price.  Our room was clean and spacious for our family of six.  Beds were comfortable, pillows abundent.  We heard very little noise from outside or the halls, and slept well.  The staff was always friendly and helpful.  Valet parking is required - to be honest, I'm glad someone else had to cram our large rental car into their tight parking spaces.  (On our previous trip, we did self-parking in a very small underground lot...and I hated it)
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were beautiful and the staff was welcoming.  I wound that the the hotel staff went out of their way to make sure that me and my husband were taken care of.  The amentities available were so convient.  You truely helped make our trip one of the most enjoyable.  I would reccomend Peacock Suites to people and families looking for the a well serviced and peaceful hotel..
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments regarding your recent stay at the Peacock Suites! We are so glad to hear that your husband and I felt taken care of and that your trip was enjoyable!  As we do with a lot of our comments, we have posted them for the staff to see as it is truly them who are the backbone of the property!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you both stay with us again in the future!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Nice place  but dont count on the breakfast
Summary: We stayed for four nights while attending a volleyball tournament. We had a suite and the room was clean and beds were comfortable. Everyone slept great. The “Complimentary breakfast” was REALLY poor (Juice, toast, cereal). We purchased some breakfast items and put in the fridge instead of the “Complimentary breakfast. There is a valet charge of $8/day and the service is fast and efficient. Staff is friendly and maid service is great. Overall a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to put the comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites in writing. We are so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and we hope that your volleyball tournament was a success!  While we are happy to offer complimentary continental breakfast to our guests, it is just that, continental so juice, toast, cereal, oatmeal, coffee and danish/donuts would be the kinds of things to expect.  We look forward to having you come back and stay with us in the future!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: I stayed at the Peacock in Anaheim for seven nights.  All 7 nights, I slept great.  We had a suite.  The room was clean. The beds were comfortable.  All the staff I encountered were friendly.  Be prepared for the valet charge of $8 a day.  I knew ahead of time, so this was no big surprise to me.  I actual liked dropping my car off at the door.  They were quick, courteous and friendly.(i tipped at the end of my stay)  Would absolutely stay again. negatives,  would be the small bathroom, and only one mirror, we really had to coordinate getting ready since the vanity is in with the shower.(in our suite, anyway) and the complimentary breakfast isnt that great.  neither of these points were trip spoilers.
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites! Thank you for your comments and for your compliments regarding our valet staff! We have passed them along to their manager!  We have a couple of different room types and only one of those, unforunately, has the vanity in the actual bathroom itself. The rest of our rooms have a vanity out side of the bathroom for convenience sake! We hope that this would not deter you from staying with us again!  Thank you for your time and we look forward to your next visit to the Peacock Suites!  Regards,  The Peacock Management

Summary: We love this place! it's our  third stay here,and it has gotten even better this last trip.   The staff is first rate and so helpful. we loved the valet parking as the parking lot is a little small. we will be back soon.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments about your stay in writing.  We are so pleased to hear that you keep returning to the Peacock Suites and that you plan to return again in the future!  Your comments have been passed along to all of our managers for their review and for them to pass on to their staff.  Thank you again for your nice words! We look forward to seeing you again really soon!!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: When my mother and I took my three kids ( 15, 9, and 6) to their first trip to Disney this is where we booked at. It was a great place to stay. The rooms were spacious and having a seperate room and television for the kids was great. My mother even decided to get her own room with my oldest and it only cost 70 dollars a night for a king bed suite. Great deal! The breakfast was nothing special but the rooms made up for it. The shuttle was great for the transport back and forth to Disney and was also just a short walk to the parks as well. The Garden mall around the corner was a huge bonus. Great places to have dessert or go to a movie at the mall. We are planning on booking at Peacock for our trip there next year.
Manager Response: We wanted to take the time to thank you for your comments about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!!  We are so glad to hear that your whole family enjoyed their stay with us and that your mother even decided to get her own room!!   Our continental breakfast is just that, continental: juice, toast, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, milk, danish and donuts. It is an added benefit to start off your day!    We are also glad to hear that you plan to return to stay at the Peacock next year. I am sure you will be pleased with some of the changes we have planned!  Thank you again for your time and comments.  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Looking for cheap? This place is for you...
Summary: There were two good things about this hotel; 1) distance to Disney and availability of shuttle service to Disney and 2) the room configuration. Our family of three stayed at this hotel and our son (and us) enjoyed the separation between his 'bedroom' and our 'room' (really its just a thin wall with glass door) - he had a TV in his room as did we. The lobby was tiny, the free breakfast was poor, the concierge seemed to understand the population of guest (we asked where a good place to eat was and we were told Mimi's Cafe, which in my mind, is exactly like Perkins... not really what we were thinking of), the pool was not a place where I wanted to spend time (no sunlight)  - you sort of feels like you're in a garage. Luckily, we spent very little time at the hotel as we were off at
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the time you took to put your comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing. It seems that you were lucky in being able to book at room at the last minute!  We are glad to hear that your family enjoyed your stay and that the room types we have to offer were a good fit for you all!  I have had a conversation with our concierge regarding the restaurants that they reccomend and although Mimi's serves a really great breakfast, there are some other nice restaurants close by.   We hope that should you travel back to Anaheim in the future, you will give the Peacock another try!  Thank you again for your time and comments.  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: When I return to Anaheim, I will definitely stay at Peacock Suites.
Summary: Our party of 4 booked at Peacock Suites because of it's closeness to the Anaheim Stadium.  We were there to watch baseball!   Overall it's a great place for a great price. We found the "continental breakfast" lacking, as it was all carbs.  Some fresh fruit would have been  a nice touch.
Manager Response: As the Management team, we wanted to say thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Peacock Suites,   We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay while you were here and hopefully, whatever baseball team you were here to watch (the Angels or the opposing team) won, making your stay even more enjoyable.  As we have mentioned in other responses, our continental breakfast is just that, continental. Nothing fancy, just enough to get a start to your day! We have passed on though, to the General Manager, that fruit would definitely be a good addition!  Thank you again for your comments! We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Peacock Suites for 4 nights.  We have 3 kids (8, 6 and 3).  The staff was VERY friendly and accomodating.  We had several questions throughout our stay and they were always happy to answer.  We even asked where the closest bank was, Target, etc.    The room was spacious and clean.  There was some noise due to new construction close by in the mornings, but that is out of their control, so no negative marks there.  The pool was small, but well kept.  There is a shuttle that comes every 20 mins that takes you to and from Disneyland.  It costs a few dollars per person, but is easily worth it.  Drops you off right at the park, so you do not have to walk from the garage or take the tram or anything.  We really liked that.    The valet staff was also VERY
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites and would recommend us to others! Thank you for your kind comments about your visit!  We have passed along your note to each manager so that they, as well as their staff, are aware that everyone exceeded your expectations while you were here!  As you know from seeing our parking lot and garage, valet is the most convenient way to handle our parking! We are glad to hear that you had a good experience!  Thank you gain for your comments! We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Had a family birthday party at Disneyland for 3 year old twins granddaughters and my daughter-in-law picked Peacock Suites because of it's fantastic rates and indoor swimming pool.  I checked out the ratings and booked here too.  I was not disappointed.  The double suites were spacious when we had our older granddaughter with us and the King Suite was great when we were just two.  Stayed 5 nights.  Definitely would stay again.  Wonderful staff!
Manager Response: Gloria,  Thank you, first, to your daughter in law, for choosing the Peacock Suites for your stay during your granddaughters birthday celebration!  We hope they had a really great 3rd birthday!  As you saw when you arrived, the pool is outdoors, just covered! We hope you were all able to use it after a long day at the park since it is open until 10:00 p.m.  Thank you again to all of you for choosing to stay at the Peacock and thank you for your comments regarding your stay! We appreciate your time and look forward to your next visit with us!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Managements

Summary: We had a wonderful 3 night stay here,  the staff were wonderful, answered any questions quickly, very accomidating.  We stayed with our teens, we had 4 adults & 3 teens in 2 rooms.  Walking each day was no problem, we really enjoyed the quiet walk in the morning, and enjoyed getting away from the hustle & bustle of Disneyland. Valet quick & efficient. Got a great deal booking directly with the hotel. The online price dropped after I made my reservation, but there was no problem getting the lower price when I phoned and requested it. We didn't eat breakfast there, so can' comment. Pool area was nice, but  busy. Bedding clean but seemed a little tattered. Sofa bed not that comfy for teens. They felt the springs. Overall we were very happy with this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing!! We are so happy to hear that you had an enjoyable stay!  I have notified Housekeeping to check their inventory of bedding to make sure all is checked regularly.  Thank you again for your comments! We truly apprecitate your time and look forward to having you come back and stay with us again!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Managers

Summary: I'd recommend Peacock Suites to anyone.  For being so close to Disney it's a great deal.  Right next door to a brand new outdoor mall as well.  The rooms are nice with a living room, bedroom and bathroom that come with a couch, two TVs (one is an LCD tv; appx 32 inches), free wi-fi, microwave, refrigerator and plates/silverware.  The service is very good and they seem to genuinely care about their patrons.  They have events every evening ranging from family game night, barbeques, free root beer floats and more.    The ART shuttle to Disneyland stops out front every 20-30 minutes and tickets can be purchased from the front desk ($4/day).    My only complaint would be lukewarm-cool showers in the morning because everyone is showering at the same time and mandatory $8/night valet
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your nice comments regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites! We appreciate the time you took to put eveything into writing and are so happy to hear that you had an enjoyable stay!  You are right when you say that we do genuinely care about our patrons! We do! We do!   I have passed along the information about the water to maintenance and the problem, whatever it was, should have already been taken care of!  As far as the valet parking goes, we are sure that once you saw our parking lot, you would agree that having all vehicles valet parked, is the most convenient way! We are sorry that this was a complaint, but we are certainly glad to hear that you have not held that against us and would stay here again!  Thank you again for your time and comments!  We look forward to your return stay!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great deal and very close to Disney
Summary: I chose to do an advance purchase for this hotel and am very happy with the deal we got.  We were very impressed with the size of our hotel room and loved that there was a separate family room for when parents and kids wanted to watch different things.  We weren't big fans of the shower...the pressure wasn't the best and the first day it took a while for the water to get hot enough to my liking.  We also weren't fans at the multiple attempts to get us to buy a timeshare.  We were there to vacation with our kids for school vacation and didn't want to be sold anything.  Other than that we were pleasantly surprised at how close it was to Disney...we walked and also the great Garden Walk.  We ate dinner there both nights and the shopping was lovely too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean room, quiet location on 2nd floor, 15minute walk to Disneyland, hotel wash machines but used the coin op across the road (no waiting) and very friendly courteous staff. Rate was second night 50% (due to financial gloom). Two rooms, solid door separation, good hot shower (but have to wait awhile). Didnt use the parking - check the daily valet rates if applicable for you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I must say after a month travelling across the US. The Peacock stood out as the best. Firstly it was the staff that really make this place , they were fantastic... very customer focused. Rooms were good value for the money, continental breakfast was good enough to get you to lunch. Disneyland is within walking distance(15-20 mins easy walk)... save yourself the  $16-$20 per day for the bus.... Spend it on the kids...If you want to do tours, the staff will organize this for you. Al, the tour operator was GREAT!! Overall a GREAT STAY! Highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our recent trip to Peacock Suites. We had a great experience with our stay. The room was great with 2 t.v.'s and DVD players, microwave, fridge, can openers, even plates, silverware and dishwashing soap. The only small complaint I would have with the room, is the pull out sofa bed was uncomfortable, and you would just automatically roll in, and sink in the middle of the bed...felt like it was all springs...which i guess is to be expected with sofa beds, but it was really hard to sleep on.Other than that, our room was wonderful.The staff were all friendly and very helpful, and our housekeeper was great. She even arranged my daughters stuffed animals from the day before on the bed, with her Tinkerbell blanket, which was a great little surprise when we returned. It was a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at Peacock Suites April 19-26 with my family. We had 4 adults and two young children.  We booked a three bedroom suite that really was a two bedroom with a living room.  The first room had two kings w/bathroom that adjoined the second room w/ one king, living room w/bathroom.  The set up was weird because the person sleeping on the pull out sofa had to go through either room to use the bathroom. So if you expecting a true three bedroom do not book it here.  I would suggest they put a floorplan of the rooms on their website so people know exactly what they are getting before they book..  I was so impressed with the front desk staff and the valet attendants.  They also greeted us with a smile and were helpful with any questions.  Oh, yeah this is a timeshare hotel so stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here a few weeks ago with our children. The staff were very very friendly and helpful. Very kind to the kids. The hotel was nice. we stayed in a suite that had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. The kids loved the pool and the hot tubs. Glad to be able to have free breakfast too! One thing that I liked that I didn't know about before was the gift shop, it was a great place to pick up souvenirs and cheap kids tshirts. the best though was the friendly staff :)
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not so bad if you are in Disneyland all day.
Summary: We were at the Peacock Suites during the second week of April 2009.  The front staff were welcoming but after check out a time share person tries to get you to sit with them for the sell job.  The room was meant to be a one bedroom with kitchen facilities.  It was really one room with a divider.  In the room with the pull out couch there was a bar fridge and toaster.  I would not have wanted to actually cooked or prepared food.  The fridge was good for keeping drinks cold.  The pool was way smaller than the picture portrays but everyone enjoyed it regardless.    The breakfast room was nice enough and being able to have cereal and toast was welcome.    We were not pleased to find out there was an $8/day valet charge and you had to have them park your car.  We walked each way to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Thanks to the Valet Guys!! They were awesome.  They parked our trailer in a safe location and brought our truck out quickly.  They always had smiles on their faces and jokes came easily.  Maid services did a great job as well.  Our kids loved the pool.  We should have just skipped Disneyland and saved our money!! Hanks Family
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disney fans will like this hotel.
Summary: The staff knew Disneyland like the back of their hands.  Very helpful in assisting my family in getting to and from the park.  Also had inside information on park discounts.  The hotel is clearly Disneyesque and caters to families with children.  The rooms were spacious and very modern.  This Hotel even has elevators - thank God.  The breakfast room is spacious, and the breakfast includes O.J., coffee, toast, donuts, and pastries.  However, anyone who wants a pre-packed Egg McMuffin is going to have to pay for it.  Also, the cleaning staff and the waitress in the breakfast room do not speak English - but Spanish.  This Hotel does force you to valet park at $8 a day, but the valet staff is always present, quick and efficient in getting your car.  The hotel grounds are nicely
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the front desk to the cleanliness of the room.......grrrreat!!.  Very comfortable room.  Clean and convienent.  Nice walk to Disneyland.  First hotel for pick up and drop off on the shuttle.  Loved the deep tub with the jets.....perfect after a long day in the park.  The chocolates on the pillow was a nice touch.  No pressure to attend a timeshare.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Inn and Suites for 4 nights, family of 4 with a 1 and 4 year old. We stayed on the 1st floor and were given a room on the 1st floor right across from the conference room/breakfast room. There was a large “family” room with couch, tv, mini kitchenette, chairs and table. There was an actual door (not French doors/curtain) that closed off the bedroom from this sitting room that was attached to a very small bathroom. We have previously stayed here before on the 4th floor and the layout of the rooms are completely different. I liked the room on the 4th floor much better. This room had 2 very small beds, barely larger than a twin sized mattress although they were comfortable. All in all this was a pleasant stay and perfect for our purposes to visit Disneyland
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for putting your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites in writing!   We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit and  plan to stay here again the next time you are in Anaheim!!!   Thank you again! We look forward to your future visit!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: A mix-up and poor room planning, but a few good surprises.
Summary: First of all do not get the impression that this is a "resort" in any terms (even if is available for timeshare ownership). This is a hotel grade conversion to a suite  We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in order to take our 3 young children to Disneyland. We booked the hotel 4 months in advance (too bad they didn't tell us about the mandatory $8 per day parking fee!). When we checked in we were given the keys to our room. All the rooms upon entering have a typical hotel vibe. You enter at the bathroom which is followed by the bedroom. At the back is a glass sliding door that separated the living room which has a small sofa and a table with chairs. Each unit has 2 TV's, one in the bedroom and one in the living room.. The design was not well thought out, as the kids 1) constantly
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking a few minutes to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peaocock Suites in writing!  As I am sure you noticed during your stay, our parking lot and garage are a bit small and in order to control this situation, we have had a parking/valet fee since October of 2006. The cost and information is located on our website, as well as all of the other websites that we work with so we were surprised to hear that you were shocked by the fee when you got here.   We are always happy to hear that our staff was accomodating and friendly so than you for noting this in your review!  Tahnk you again for your time! We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: I liked the pictures of this hotel, it looked, fun and cheerful. When I arrived, it was nothing but disappointment. The staff seemed perplexed that I added a day at the beginning of my stay and actually told me I would have to come back down tomorrow and check in again. I was not impressed. I turned to speak to the concierge who knew very little and had to look up everything we asked about on the Internet. (I could have done that.) He tried to book me into an appointment to view and try to sell me on another of their timeshares as if I had prearranged that. I had not. This was only the beginning of my disappointments.
