When the only way to get to the elevator without climbing stairs, was through the same parking garage that we were not allowed to park our own car in, that was
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your stay at the Peacock Suites! While we are sorry to hear that you did not emjoy your stay with us, we would like to touch on a couple of your comments, in hopes that you will have a better understanding of the property.  As I am sure you noticed while you were here, our parking lot and garage are small and therefore after several months of trying to figure out how to best control the parking situation (guests would actually double park their cars then leave for the day, leaving other guests stranded), valet parking was the most viable option. That we have valet parking and a fee is listed on our website, as well as on all of the other website that we work with, our call center and our wholesale partners.   The hotel was remodeled in November of 2006 so we are suprised that you felt that the suite was "dingy". Our maintenance staff is constantly working on keeping the rooms in the good shape that they are in.  We do apologize that the high speed internet service was slow when you tried to use it. Unfortunately, we don't have any control over how it runs but we do hope that you were able to get done what you needed to!  Our continental breakfast is very similar to those around town...it is a place to start your day off! As far as the patio being closed, again, our maintenance staff is working diligently to keep everything in order and it just so happened that the patio had to be closed for a few days in March to be redone! We are sorry for any inconvenience it caused you and our other guests that were hear during that time   We thank you, again, for taking the time to put your thoughts into writing. We do take all comments very seriously and appreciate everything our guests have to tell us!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites with another family (two adults, two kids + two adults, two kids...kids aged 5 and under) for a week in March 2009.  We stayed in room 102 which had two bedrooms, each with an ensuite bathroom and flatscreen TV, and a common area that had a flatscreen TV, fold-out couch, dining table, microwave and fridge.  To be perfectly frank, I had serious reservations about staying at a time share.  I've never been interested in one before because of the hard-sell tactics and the horror stories I've heard about extra fees or an inability to book the dates and locations that you want.  We ended up at the Peacock because the father of the wife in the other couple we traveled with had a timeshare with Shell Vacations Club, and booked us in there when we simply
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing!  We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit, even after being a little leery at first! We have passed on your comments regarding the front dest staff  to the Guest Services Manager and we have had the staff look at the reveiw themselves! We have also passed on your nice comments to the valet staff so they are also aware that they should keep up there excellent service!   Thank you again for your time! We truly do take all comments to heart!! We look forward to having you return to stay with us in the future!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: My wife and I, my two young children and my mother all stayed at the Peacock Suites on consecutive weekends that surrounded our Carnival Cruise.  The Peacock was great, we booked it using Bluegreen Timeshare points.  The first weekend, we had a two bedroom Suite (sleeps 8) that was very large and comforable.  It was very clean.  The second weekend we did a one bedroom suite (sleeps 6) that was also very nice, but obviously smaller than the two bedroom (We ran out of points so we had to book the smaller unit).   The service desk staff was great, as were the valet parking service that allowed unlimited in and out service for $8 a day.  The hotel is under a mile walk to the Disney Front Gate and near all sorts of restaurants and shopping.  We loved it and would definitely stay
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites! Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your visit! We are always pleased to hear when guests enjoy themselves!  We hope that you will choose to stay with us again the next time you make a trip to Anaheim!  Thank you again for your comments!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Just stayed at Peacock Suites last week with my mom and my two small children. This is a value hotel, so don't expect luxury, but for the price we were pleasantly surprised! Staff was nice, pool area was clean, the ART bus stops right in front of the hotel. The rooms have a sliding door that separated us from the kids for naps and bedtime. All the rooms have a fridge and microwave with plates, utensils and even dish soap and dish towel. The continental breakfast was adequate but if you like fresh fruit, you should bring your own. All they have is oranges. Also, they serve hard boiled eggs. Some other guests brought mayo and made egg sandwiches. We were very happy overall and would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Peacock Suites! We are thrilled to hear that you and your family had such an enjoyable stay!!  We look forward to having you all stay with us again on a future visit to Anaheim!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: They Wont Release Money From My Credit Card
Summary: A hold was placed on my credit card when i arrived i paid cash on the day i departed a month later and 5 calls the hold is still not released
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments! While all hotels take a security deposit on a credit card upon check in, it is released back to the card up on check out when I guest pays in cash or on a different card. This usually takes about 24 hours to show back up on the card, however, anything after that would be at the descretion of your bank or financial establishment so we are hopeful that you have gotten this worked out with them at this point.  We hope that you will give the Peacock Suites another try should you ever return to Anaheim!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Management

Summary Heading: Clean hotel, nice stay, no complaints!
Summary: My husband, myself, and out two small children(3 yrs. and 6 mos.) stayed here this past week for two nights so we could go to Disneyland. The location is decent, about a half mile from Disney, and considering the shuttle charges you(which is ridiculous in my opinion) we walked it. And because our kids take naps, we walked it a couple times during one of the days. It wasn't a bad walk at all, I actually preferred it to taking a shuttle, or even to parking at Disney which we did our check out day...so as long as you don't mind a stroll down the street, I recommend it over the overcrowded shuttle.  Anyways, the mandatory parking fee was not a big deal, and it is valet, which a nice, so you don't have to worry about some idiot parking too close to you and having to squeeze out of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The front desk service was incredible!
Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites for two weeks, the service there was incredible!!! There were three people in general that stood out, two front desk young ladies, Candy and Shelly, they would go out of their ways to make us feel at home and to see that our needs were met.  They are a wonderful asset to that place.  The third was the lady at the breakfast brunch place, cant remember her name, its the usual lady, not the fill in one, she was wonderful as well, quality service!! I will go back there because of those three employees.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here 2 nights while taking kids to Disneyland. It was close to Disney but not really close enough to walk. Shuttle bus runs every 20 min for $4adults, $1 kids. I think this was an apartment complex before that was turne dinto a hotel. Mall is walking distnace 2 blocks away with Cheescake Factory, bowling alley and cinema for those rainey days like we had.  Pros: Spacious rooms with bdroom separate from living room. Living room had sleeper sofa, end tables, coffee table, dinig table with 2 chairs, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, can opener and coffee pot. Plasma TV with DVD player in bedroom and living room. Bathroom was reonovate dwith trendy fixtures, granite counters and karge jacuzzi tub/shower. Plenty of towels were in bathroom folded in cute display.  Cons:
Manager Response: none

Summary: The very first thing I have to say about this place is that the room of huge! We had two bedrooms, two bathrooms....all the space we needed. It was like an apartment, but having said that, there was no kitchen!!!! I thought that was the strangest thing ever!!!! There's just a small refrigerator and microwave!  The continental breakfast is just a few stale doughnuts and danishes. I realize that its just down the street from Disneyland, therefore I won't rant about the counless number of children running wild in the hallways. What I will comment on is the 'valet' parking. For starters they charge you $8 per day for it. Second, at any given time there are at least 4 families waiting for their cars to come with one guy running to get them. This is neither fair to the employee or the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Planned a family vacation for a week. We stayed in the 1 bedroom suites which was plenty big enough for mom, dad, two teenagers and two babies. Hotel provided a complimentary crib for our daughter. Room was very clean and staff very attentive. Loved the valet parking- thought 8.00 dollars a day was very reasonable. Will tell family and friends about Peacock Suites. Very Nice surprise!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overall, this was a great place for a family of six to stay for a week!  To get a family suite at this nice of a hotel for $49 a night was incredible!  I was glad we searched deeper and found an amazing promotional code.    The included breakfast was a nice plus but would have been amazing if it could have also included waffles and a better variety of cold cereals and fruit.  The cold cereals they served were just Cheerios and Corn Flakes.  The only fruit offered during our week long stay was oranges.  There were usually donuts and other pastries as well as juices, toast, and boiled eggs.  Overall, it was pretty good...especially for the price, just a week of the same breakfast food started to get a little boring.  (For $1.50 per item, they do offer a few prepackaged
Manager Response: none

Summary: attached living room was great for us freak families with more than 2 children, very clean, staff were great, only wish the pool area wasn't covered, a bit of a walk to disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The service? GREAT!...My sister in law and I were greeted with happy smiling faces from Shelly and Juan. I had made reservations the day before as we didnt like where we were staying except it wasnt thru the hotel.Shelly asked me if I needed 2 rooms because thats what my reservations said. I said it was some sort of mistake, Shelly said....Dont  worry , made a phone call and took care of it for me. I realized I had kept my security box key from the last hotel, Juan said.....Dont worry, asked for the hotels address and took care of it for me. The rooms? AWESOME!....We were very surprised to find not only a clean spacious room with 2 comfy queen size beds... but an extra tv room  with a couch that converts to a bed, an extra tv and dvd player. refridgerater and more. Oh did I
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family consists of my husband and I as well as two teenagers, a boy and a girl and we also have a 8 yr old girl so the suite arrangement was perfect for our family. The sliding doors that seperate the rooms made it so the kids could go to bed but we could have a little quiet time without disturbing them. One of the days we stayed we decided not to have housekeeping in because we had too much stuff in their way but we needed fresh towels to have showers when we came back for the evening. My husband phoned down to the front desk and asked if he could run down and grab some fresh ones, they told him that fresh ones would be at our room in under 7 minutes. They were there in less than 5. There were so many little things that made our stay memorable that we would stay again. I
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Peacock Suites.  The room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated.  The living area was complete with a refrigerator, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. The thing I really liked was the sliding glass door between the living area, and the bedroom area.  Since I was staying in the living area, and my daughter's family stayed in the bedroom area, I could close the sliding door, pull the curtain in front of it, and have perfect privacy from the bedroom.  Also, both the living area and the bedroom area had their own TV's.  We started each morning with the complementary continental breakfast.  It had most of the traditional pastry, and cereal items, but also included hard boiled eggs, which I really appreciated as I am diabetic.  The customer
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Rooms, but that's about all.
Summary: Don't let the nice new rooms fool you.  This hotel has a LOT of serious problems!  While the rooms at Peacock are spacious, well furnished, and clean, and the cleaning staff is courteous and quick to respond, the lack of customer service at the front desk, and the slew of problems we had during our stay negate these little positives.  If you have business to attend to on the web while you're at Peacock, forget about using their free in-room wireless.  It only works 25% of the time, and when it does work, it's so slow you'll never get anything done.  Don't expect the front desk to be able to tell you anything about the internet service, other than trying to get you to pay to use their business center in the lobby.  Also, be wary of the shuttle service that takes hotel guests to
Manager Response: none

Summary: Peacock Suites was wonderful.  The first impression of the room is that it is a bit small.  This is only because when you walk into the room, the bathroom sink was right there.  We are a family of four with two young girls.  This was the perfect set up for us with the room divided by the sliding glass door.  They played and watched Hannah Montana as we relaxed on our King size bed and watched our own tv at night.  They had no complaints about sleeping on the pull out bed.  They even loved the fact that each day when housekeeping would come in and make the beds, they lined all of their stuffed animals up on the pillows for them.  I tried to leave housekeeping a tip, but it was still there at the end of the day. Ok, the breakfast.  Yes, toast, cold cereal and oatmeal, juice,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beware!! We booked through Hotels.com that did not honor their Price Match Guarantee on the rate or disclose mandatory valet parking @ $8 per day.  Peacock Stes web site does not disclose mandatory valet parking and they would not adjust or remove the mandatory valet fee. Staff was unaccomodating & rude. I too like the truth & facts.  Rooms are small & free breakfast is "junk"-watered down juice & coffee, cold hard boiled eggs, cereal & donuts. No fruit. A real scam......Beware
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed at the Peacock Suites and quite enjoyed it.    The staff was very polite and had no problems with them.  The only negative thing I would say about that was I thought the room would be cleaned more thoroughly than it was.  Some days it seemed like our bedcovers thrown back on our beds was the only thing that was done to our room.    The elevators were a minor annoyance as we stayed on the 4th floor and when we had our luggage or stroller we had to load onto one elevator and then transfer to the other to get to the 4th floor.  The rooms were a touch on the small side but also well layed out so that a family could stay in them quite comfortable.  I really liked the french doors between the living area and bedroom area that could be closed off.  The shower head in
Manager Response: none

Summary: For our post Christmas Disneyland vacation, I booked 2 rooms at the Peacock Suites -due to the size of our family.  On a Disneyland vacation, when all you do is sleep and eat breakfast at the hotel,  you want the rooms and  breakfast to be good.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable. (bathroom was a little small) But the breakfast was awful.  I asked the receptionist when I booked what it included and was told (among other items that weren't there) breakfast burritos!   Trust me there were no breakfast burritos.  She also mentioned a couple of other  items that were not there during our 3 days, or were not part of the FREE breakfast.  (Yes, there were a couple of items for sale!)  The hard-boiled eggs were cold, and there was a sign on the micro forbidding you to warm them
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was very friendly and very helpful. Hotel was very clean and very nice. The only complaint is that our keys did not work right away but we took them to the desk and they fixed that right away for us. The hotel is strictly valet parking and the Valet were very helpful when we needed acess to our car (at all hours of the night and day). Overall, Amazing stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got a great price thru Priceline, for a good hotel.  Close to Disneyland and on the Anaheim Resort Transit route.  The bus stopped right in front of the hotel.  Within walking distance to some good restaurants.  No self parking, only valet for 8.00/day, however there was always someone available to retrieve the car when we needed it.  Front desk staff and concierge were very courteous and helpful.  The room was clean, bed comfortable.  Suite was two rooms, 2 queens and a sofa sleeper.  2 TV's with dvd players,   Only complaint about the room is that on one side of each bed there was no room for the person sleeping on that side of the bed to walk beside the bed.  To get in and out you had to crawl over the bed to the bottom or over your sleeping companion.  This hotel is a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value great staff great hotel!!
Summary: My family and I recently stayed at the Peacock Suites for the second time and definately plan to stay again.  Peacock Suites was a great value and the rooms are BEAUTIFUL and spacious!  We had plenty of room for our kids to do their own thing without feeling cramped in a hotel room.  The shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient as well.  Upon arrival we were greeted by a lovely staff and the Manager, Andrew was very helpful and sweet and assured us a wonderful stay and said if we needed anything feel free to ask.  Personal attention makes such a difference.  Check in and check out were a breeze and it was nice to have such an attentive staff to accomodate our every need.  Thank you Peacock Suites for making our stay with our kids so enjoyable.  We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel was okay, but will not return
Summary: Likes: - Clean room, very spacious - Very friendly staff  Dislikes: - Breakfast food (GROSS!). Considering it is a place for kids, the cereal are all sugarless (all are initations of Cheerios and Corn Flakes). Fruit Loops or Corn Pops would be good. (Very little variety) - Valet parking (cost $8). It should always be an option at every hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Peacock Suites is the place to stay!
Summary: On our vacation to California Disney Land made our days and the Peacock Suites Resort made our nights.  If we ever come back to this area to vacation there is simply no other hotel that we would consider other than the Peacock Suites Resort.    Upon arrival, the entire staff was exceptionally friendly and accomodating.  Every staff member we encountered greeted us with a friendly smile.  At the same time they were not overbearing in the least  as if they were just putting on a show like so many other places we've stayed at.  They genuinely made us feel that they were happy we were there...and not just another guest to take care of.    Durring our stay we were first of all impressed with the room rates.  Once we settled in our room we couldn't believe the accomodations for the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent the week of Xmas at the Peacock Suites and had a wonderful experience.  We booked through our time share and there was a mix up with our reservation not being entered. The front desk went above and beyond to fix the problem and we had a beautiful suite for the week.  They were quick to address any small or large problem and helped with suggetions and directions whenever needed.  The room was clean and neat - and although we were told they did not have full maid service (just clean towels and such), we came into our room every evening to see a cleaned up, beds made and bathroom scrubbed room.  We did have to pay for daily parking but the attendants were friendly and quick to get the car when we needed it - even jumped it when we left the kids left the lights on and the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Peacock Suites during our 9 week North American trip and found the hotel to be really good value for money and the staff were very attentive and helpful. The rooms were really good and a quick 5 minute shuttle to Disneyland. Overall, the stay was really enjoyable, however there were two things that really annoyed me. Firstly the hotel did not have free wi-fi and charged $9.95 for a block 24 hour period from 4pm one day to 4pm the next day, so if you logged in at 3.59 and logged out 2 minutes later, you would be charged for two days worth of internet!! Apparently this is being fixed next year when the contract with the internet privider expires. Secondly upon leaving the hotel, I asked the hotel staff to call me a taxi to take me to the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came home from our trip completely exhausted because of the noise at the hotel.  The walls are paper thin and we were on the 2nd floor and you could hear everyone above us as they walked around.  The toilets flush so loud that every time someone went to the bathroom around us or above us it sounded as if it was in our room.  There were small children above us that rose very early and while I know that children run rather than walk they sounded like a heard of elephants above us.  Everyone that we talked to had the same complaint.  The air conditioner was very loud and in the room with the two queen size beds had no air circulation and was very hot so the choice was to have a loud air conditioner or stale hot air.  There were workmen working outside the other room that started
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to put your comments about your visit to the Peacock Suites in to writing!  While we are sorry to hear that you had some issues with your stay, we are glad to hear the nice things you had to say about our staff!  I understand that you were frustrated with the parking fee, however, it is noted on all of the websites we sell through that there is an $8.00 fee. There is also information regarding the shuttle passes being available at a nominal charge. Unfortunately, the city of Anaheim has mandated which hotels use or don't use the shuttle and the majority of the hotels in the area are actually on the shuttle route.   Thank you again for your time! Happy Holidays!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We go to Disneyland about 3 times a year, this is the best value by far.  The room was nicley decorated,  with every amenity we needed.  Fridge and, micorwave.  My daughter and I enjoyed sitting on our couch watching a movie on the DVD player. The staff was excellent, I especially like having someone to bring the bags to the room without my asking, Adrian was extreamly helpful and polite.  The housekeeper, Natalie,  who cleaned our room did an excellent job.  I really liked the fact that there were plenty of towles in the room. I agree with other reviewers that breakfast left a lot  to be desired, but the with the deal we got on the room, I coould afford to eat at Disney everyday.  I also agree that the iternet cost was a little to much, so I just didn't use it.  I was happy to
Manager Response: We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Peacock Suites!! We appreciate the time you took out of your schedule to put your comments in writing!  Both Adrian and Natalia have been recognized as having been mentioned on Trip Advisor, Thank you for mentioning them by name and in such a positive manner!  Thank you again for your time! We look forward to having you return in the future!  Happy Holidays!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Great Stay! Early December 08.  I've given 5 stars because of the quality of rooms (nice furniture, multiple tvs, 'fridge). The staff was fabulous and everybody was very friendly.  Room service did a great job and all of my belongings were safe.   If I could say ANYTHING at all negative it would be A: The free complimentary breakfast didn't 'wow' me (not into the cereals and pastry) and B: My wife hadn't told me about the mandatory valet service for our rental car. 8$ bucks a day (plus tip when picked up car) .It's free to come and go as much as you like and they're relatively fast and very friendly.  All in all, it is my first day back in Seattle and I sincerely miss the Peacock Suites in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the Peacock Suites.  We are so thrilled that you enjoyed your stay so much that you "sincerely miss the Peacock Suites in Anaheim".  We look forward to having you and your family return for a future stay!  Thank you again for your time!  Happy  Holiday!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We stayed a the Peacock for 15 nights at the end of November.  We read a lot of reviews from others that have stayed at the hotel in the recent past, and I would have to say that our experience was as good as anyone's, and better than most.    We stayed on the fourth floor and had adjoining rooms with our other party.  There were seven of us in total and having the sitting rooms gave everyone enough room.    The rooms have everything you need including fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, two TVs and DVD players, coffee table, small table and chairs, sofa (bed).  Most importantly, the rooms are clean, a common theme throughout the hotel.  Almost every morning we caught some staff member in the act of cleaning in the elevators, the welcom mats, the parking lot, or somewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice review you wrote about your visit at the Peacock Suites. We are so glad that all 7 of your were accomodated so comfortable, which helped to enhance your stay!  I have passed along your comments about the resort being so clean to the Head Housekeeper as well as to the General Manager so that our Housekeeping staff can be awarded!!!  Again, thank you for you time and for the nice words! We look forward to having you retunrn to the Peaocock Suites on your furture visit.  Happy Holidays,   The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We had a great visit.  The staff were WONDERFUL... especially Juan and Mike at the front desk.  The location was perfect for evening walks to the mall and restaurants.  The shuttle to Disneyland was convenient and quick.  We had a great experience and will definitely stay there again!  Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on your recent stay at the Peaocock Suites!  We are so appreciative of your review and please know that Juan and MIke's supervisor has been notified of your kind words, as have they!  We look forward to your return to stay with us again in the future!  Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful Holiday season!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: This is the 4th time we have stayed at this hotel.  We checked in quickly and the staff was so nice, inquiring about our stay and activities and giving us hints about what to expect at Disneyland with the holidays.  We weren't happy with the addition of valet parking for $8/day, but they were really nice and got the car rather quickly.  The room was as we expected, 2 queen beds, TV, DVD, closet and drawers.  There was a separate sitting room, which was very useful with 4 people trying to get ready in the morning.  The breakfast is dull, something they really need to look at better, dry pastries, dry donuts.  However, knowing that there is a microwave, refrigerator, toaster and coffee pot in the room, we packed snacks accordingly.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and we will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to come back to the Peacock Suites! We are so glad that you keep returning to stay with us and that your experience has been so pleasant!  While we understand your concern about the parking situation, we do hope that the organization of if all enhanced your overall visit.  Thank you for the time you took to write your review! We look forward to your return in the future!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Wasn't Too Bad, But Could Have Been Better
Summary: This is my first review of this hotel based on my second stay here.  My wife and I are Shell Vacation Club owners and this is one of places in our network, so this is the second time we have stayed at the Peacock.  We arrived at the Peacock around one in the morning after driving down from the Bay Area for our annual Disneyland mini-vacation.  Check In: Check in was simple and quick most likely due to the time we arrived at the hotel since no one else was checking in.    Rooms: The rooms are fairly large with separate sleeping and sitting areas.  The sitting area contains a sleeper sofa, fridge, microwave, TV and DVD player.  The sleeping area has a closet, TV, DVD player and adjoins the bathroom.  I thought the beds were very comfortable and there were plenty of towels
Manager Response: We wanted to take the time to say thank you for the comments you posted about your stay at the Peacock Suites.  We are happy that you enjoyed your second stay with us and although you had an issue with noise on your first night, we are glad to hear that once you got moved, all was better!  We have had a discussion with concierge about their call times so future guests should not be receiving calls early in the morning. Thank you for bringing that to our attention!  We hope that you will return to the Peacock for your third visit sometime in 2009! Thank you again for your time and comments!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: bfast was okay. the room was not cleaned, we were expecting them to clean the room on a daily basisbut instead we found liqour bottle behind the couch. that just tell you they don't clean very good. we just got new towels. no new toilet paper, did not vacuum and bed was not even done. did not change the bedsheets. notified the front desk nothing happen.  not happy, san lorenzo, ca
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to put your comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites in writing.  While we are sorry to hear that you were not quite happy with your stay, we hope that you will give us another chance, in the future, to reedem ourselves.  Thank you again and happy holidays!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We loved the layout of the suites.  There are 2 TV's in each suite--sweet!  Do not plan on using the hide-a-bed. We had to use it the last night as some of our family went home & some stayed, but not enough to keep all the rooms. We ended up sleeping on the floor.  It was all springs--totally unsleepable.  Also, it's a shame in this day and age, no free wireless connection.  I can't think of a place I've stayed in where we had to pay.  Also, they say it's $9.95 for a full 24 hrs.  Nay, nay, the hotel cuts it off at 4 pm, which is the check in time--even if it's just one of your regular reservation days. So, if you sign up for Wayport at 3pm you will only have it for one hour.  Hotel book VERY deceiving.  Just minor, but we would've loved waffles at the breakfast that are found
Manager Response: none

Summary: Highly recommended for family of 4, especially the 2 bedrooms suite. Comfortable and clean room with friendly and helpful staffs. Good and well maintained Washer (x3) and Dryer(x3) makes our laundry easy. The walk from Peacock Suites to Disneyland is about 20mins. Garden Walk, which is only less than 10mins walk has good restaurants, like Cheesscake Factory, Bubba Gump etc. There is also a 7 eleven only 5mins from the hotel. Strongly recommended.
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit to the Peacock Suites in November! Thank you for your comments about the room and especially about our staff! We are always thrilled to hear good things about all of our staff members and they do get passed on so that everyone knows they have been recognized!  Thank you again for your time and we hope that you will choose to stay with us again on your next trip to the Anaheim area!  Happy Holidays,  The Peacock Management

Summary Heading: The hotel is very nice, but the staff is even better
Summary: We stayed here for Hallowe'en week on a timeshare exchange, and booked a 2nd room online for our (adult) kids & grandkids. They reception staff was delightful, even managed to get us adjoining rooms when I explained the situation. The hotel is very attractive & clean, with a nice little pool & two hot-tubs. Particularly liked the "adults only" swimtime from 10-11 PM. Restaurants are within walking distance, as is Disneyland - maybe 5 blocks, which is not a bad hike going, but coming home you probably want to take the jitney. Especially if you have little ones... (Route 7 - at least when we were there.) The breakfast was better than some but nothing to write home about - mostly donuts & that dry cereal  you buy in big bags & your kids won't touch it...  But overall we had a very
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites! Thank you for taking the time to put your comments in writing!  I am glad to hear that we were able to accomodate your family and get your rooms to adjoin! I am sure it was fun for your grandchildren to have you right next door!!!  We appreciate your kind comments and will pass them on to our staff to read!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Happy Holidays!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: This was our first stay at the Peacock Suites.  It was amazing from the moment we arrived from check in to the valet to advice on places to go, the staff was absolutely amazing.  We were treated like royalty.  Our room was fantastic, the pool is clean and open late.  The continental breakfast was wonderful each morning.  It was clean and beautifully decorated.  The shuttle to Disney ran every 20 mins, and it was a 4 minute drive to Disneyland.  AMAZING!  Next time we wil be staying at the peacock again!
Manager Response: We love that you used the word AMAZING to describe our staff in the description of your stay. We appreciate when comments are made about our staff and we can pass those comment on to each person, knowing they have made an impact on a guest.  Thank you so much for your review and for taking the time to comment on your stay! We are glad to hear that you will stay with us again and look forward to your next visit!  Happy Holiday!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We had a very nice stay at the Peacock Suites.  I thought as far as  value goes the rooms were very nice.  The bedroom on it's own was not overly big, but the living area was decent, and together I think they made for a spacious room.  The ability to separate the living and the bedroom is what got us interested in this property to begin with.  We were traveling with our two young children.  In the end we decided that the living room was there room, and we kept the bedroom.  This just worked well for us, and there was really no convenient space for the pack-n-play in the bedroom.  The rooms were very clean and the number of amenities was quite extensive for what we paid (nice, if small pool, 2 jacuzzis, micro, fridge, hair dryer, coffee maker, chocolates on our bed one night,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visit the Disneyland area quite often and have stayed overnight at many of the "budget friendly" hotels.  The room itself was one of the nicer we have booked.  The room was very clean and had an interesting layout.  We requested a room change and noticed the rooms have different layouts.  Some of the rooms apparently open to the living area separated by a bathroom area, and then the bedroom area.  Some are reversed, where you walk into the bedroom area first.    We had requested a smoking room on the website with two double beds.  When we got to the room , we noticed it was non-smoking and called down to the receptionist, who told us they had a smoking room available, but it only had one bed with a sofabed.  We took the room (#327), and it was a bit smaller than the first,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay last week at the Peacock Suites.  The resort is in a very convenient location right next to Disneyland.  Our room was very clean and inviting and we felt very comfortable relaxing in our room for the week.  The employees were all very friendly especially the front desk who were very helpful with directions and pointing out good places to eat around the area.  We will definitely be returning to Peacock Suites the next time we come out to visit Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Peacock on a last-minute trip.  I had no idea what to expect, as I was referred to the Peacock on a one-off.  As it turns out, I was pleasantly surprised!  The people at the front desk were very efficient and courteous, and we got our room immediately.  (One of my big pet peeves is waiting for a room.)  After checking in, we stopped back down by the front desk to ask a few questions.  The general manager, Joe, came over and personally helped us out!  I've never met a general manager at any other hotel stay - I was very impressed!    The rooms were great too - room service was fast and everything was up to par.    All in all, a great stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Probably wouldn't stay at Peacock Suites again...
Summary: We just returned from a 4 night stay at Peacock Suites and have a somewhat mixed review of our stay.  From the Internet pictures, the room appeared to be much bigger than it actually was.  This is really a basic hotel room in which the sleeping area has been condensed to make room for the sliding french doors that separate the sitting area.  One the other hand, my husband and I did enjoy sliding those doors closed in order to enjoy a glass of wine and listen to music while the kids were on the other side watching the Disney Channel on TV.  The biggest problem we had on our stay was with the Housekeeping Staff.  Each morning as we were leaving for Disneyland, we made it a point to speak directly with the housekeepers to let them know we were leaving and our room was ready to be
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to thank you for taking the time to post your comments about your stay with us here at the Peacock. As reading through them we have seen the comments about our Housekeeping service and I want to be the first to say it has been addressed and these comments have been shared not only with myself, but the entire management team, Housekeeping included. We take all guest feedback serious and although I know you mentioned having some second thoughts in choosing to stay with us again I want to reassure you that guest satisfaction is our highest priority. We hope to see you again soon and thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites from Oct. 3 - 9, 2008.  We booked it through a time share.  We traveled with 3 adults and 4 children and booked two 1 bedrooms. The rooms were pretty spacious and pretty much looked how they are pictured on the website.  It was a pretty nice hotel for the Anaheim area.  The refrigerator was a good size for a hotel room and very cold so it was good for taking in drinks to Disneyland.  The microwave in the room was very convenient.  There was also a coffeemaker, toaster, and plates and utensils.   The pool area and pool were alot smaller than it seems in the pictures.  We did have a small ant problem in one bathroom but in the other room we booked had no ants.  The housekeepers did a good job and were very nice.  We caught the ART shuttle the first
Manager Response: Thank you so much for providing us with your honest feedback. We appreciate it, and we also want you to know that we take all comments right to our management team for discussion. We are happy to see that overall you enjoyed your stay and hope you will consider us in the future for your trips to Anaheim. I would also like to note that both our Housekeeping and Maintenance departments have been alerted on the issues in your unit during your stay and we have resolved them. Thank you again and we look forward to seeing you again.

Summary: Just a quick note to say we enjoyed staying at  Peacock Suites this year.  The staff was wonderful as always.   Shelly at the front desk was exceptional and took care of all of our needs.    We actually spent a couple days this year at another resort and it just was not the Peacock.  It really made us appreciate the homey feeling we get at Peacock Suites.  Thanks to all the staff and see you next year!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond about your stay at the Peacock Suites!  Rest assured, we talk all comments to heart and pass them on to our staff! Shelly and her supervisor have been notified about your gracious comments about her!!!  We look forward to having you come back and stay with us again in the future!  Thank you again for your time!  Regards,  The Peacock Management Team

Summary: Date: 19th September 2008  We are a family of six, with the children aged 19,19,17 & 14 - travelling from Australia. Our accommodation was two one bedroom suites, with the 4 children in one of the rooms, two in the queen sized bed and two on the pull out couch. We booked our accommodation through RCI and stayed for 14 days.  We arrived approximately 9.15am and were greeted by Rochanda, who was extremely pleasant and helpful. Rochanda was able to provide us with immediate access to our room and breakfast in the breakfast room. Rochanda assisted us on several occassions and was always more than willing to assist and went out of her way to follow up our transport after we had checked out as our transport did not arrive and was an hour late.   This was our third time to Anaheim and
Manager Response: Reinmuth Family,  Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on you recent stay at the Peacock Suites.   Please know that Rochanda's immediate supervisor and Rochanda, as well, have been notified of the really nice comments you made about her! We are very appreciative of any remarks made about our staff and take them all seriously, good or bad!!!  Thank you again for your time and we hope that the next time you travel to Anaheim, you will think of us!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Very nice stay.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Had perfect veiw of fireworks at disneyland.  Large compact fridge in room.  Also toaster and can opener and microwave. Did not like the fact that valet was manditory.  $8.00 per day. Breakfast was limited but ok.  They offer additional food at a cost. Loved the fact there was a gift shop in the hotel.   Overall this was a nice hotel and we were very comfortable.
Manager Response: We are so glad you enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites! Thank you taking the time to puty our experience on paper!  While we understand the frustration you had with the parking/valet fee, we hope that you will understand why it is done since you have witnessed the actual parking around property! The parking/valet fee was started to help aliviate what could be a dreadful parking situation and to assist all of our guests with an easy parking solution.  Thank you again for your comments! We look forward to having you return to the Peacock Suites in the future!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Everything I expected; nothing more nothing less!
Summary: Okay, let me start off by saying thank you to TA and it's members for valuable information.  Our trip to Southern Cal was very enjoyable.  THE PEACOCK SUITES:  Location:   The hotel is about 5 blocks from Disney property.  The Main Gate is essentially in the middle of Disney property, so there is actually a further walk to actually get into the parks.  Total distance from Hotel lobby to Main Gate is 1 Mile.  I'm sorry, but this is NOT far by any stretch of the imagination.  This should be walkable for everyone except those that have "challenges" or are just plain lazy (imho).    Rooms: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out queen sofabed.  Sofabed was NOT as comfortable as the 2 other beds, but do you actually expect it to be?  My wife and I slept on
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments in writing regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites. Since you took so much time with them, we thought it would be easier to address each paragraph separately, so please see below for our comments:  THE PEACOCK SUITES:  Location: The hotel is about 5 blocks from Disney property. The Main Gate is essentially in the middle of Disney property, so there is actually a further walk to actually get into the parks. Total distance from Hotel lobby to Main Gate is 1 Mile. I'm sorry, but this is NOT far by any stretch of the imagination. This should be walkable for everyone except those that have "challenges" or are just plain lazy (imho).      **PSR Response: Technically, when you run the actual distance from the Peacock Suites to the DIsneyland Resort on a MapQuest, it gives you .09 of a mile. We have had reports from most guests who walk, that it takes about 15 to 20 minutes to walk, which is pretty average for most hotels in the area. We also have the convenience of having the Anaheim Resort Transit stop right at the end of our driveway to get all guests over to the Disneyland parks safely and comfortably.   Rooms: We stayed in the 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out queen sofabed. Sofabed was NOT as comfortable as the 2 other beds, but do you actually expect it to be? My wife and I slept on that sofabed for 5 nights and we managed to get our rest. The 2 queens were very comfortable. The layout of the room is rather peculiar; the section where the 2 queen beds and the bathroom is immediately insied the entry door. French doors separate the sofabed/fridge/microwave/TV area. Why would you need privacy for the "living area"? The beds should actually be located where the sofabed is and vice versa; that way people that are staying up watching tv or going in/out of the room or bathroom aren't disturbing the people who are sleeping. Carpets looked fairly clean. Towels in bath were adequate. Nice to have 2 TV's, both with DVD players. View from our room was horrible; looking onto the loading dock of a commercial laundry company. No balcony. AC was noticeably loud when on; may annoy sensitive sleepers.  **PSR Response: We finished a total renovation of the hotel in November of 2009 and we are glad to hear that you were happy, for the most part, with your room.   Property: I've seen some sites mention this property as "most beautiful in Anaheim". In reality, it's okay, but I wouldn't call it beautiful. Mind you, I really wouldn't consider any of the hotels around Disneyland beautiful, other than the Disney Hotels themselves. Did not try out the pool or hot tubs, but looked fairly typical of moderate hotel facilities. Very small workout room with 2 treadmills and 1 stationary bike. I never saw anyone in there during my stay.  Parking: I've read a lot of complaints about this. Our experience was very positive. The Valets were very quick and accomodating. FYI there is a parking fee of $8 per day. Notice that I didn't call this a valet fee; you can definately park your own car if you insist, but they will still expect you to pay $8 per day. For all you cheapos out there, you can save some money by telling the valet that you stayed with a relative for a night or two during your stay, and they won't charge you for those nights because you weren't parked at the hotel.   **PSR Response: As we have mentioned in other responses on Trip Advisor, the parking fee has been put into place to assist all guests when they arrive and depart. The Valet is as actually an added bonus! Also, please note that all guests are required to pay the $8.00 parking fee if they are parked on property, for any reason!  Food: No restaurants on site. Anaheim Gardenwalk is literally around the corner and it is a nice/new open air mall with several restaurants. There is also a 7-11 around the corner for picking up snacks and such. The continental breakfast in the morning is fairly representative of what you SHOULD get for a continental breakfast. I've read complaints about the continental breakfast "only having" breads, pastries, cereals, fruits, and juices. I suggest some of these people should look up the definition of "Continental breakfast"!!   **PSR Response: Thank you for your assessment of our continental breakfast! We are one of the few hotels that offers a complimentary continental breakfast, let alone breakfast at all and we while we do see complaints about needing more food, you are correct when you say “continental breakfast”!!!!  We are so pleased to have the Gardenwalk up and running! With all of its’ restaurants, shopping, bowling and movie theater, it is a nice addition to the neighborhood and is literally a 5 minute walk!!!  Information session: Yup it's a time-share sales thing. They'll offer you the usual tour tickets, or theme park tickets etc. Don't waste your valuable time. IMPORTANT: Do yourself a favor and just flat out tell the lady that you're not interested in attending the sessions. Unless you make it very clear, they will call your room and keep calling until you give them a definitive NO!   **PSR Response: Obviously, not everyone is interested in attending a presentation but for those that are, please allow concierge to do the job they have been given to do!  Staff: Friendly, helpfull desk; prompt maintenance, competent housekeeping.   **PSR Response: We have noted this and let the supervisors in all departments know that there is going a wonderful job and that our guests appreciate it!!  **Thank you again for you time! We as the management appreciate all of the comments we receive, take them very seriously and review them to see what was good and what we can do better!  **We hope that you will choose the Peacock Suites on your next visit to Anaheim!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights and will definitely return!  The staff was friendly and very helpful in booking tours, suggesting restaurants, assisting with transportation, etc.  The suite had everything we needed - my teenage son took over the living room area so it was just as if he had his own room.  He appreciated not having to share with mom & sis!  The only real drawback was the lack of a restaurant or in-room dining, but the breakfast room was great - we saved a LOT of money by having breakfast there rather than at the park!
Manager Response: We are so thrilled to hear that you really enjoyed your stay at the Peacock Suites earlier this month! Thank you so much for taking the time to put your comments in writing!!!   To address your comment regarding the lack of us having a restaurant on the property, we hope you you were able to take advantage of the Gardenwalk and the wonderful new restaurants and shops they have. We are excited to have them there since they are only about a 5 minute walk.  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you come back and stay with us in the future!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We were visiting Disneyland for two nights and couldn't have had a better stay.  The room was comfortable, clean and accomodating to our needs.  The hotel staff was very friendly and made us feel at home.  The shuttle to and from Disneyland was convenient and affordable.  We will definately be back next time...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from a 5 night stay and cannot find anything at all to complain about. All staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful from front desk right through to maid service and maintenance staff. We were there on timeshare exchange and refused the tour without any probelms- Mary Ann was still very helpful even though we didn't want to buy into the resort. We had a 1bed room that was ideal for us (you may have privacy issues if 4 adults were to stay). Free breakfast was just enough to set you up till lunch but the addition of fruit may improve it. The location is perfect for Disney and we walked it in about 10 mins (going the longest way round- tip: quickest way is turn left and left again out of resort and you can see it) The pool is under cover in shade so we used the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: great hotel but not walking to disneyland
Summary: my family stayed at Peacock suites with a 1 bedroom suite for 10 days. the staff were very good, they were very helpfulwith everything . It is not walking distance to disneyland (approx 30 minutes) though but they provide the tranfer bus at low cost. the one problem I had was the VALET PARKING , they charged you 8 dollars a day to park your car ... they only drove it sometimes 20 feet. no restaurant on sight, but the morning  free breakfast was good. the pool was clean. the rooms were clean, on sight laundry was great. my family was 4 plus 2 grandmas in a 1 bedroom suite  and worked out fine. Sofa bed not so good though. but room had coffee machine, microwave, and fridge.very good for left overs and cold drinks. I would rate this hotel 7 out of 10 but when i come back, i think
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Location.  Staff in front office friendly and very easy to talk too.  Shelly, was fun to talk to and joke with.  Valet was wonderful.  Always knew us and got our truck ASAP.  The room was clean; we stayed in the 3 bedroom so to us it worked.  It was cleaned every time we came back from Disneyland. The cleaning staff was very friendly.  The laundry room all machines work.  It needs to be remodeled but this is a minor problem.  We brought our own breakfast, lunch and dinner meals because we stayed for a week.  We also brought a all in one cooker.  So the breakfast room was helpful just to take extra food.  It is okay I would give it 3 stars.  If you want a full breakfast bring your own meals or go out to eat. Just be ready to pay in that area.  The only two bad things that
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have just returned from a 5 day shortened to 4 day stay at the Peacock Suites in Anaheim, CA.  It was one of our worst vacations and we left a day early because we just couldn't stand the cramptness of the room and the inefficiency of the "resort" hotel in general. .  Our rooms keys never worked and w constantly had to return to the desk to get new ones, very frustrating and time wasting.  The room itself which was booked through RCI as a timeshare booking was one of the worst hotel rooms we have ever stayed in.  There was no privacy in the bedroom as the guests on the pullout sofa had to walk through the bedroom to use the bathroom.  You walk right into the bathroom area as you enter the room.  I would never recommend this to anyone who expects timeshare quality
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments you took the time to submit regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites. While we realize that we are unable to make everyone happy (although we sure try) we would like for you to know that we have taken your comments to heart and have reviewed all that you said.  In regards to the rooms keys not working, we have not had any complaints about that previous to your stay so we have dispatched Maintenance to test all of the locks and the keys to see what is going on with them.   All of the information regarding the square footage of the suites and their privacy description is is listed, in specifics, on the RCI website so we were surprised to hear that you were unaware of the layout of the suite.   Thank you again for taking the time to post your comments! We truly appreciate it!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Hi My husband and I are from New Zealand and had previously stayed in another hotel opposite Disneyland on two other visits. At first we were disappointed not to get that one as they lived up to all our expectations. Very much to our surprise Peacock Suites surpassed the other hotel in many ways.  We will most definitely be back and have already referred others to it. Our cleaning staff were absolutely wonderful, exceptional service - above and beyond the call of duty we'd say.  We are in our early fifties and didn't  bother with a shuttle, mind you we didn't have small  children with us. We enjoyed the walk to Disneyland and many other places, walks off the breakfast which we found ample. After reading another review I am not sure what they required for breakfast, perhaps they
Manager Response: Mr. and Mrs. Berryman,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your comments about your stay here at the Peacock Suites! We are so glad that we exceeded your expectations and are now your favorite hotel in Anaheim!!!  Please note that Rochanda's supervisor, as well as Rochanda herself, has been shown your kind words about her. As managers, we are always thrilled to see our staff named for positive things they have done and we make sure that they are rewarded for it some how!   We have also let the Housekeeping and Maintenance aware of your comments about their teams as well!!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you come back and stay with us in the future!  Best Wishes,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Great, Economical place to stay.  Thank You!
Summary: Great place to stay for a family.  The Suite consists of 2 bedrooms and a bathroom.  You can read about all the amenities provided either from the website, or the reviews below (I don't need to re-type the same things that are easily found elsewhere)!!  Ultimately, what sealed the deal for me and will bring me back again.  The EXCEPTIONAL Cleaning Staff!!  Wow!  We were people in a hurry to get to Disneyland, with everything thrown this way and that, and when we came back, the place was immaculate!  I felt like I was on a Cruise Ship, as things were arranged so nicely (even the kids stuffed animals and blankets)!  The attention to detail by the Cleaning Staff is DEFINITELY what sets this hotel over the top.  I will not even look at any other hotel options for the next trip to
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you had such a wonderful stay with us! Thank you so much for sharing your comments!  I have passed along all of the nice things you said about our Housekeeping Staff to the  Housekeeping Manager and to the General Manager! They are both aware of how happy you were with everything AND that Graciela did such a fantastic job for you!  Thank you again for your time! We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Regards,  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Ok, but not up to expectations
Summary: We just got back from Peacock Suites after staying there on a package deal through Alaska Airlines where children flew free with a stay at certain hotels.  The rooms were very clean, but our overall review was that the hotel was pretty average.  The hotel's photos really are better than it looks.  The pullout sofa was uncomfortable, as are most of them anyway though.  There is no internet access in the room unless you bring your own wireless laptop.  There is a computer w/ internet access in the lobby for a fee.  The continental breakfast is OK but just consisted of cold cereal, donuts, hard boiled eggs and juice or milk.  The hotel was not as close to Disney and other restaurants as expected.  The Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump Shrimp and 7-11 were within walking distance, but
Manager Response: Thank you for the comments regarding your recent stay at the Peacock Suites. While we understand we cannot always make everyone happy, it is obviously our goal to try!  As you commented about our continental breakfast it, "consisted of cold cereal, donuts, hard boiled eggs and juice or milk" we feel that it is a good way to start your day and it is complimentary to all guests! There are numerous hotels in the area that do not offer complimentary breakfasts and we are pleased to be one that does!  Also located within walking distance to us at the new GardenWalk (where you mentioned the Cheesecake Factory and Bubba Gump Shrimp) are also the California Pizza Kitchen, P.F. Chang's, and several other food establishments that unfortunately may not have been open yet when you were here.  Last, you did note that we were not as close to Disney as expected, yet you have stayed at the Hyatt in Garden Grove which is much further away and definitely needs a shuttle to get guests to and from the Disney parks. Here at the Peacock Suites, we do offer the shuttle at a minimal price, but you can also walk to get there! At this time, I believe the Hyatt also charges for guests to use the shuttle!  Again, thank you for your time! We hope that if you return to Anaheim, you will give us the opportunity to change your opinion!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Very bad personality of night clerk. Seemed to be bothered upon our arrival. Hotel does not look as nice as the picture on their website. Location was just okay. Valet parking attendent was great. You can find better.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the time you took to comment on your stay at the Peacock Suites.   We have passed your review on to the Managers of each department so that they can reveiw with their staff what was said!  We look forward to having you come and stay with us again in the future!  The Peacock Suites Managerment

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed 7 days through our timeshare.  We were very impressed with the entire staff.  They were all very friendly, helpful and happy.  The valet parking guys gave perfect directions and were extremely professional.  Our room was very clean and comfortable.  Our housekeeper was wonderful (left chocolates on the bed & found my lost earrings).  Breakfast every morning was nice.  Pool and 2 hot-tubs were perfect - we swam almost every day.  All the guests we met were equally happy with every aspect of their stay.  Each day, they have activities for the entire family.  Our boys loved the balloon animals and the icecream social.  There is a new outdoor mall called "The Garden" just 2 blocks away that's great!  We loved to take a walk there at night and eat at the
Manager Response: As always, we truly appreiciate when our guests take time out of their schedules to write comments about their stay here at the Peacock Suites! You comments are no exception and we are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  We hope that the Angels played a great game for you and we look forward to having you come back to stay with us in the future!  Thank you again!  The Peacock Suites Managerment

Summary: We had an excellent time at this property.  The staff was extremely friendly.  The room was very large and well furnished (Flat Screen TV's).  It also has an excellent location.  We happened to be there to see the Angels play and only had to make two turns to get to the stadium.  It took us like 5 minutes.  They also have a great complimentary breakfast that is very well kept.  You can eat outside on the balcony in a cabana like setting overlooking the grounds which are fantasticly maintained with a variety of Southern CA plants and palms.  Great Stay!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: By the advertising, we expected something similar to Embassy Suites but The Peacock Suites was nothing more than a dressed up motel.  The suites were too small for a family of four, the walls are paper thin, the continental breakfast was not worth our time, and the sofa bed was unacceptable even for our small children.  The good news was the beds were comfortable, the staff were apologetic and accommodating, there was a bus stop to Disneyland outside, and a nearby open air mall just opened with a number of restaurants.  McCormick & Schmick's had a great happy hour from 3-6 that included $1.99 restaurant style hamburgers, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites!   I have passed it along to both the General Manager and the Assistant General Manager for review!   We appreciate what you had to say and hope that sometime in the future, you will give us another opportunity to impress you!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We spent 2 nights the end of June.  We had a great experience.  We encountered and spoke with various members of the hotel staff during our stay and found everyone to be friendly and helpful.  My experience with this hotel starting from booking the reservation, calling for information, check in and check out was wonderful.  Everyone I spoke with either on the phone or in person was always friendly and helpful...quite unusual to find everyone to be so helpful.  The hotel accommodations were excellent for the money.  Our "rooms" consisted of two rooms .. bedroom and living room.  There were 2 televisions, coffeemaker, toaster and microwave.   Dinnerware was provided which was an extra plus.  We used the shuttle to Disneyland each day and experienced no problems.  The staff had
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice comments you made about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you would definitely stay with us again on future visits!  We have printed your review and have given it to the staff to read, as we truly appreciate all you had to say and feel that they should also see what you had to say about them!  Thank you again and we do look forward to having you stay with us again!!  The Peacock Management

Summary: Stayed at the Peacock Suites in Anaheim for Fourth of July.  Very comfortable beds!  The staff are very accomodating!  The location is very close to Disneyland and they have a shuttle that takes you to and from Disneyland if you don't want to walk.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to put your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites into writing! We appreciate your time and feedback and are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us!  Than you again for your thoughts and we look forward to having you some and stay wth us again in the future!  The Peacock Management

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock for 4 nights during our Disney vacation. We had 2 adults and 3 kids in our party. We really loved it there. The kids loved the pool. the breakfast was great, our room was clean.  the hotel itself has a gift shop and the tshirts and such are much cheaper than inside Disney park. Everyone was very friendly. We had a problem when we arrived with our reservation, but it was quickly fixed and we had no further problems. They also gave us a voucher for free parking for our entire 4 night stay for our inconvinience. ( it is usually $8 a day for parking). The breakfast room is very nice and there is an outdoor balcony you may sit on while eating, or just take it back to your room, as we did. there is not free internet available here, so if that is important to
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to express your thoughts about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We are always thankful to our guests who react positively to their stay and want others to know about it!  We have passed your comments on to our staff to read so that they know they are appreciated in their contributions to make your stay as nice as it was!  Thank you again and we look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at Peacock Suites for a week beginning May 9.  We did an RCI exchange.  Typically, our vacation condos have a full kitchen, but these rooms do not.  We knew that up front and just planned "microwavable" meals accordingly.  Each room has a credenza with a *small* microwave and a *small* fridge.  They also provide 6 plates/silverware/cups, a toaster, can-opener and a coffee maker.  Because we didn't want to clean the dishes in the bathroom sink, we opted to bring paper plates etc.  There is a continental breakfast each morning from 7 to 10 with coffee, 3 juices, 5 donut options, corn flakes, cheerios, oatmeal, eggs, oranges, toast and milk.    We had two queen beds that were separated from the couch and credenza by a sliding french door with curtains.  Peacock provided a
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for taking the time to give such positive feedback regarding your stay at the Peacock Suites!  While we understand you are used to full kitchens when traveling to other RCI properites, we are so glad you were readily prepared for our kitchenettes!  Thank you again for your time and we look forward to having you stay with us again sometime in the future!!!  The Hotel Management

Summary: The suite itself was very nice. The room was clean, well laid out. Unlike other posters, we did not hear any noise from the hallways. Our room was always cleaned by the time we arrived back. The breakfast was good, we brought our own peanut butter.  The negative was buying the bus pass at the front desk. We noticed several people at our stop being refused on the bus for having invalid tickets. Not until it happened to us, did we understand what happened. We were sold already validated tickets. My husband went in to the front desk and the girl said she didnt remember selling him the tickets that morning! The other girl told her to give us new tickets and we left. Now six month later we got a new charge for bus tickets. We called Peacock and left a message and did not hear back. A
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites from Mar. 28-April 7 for a convention and a few days R & R afterwards. We chose the hotel for its amenities, and were not disappointed. We chose to walk almost everywhere, but the bus stops right outside the door. Parking is a potential problem, be warned. (We did not have a car). I never saw anyone use the internet access in the lobby.  The breakfast included hard boiled eggs, toast, muffins, donuts and pastries, coffee, tea, milk and juice; cereal and oranges. The location was convenient and kept tidy by the staff.  The housekeepers were friendly and accessible, and had little "surprises" during our stay, like chocolates on the pillow. (We always leave a daily tip for the housekeepers, I hope that it is your policy to do the same!)  Our
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking time out of your day to write about your experiences at the Peacock Suites! We are certainly glad you decided to stay and relax after attending a convention for a week!!  We have passed along all of your wonderful comments to each department head so that they can let their staff members know that all of their hard work is being appreciated!   We are happy to hear that you would stay with us again and look forward to your return in the future!  Thank you again!  The Peacock Suites Managerment

Summary: Stayed 1 week at the Peacock Suites during my son's spring break. Our one bedroom suite on the forth floor was spacious, clean and quiet. The ART shuttle was efficient and at only $12.00 for unlimited rides for 5 days it was a bargain. The employees were very nice and helpful, especially Krista at the front desk.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a positive review about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We know you are busy with your life and we appreciate that you felt your time with us was worth writing about!  We have let Krista's supervisor know that you made a nice comment about her so that she is made aware that her attitude and personality are appreciated by our guests and by us, as managers!  Thank you again and we look forward to having you return to the Peacock Suites on any future trips to Anaheim!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: I was definitely disappointed in the quality of the hotel. The girl at the front desk seemed very new and very unfamiliar with the area when we asked questions. The suite that we stayed in was ok but certainly not worth the money, we paid. I will say however, that the person who runs the gift shop was very friendly and helpful. The valet at the hotel also was very friendly and very helpful. Overall, for the money you are better off staying at a hotel closer to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay at the Peacock Suites. While we are disappointed to hear that you felt your stay was only mediocre, we appreciate your comments. We have taking your comments seriously and have passed them on to the managers whose departments were mentioned.   We are sorry to hear that you thought your suite was “okay but certainly not worth the money…” as all of our suites were renovated within the last year and we have certainly gotten a great deal of praise on them!  We hope that the next time you are in Anaheim, you will give us another try!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We were a group of ten and this hotel was ideal for us. Very friendly and helpful staff at reception especially Sandra. The ladies who cleaned all our rooms were wonderful and met us every morning with a smile and nothing was too much to ask of them.If I had one piece of advice for the hotel it would be to change the breakfast menu and add fresh fruit other then that the Breakfast room was lovely with entertainment put on for the children. The pool was clean and well kept my friends enjoyed early morning swims. Over the week we were there it was a very enjoyable time
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the nice comments about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We are appreciative of the time you took to let us know about your stay and as always, we have passed them on to the head of each department so that their staff can be recognized!  Thank you for your input about breakfast. We are always looking at ways to update what we have!  We look forward to having you and your group come and stay with us again in the future!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: This was our second stay at the Peacock Suites. Our first time was in June of 2002. Both times we found our rooms to be clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant, and the valet guys were great. This is a great place to stay if you're going to Disneyland but don't want either the high prices of a front gate hotel or a run down old hotel accross the street. It is less than a 5 minute drive to the main gate. It is also a great location if you're going to see the Angels or the Ducks play. Be aware of the $8.00 a day parking fee that I didn't see advertised on their web-site.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Peacock Suites! We are glad to hear that you had a great stay and are happy that you chose to come back to us after 4 years since your last visit! We hope that you were impressed with all of the recent upgrades to the suites and to the property  The parking fee is listed on our website but we do apologize for any frustrations you had there!  We look forward to having you visit us again in the future!  Thank you again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: This was the worst experience. I booked the room via the 1-800 number. I was very clear about when I was going to be there and they still messed up on my reservation. The manager (Yolanda)was rude and kept insisting that we had made the mistake. She never once said that something else could have happened and was very rude about telling us how they have been booked solid for 2 months. Then she proceded to talk in Spanish while dealing with my situation with the people over the phone. So, in the end, instead of getting a room for $99 (Peacock Suites) we had to pay $250 for a room from someone else.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to notify us of your experience at the Peacock Suites.   While it is our top priorty to make it a pleasant and easy experience for all guests, we realize that we can not always make everyone happy and we do apologize for this!  Unfortunately, it looks like when you arrived here, we were sold out and we were unable to assist you with a room but we do hope you had an enjoyable stay in the hotel you did stay at.  Again, thank you for your time! We will pass your words on the departments mentioned!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Booked through Alaska Airlines vacations as part of a package.  Saw the mix of review and thought we would take a chance.  Overall, a good experience with good, clean room (very close to the balcony smoking area though) and helpful staff.  One day they forgot to clean the room, but they fixed it cheerfully with a single call.  Parking is a separate charge.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Inside: to start the front desk  manager  is the rudest women I ever met  . she is really unhelpful and road   her attitude is really bad. The front desk staff was nice ( krista ,yolanda ) was the best.  As for the stay, the first night we were woken up at about 7 am by extremely loud garbage trucks.  The breakfast was one of the worst that I had ever experienced (toast was the main attraction)!  Outside: The valet  guys  was nice and helpful specially enzo and ross , the other guy Maher give us an attitude also .......
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us and other guests know about your recent experience at the Peacock Suites!  It is unfortunate that your experience fell short of the expectations that we set for each and every guest!  We appreciate hearing both the negative and positive aspects of your stay and look to these to help us to move forward.  If your travels bring you back to Anaheim in the future, we would like to hear from you and have the opportuntiy to have you experience the Peacock Suites one more time.  Thank you!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: totally enjoyed the experience at this hotel, freindly staff, clean rooms , good value, gave this hotel a 5 rating but somehow ended up on hotels.com as a 1.  thomas' west jordan
