Manager Response: Thank you so much the nice review! We are so appreciative that you took the time to let us and other guests know that you enjoyed your stay with us!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Thanks again and Happy New Year!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We exchanged 1 week through RCI, and were allocated a three bedroom suite sleeping 8 people.  Check-in was quick and easy.    Rooms and staff The rooms were clean and adequate, with all you need, comfortable beds, kichenette area with fridge, coffee maker, microwave, etc.  Each room had a tv and dvd player.  Being English, we asked for a kettle as we do like our cups of tea.  The first kettle was broke, so as soon as one became available the maid put it in our room, without being reminded.  We found the staff were friendly and helpful.  When we arrived we could not open our safe, the maintenance man was sent within a couple of minutes.  Breakfast Complementary breakfast is served each morning with plenty to start your day.  The lady in there worked hard making sure everything
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive review about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We appreciate the time you took to do and are equally as appreciative that you did it in sections as you did so we could see if we needed to address any one particular area.   Although you mentioned that you would probably not come back to Anaheim in the future, we hope that if you do, you will again choos the Peacock Suites!   Thank you again for your time and Happy New Year!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary Heading: Do not waste your time in staying in this hotel
Summary: I cannot believe it I stayed in this "resort hotel" before and they went out their way to help the guests.  Previously I was a queen but not anymore a pauper.  I left messages with the management and they never responded.  They tell you one thing and do another.  You have been forewarned.  If the computers fail everything hits the fan.  You  should have a blessed and safe trip in Anaheim CA  not a nightmare.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your dissatisfaction with your stay at the Peacock Suites! We appreciate when anyone takes the time to let us know how their stay and our service was!  In going over your review, we found it strange that yours was the only one express dissatisfaction with your stay during the time period when our computer system was down. As I am sure you can understand, when the computers go down for an extended period of time, there is some chaos that goes with it but our staff, always has the guests best interest in mind.  As far as messages that you left for management, we were unable to to locate any messages left for anyone of us during those days but when the computer went down, it did cause some issues with our phones as well so for any missed callbacks, we do apologize.   We certainly hope you will give us another chance in the future!  Thank you again for your time!  The Management of the Peacock Suites

Summary: We had stayed at Peacock Suites in 2006, and were happy with our accomodations, so decided to book with them again.  We were very happy with the updates they have made, we got 2 great rooms, one had an additional MURPHY bed that came out of the wall, as well as the pull out couch and the 2 queen beds.  Our other room was a lovely king suite, with a jacuzzi tub.  The bed was VERY comfortable.  We slept extremely well, better then at home, and our room was always well attended to when we returned at the end of the day.  We did not hear another soul in any other rooms.  We really did not have one complaint, other then the continental breakfast is very basic, but we were able to make it through to lunch on what they had.  I would have to say that for what we paid through Alaska
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at the Peacock Suites! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit!  Please note that we are excited to have the addition of the Garden Walk opening up a block away. Several of their restaurants are open and the areanticipating having some of their other facitilites open in May. On your next trip to Anaheim, you will have a whole new experience!  Thanks again for your time!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Stayed through RCI.  I highly recommend.  We had an amazing and wonderful 6 night say November 2-8 2007.   The rooms are very clean, newly redecorated with very up to date decor.  Our bed had feather comfortor with at least 5 pillows on it was double sheeted and extra blanket.  This was very nice since my husband steals the covers. Our Housekeeper was amazing.  sweets on our bed each day, tons of fresh towels daily.  We are not use to this in RCI properties.  This Shell run property knows how to treat their guests with fresh towels each day and placed the kid's toys in awesome arrangements on the beds.  Nice safe in the room, The valet is very speedy.  I needed info on the breakfasts at Disney and the desk gal was amazing she gave us tons of information and then connected us to
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed in the Peacock Suites four times, and we liked it so much we have bought timeshare time there.  We visited three times, at different times of the year and all have been wonderful, then we bought the timeshare.  The room are very nice and much bigger than a regular hotel room.  As a mom with four kids I can tell you these room have floor space for the kids to play, which is hard to find.  The staff is out of this world, anything you need they are right there.  The cont. breakfast is nice, better that most hotels in the Disneyland area.  It is a little ways to walk, if going to Disneyland, but the shuttle is right outside the hotel, and is very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock as Shell Vacation owners after years of hesistancy due to the bad reviews I've read. We were very pleased with our stay. The room was nice, the staff was very nice, and we didn't mind taking the shuttle to Disneyland each day. Our three children (under 9) were free on the shuttle. I already knew of the valet parking and wasn't surprised. The valet was good enough to move our vehicle up to the front on the last day to make loading and leaving a breeze. We will definitely use our Shell points again and stay at the Peacock next time we're taking a Disneyland vacation.
Manager Response: We wanted to take a minute to say thank you for the time you took to write a review about your stay at the Peacock Suites! We appreciate your kind words and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!  Thanks again!  The Managerment of the Peacock Suites

Summary: we arrived a couple of hours after check in time....The front staff were fabulous, check in took around five minutes....! (Thanks Rachel)  Our room (a one bedroom suite) was fab...clean, tidy, modern...two televisions were great, kept the child happy and gave the adults a small piece of "non-child-talking" time.  The concierge people were great, helped out when ever we had questions....  There is a shuttle to disney land that you pay $3 per day, unlimited use for, but if you don't mind a nice walk (no more then ten minutes) it can sometimes be quicker to walk then to wait for the shuttle (it comes every half hour)  Breakfast was good, lots of pastries, donuts, fruit, cereal's, toast. juice and tea and coffee.  Perfect way to start the day.    the gym is good, although i only
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the very nice review! I have printed it and passed it on to both Rachel and Catalina's managers so they get the recognition they deserve!   We always appreciate our guests taking the time to express their thoughts on their stay and we truly appreciate your time as well!   Thank you again!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: Our stay at the Peacock Suites was from an RCI exchange.  We arrived at 1:30 PM on checkin day and were pleased to find a room available for us.  We were given room 211 - a one bedroom unit.  RCI guests receive a bag of Mrs Fields cookies upon checkin.  The resort provided complimentary 3 bottles of cold water, a ziplock bag containing 2 granola bars, 2 microwave popcorn, and 2 bags of Knotts cookies.  They also include a morning paper each day.  There is a large safe for no charge to use.  We were also provided with coffee, shampoo and lotion.  The dishes and cutlery are in the bottom drawer which I did not find until after I went shopping for necessities.  We did need the small paring knife we purchased as none are provided.  Smoking is only allowed on the roof deck or on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock suites from Sept. 7 to Sept. 14.  After reading some of the earlier reviews I was a little concerned about our stay but there was no need for any worry.  We found the staff very friendly, the check in went very fast and there was never a problem when we had questions.  The room was very nice.  We had a king size bed with a flat screen TV and lots of closet and storage space.  In the sitting room area there is a sofa that makes into a queen size bed, microwave, fridge and coffe maker.  This room also had a flat screen TV.  The bathroom was large and the towels were good quality as well as the bed linens were very nice.  The pool area is quite large and has two hot tubs.  Only down part about this it is all under cover and I would have liked to be able to
Manager Response: As the managemet of the Peacock Suites, we would like to thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review about your stay with us!  We are pleased you enjoyed your visit and look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We recently stayed after a recent renovation which provided excellent upgrades, including plasma screen TVs and upgraded continental breakfast area. They also began (in October 06) valet parking. Due to their limited parking, this was a great solution, however it is now manditory instead of optional.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to express your satifaction with our renovation and upgrades! We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay due to the changes that we made throughout the hotel and appreciate that you did take the time to write a review!  In regards to the valet parking, there is actually a parking fee of $8.00 which is mandatory but we offer the valet as an added bonus.   We hope that you will choose to stay with us again on any future trips you have to Anaheim!  Thank you again!  The Management and Staff of the Peacock Suites

Summary: great breakfasts (INCLUDED in your room)  - friendly staff - clean room - though walls are thin so you do hear other guests on occassion.  choose the right time and get the moderately sized pool to yourself. great Taco place across the road (CHEAP FOOD) - 7/11 next door.  We would go back to the Peacock Suites before considering another property.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments about the Peacock Suites on TripAdvisor!  We appreciate any and all comments (especially good ones) and pass them along to the staff!  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock for 6 nights , end of May beginning of June. We arrived early and had to wait for our room to be ready for about 3 hours, we asked to swin and that was fine and kept the kids busy. We got into our room and it was okay, the view was not so great but comfy.  We really enjoyed the glass doors between the living room and the beds, gave an area for the kids to watch TV and us to relax. The shuttle is really convienent and is 3 dollars a day, kids are free with paying adult.  Get your passes at the hotel front desk, much easier. We did Disneyland, Universal Studios and Seaworld and was nice to back everyday to a clean room. Pizza mostly, is inexpensive Marris delivers to your door and is good to take to the park the next day!!! Breakfast was enough to get us
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughts about the stay you and your family experienced here at the Peacock Suites!  We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit and truly appreciate the time you took to write your review.  We look forward to having you visit again in the future!  The Peacock Suites Management

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Suites for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend.  We had booked a king room through a bonus week with our timeshare exchange company, and it was supposed to have a "kitchenette."    Upon arrival, we were given keys to a small room that had not been cleaned.  The room opened up to a small living area, and had a small king bedroom through a separate door.  The room was much smaller than the french door separated rooms on the hotel's website.  Because the room was not clean, we asked for another placement, and were moved down the hall, to a larger king suite.  Rooms were functional - small bathrooms with basic towels, toiletries, iron and hairdryer were provided.  No kitchenette, but there was a credenza with a mini fridge and microwave.  No tableware, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great stay at the Peacock Suites for a week.  We had exchanged a timeshare week, so our experience may be slightly different than that of those booking a "Hotel" stay.  Our room was large and since they are redesigned hotel rooms, the "suite" portion is partitioned to the rear of the room by a sliding french-style door.  The two teenagers in our party were happy because they could have their own space closed off from Mom and Dad.  The room was equipped with a microwave, fridge, toaster, dishes and flatware, and a coffee maker in the room, as well.  Both the living and bedroom areas of the suite contained large flat-screen tv's and DVD/CD players, as well.  There was plenty of storage for everyone's clothes in the armoire and dressers, and an iron and ironing board for
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've just returned from a week visiting Disneyland, Legoland and LA area, staying at the Peacock Suites. The hotel was just fine for our needs - a family with two kids younger than 10 years old.  Continental breakfast was great - toast, cereal, eggs, coffee, etc. - a good start to our long days of fun in the sun. The location was great for us, near Disneyland and on the shuttle line. We were always the first location to be picked up by the shuttle and first to be dropped off - the convenience was fantastic and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes for it to arrive or leave. The hotel is also close to several freeways, easy to access and find our way to LA and San Diego. One bedroom suite was roomy enough for us - kids slept on sofa-bed and were fine - two TVs were convenient
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: if you have another choice in mind, take it
Summary: to start the front desk staff are the rudest people you have ever met. the are unhelpful. Do not plan to sleep 6 in their rooms, unless 2 of them are young and don't care about sleeping on the worst hide-a-bed ever made. if you like eating powdered donuts for breakfast everyday, the free breakfast is for you, as that is the only thing edible in the "vast" selection you have. The valet service workers are the nicest people and are very helpful, however the $8 is nothing to sneeze at. Esp when we booked we had free parking, however, don't forget the documentation that states that, otherwise you are expected to pay the $8 a day. Like us. Front desk said they would give us the paper to give to valet if we had the paper showing that we booked with free parking. My daughter was sick

We had never been down to this area before so we had no prior knowledge of this hotel.  We were pleased when we arrived.  Rooms were very clean, we were in a 3 room suite, and the staff were fantastic!! Sandra, Jami, Vanessa, Adrian, ect...all were friendly and helpful.  Unfortunatly the concierge and front desk were not very knowledgable about dining areas.  This is a must in an area with so many options and alot of tourists.  We went to the Block at Orange Mall for some fun and food.  Skip the Alcatraz Brewing Co. and the Market Broiler. Summary Heading: Stay was great for the money
Summary: Rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable.  Like the room set up.  There are 2 queen beds as you walk in and seperate from that was a little living room area with a sofa, TV,  fridge and microwave.  My only complaints are that we stayed on the 3rd floor and occupants above us on the 4th floor were running back and forth until 3am.  Called the front desk and noise was stop immediately.   Parking is an additional $8.00, which I think is nuts, that should be included in your stay.  Parking at the hotel is very limited.  A shuttle service is provided for $3.00 per person to and from Disneyland which was nice.  Continental breakfast was okay, again for the price you can't expect pancakes, bacon and eggs.   All n' all I think it was a very decent stay and would stay again.

Summary Heading: Hotel is under construction - get the picture
Summary: We stayed here for one week during October 2006.  It is close to Disneyland but a little to far to walk.  The shuttle stops outside but it is $3.00 per day, per person.  If you have four in your group - it is cheaper to park at Disneyland for $11.00 per day and more convenient.    The property is converting to a timeshare facility and is presently under major renovations.  The rooms we stayed in were converted hotel rooms.  We had a three bedroom unit which consisted of one bedroom, one bath and a living area with sofa, TV, microwave and small refrigerator on one side.  The other side, connected through an adjoining doorway had two bedrooms and one bath.  Hence, three sleeping areas, no privacy but three beds! The beds were clean and comfortable – not a total loss.    The

Summary: Booked this through my travel agent, who recommended it. Its about 2 blocks from the main gate of Disneyland, or a 10 minute walk. Take the Anaheim Shuttle which stops right outside.   My room was a newly renovated room. A 2 room suite with 1 bathroom. Sleeps 6. A sliding door in the middle with 2 TVs, DVD, flat screens, microfrig, and dinner plates etc. Ask for the renovated side. Clean, and nice for the price. View isn't good, but who cares. Parking is at a premium, but they do valet for $8.00 if you don't get there early or they are full. The elevator only goes to floor 3, currently, but should be fixed soon. They are under renovation, so I am sure things change daily. So if you can't walk the stairs, don't get a high floor. Summary: Just returned from a fun trip to Disneyland, but the stay at Peacock Suites Resort was just okay.  We had purchased a week's stay via an online auction and the price was a steal.  Had read the mixed reviews before going so didn't have high expectations (but let's face it, most of the hotels around Disneyland are fairly basic which is okay since you spend most of your time at the park anyway).  The best things about the Peacock were:  continental breakfast (yes, it was standard fare, but enough to fill our stomachs and get us going in the morning), clean rooms, the air conditioning worked (though was a bit loud), the hotel was right around the corner from a Hertz location which made picking up & dropping off a car rental quite easy for a day away from Disney. Summary: We just stayed there for four nights.  It wasn't a Marriott that's for sure, but it wasn't a Motel 6 either.  It was clean, nice bed, decent shower, good air conditioning.  The maids cleaned really well and restocked coffee and utensils as needed.  The layout of the room was odd, but it worked.  We liked the glass doors separating both rooms so we could watch the kids while we enjoyed some quite time ourselves.  The staff was nice.  Valet parking was a way to get some extra bucks, but I don't blame them.  The sound proofing between floors needs to be improved, and the hotel is remodelling so maybe they are addressing this. Might be do able in the morning when everybody is fresh and excited, but too far to walk back after spending a long day walking around Disneyland.  For $3 a day pp you can purchase a shuttle pass from the front desk.  The Peacock is the third stop on the route to Disneyland, so if alot of folks have gotten on at the first two stops, the shuttle can get really full, especially at peak times, i.e. after breakfast. Summary: We had a family of 6 and were very impressed with our room and stay. Summary: I agree with an earlier review that the Peacock is more of a hotel than a resort, as the recreational facilities are somewhat limited, but our unit was spaceous, clean and well equipped.  We were a family of 2 adults and 2 kids (14 & 15) and we fitted comfortably. We could see Disneyland from the window - and hey! that's the reason you go to Anaheim.   The staff were quite helpful.  We didn't get hassled about timeshares as some other have complained, maybe because we were already timesharers using an exchange.  The free breakfast was nothing fancy, but you can't complain about the price and it fuelled us up for each day's outing. I'd stay there again without hesitation.

Summary: The rooms are really small, the sofa sleeper a joke, and the continintal breakfast is the worst I have ever seen. The breakfast was tiny juice cartons, the cheapest bread they could find for toast, corn flakes or cherios (generic), milk, sweetrolls, apple/oranges and coffee.  They hads someone serving the sweetrolls, with a tip jar!!!!! The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything, there are kids running up and down the halls so it feels like your in an earthquake, the pool is a postage stamp full of kids, and las but not least, yes there is a shuttle from the hotel but you will have to pay for it. For my money I would stay somewhere else..

Summary: Just returned from 4 nights in Anaheim and found the accommdations at the Peacock Suites to be very comfortable and clean. The continential breakfast is just that...a continential breakfast...cold cereal, toast, breakfast rolls, coffee, juice. We were in a two bedroom / 2 bath unit and was surprised to see a TV in each bedroom and in the living area as well. One of the TV's did quit working, and was replaced promptly. The pool and hot tub was very relaxing after a full day in Disneyland. I am a Shell Vacations owner, and have also stayed in other Shell properties. While this property is not as "elegant" as the properties in Hawaii, and San Francisco, it is very accommodating to families wanting to spend time at the themeparts in Anaheim. I would definitely stay there

Summary: We just returned from a week at peacock suites and we are owners of shell vacations california. Let me tell you this place stinks. They had new mattresses but the old sheets were too small but they used them anyways, the rooms are clean most days but the hallways are very noisy, the breakfast is a joke, they talked us into going to a sales presentaqtion under the guise of an owners update and then made us wait 25 minutes after our "confirmed" aappointment time, we left then I don't know how long it actually would have been. I will never stay here again and if anyone really likes it I would be very happy to make them a deal on my shell credits.

Summary Heading: Nice oasis in Anaheim Resort Area
Summary: We just returned from Peacock Inn and Suites. Our suite had two roooms and a bath. The bedroom had a king-sized bed and the living room/kitchenette had a foldout sleeper sofa. The maid service was excellent--we were supplied with clean towels, shampoo, lotion, soap, and newspaper every day. We availed ourselves of the continental breakfast each morning--it was very adequate: corn flakes, cheerios, dry oatmeal (I wasn't sure how to cook this in the microwave), white and wheat bread for toast with jelly and butter, mediocre Danish pastries, coffee, 2 flavors of prepackaged fruit juice, and coffee.  There were also whole apples and oranges. Every morning sliced oranges were available. We ate in the breakfast room everyday and always had a place to sit. My sister's family was
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was perfect for us - we arrived at midnight and were given keys to a non-smoking room - we had requested a smoking room so we rang the reception - they told us that we could change in the morning, and when we were out visiting the parks they moved all of our luggage to the new room for us.  Breakfast was ok, and plentiful - just what you need for when you have 3 kids with you, they also had planned activities - like a face-painter during breakfast sittings.  No restaurants - but they arranged restaurant reservations for us, and they had guides if you wanted to order in.  Cleaning staff were excellent and very efficient - 5 star to them.  Pool was clean, staff friendly, definately recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were so happy there!!! The staff was wonderful to us, friendly, helpful. The rooms were very clean, and everything worked great. The continental breakfast was very good. The waiting area for the shuttle bus to Disneyland was fine. We would definitely stay again. The price was quite reasonable. The housekeepers did a fine job. Our daughters and my husband put this package together and since it was only a month before spring break that it was planned, we wondered what kind of place we'd be staying. Not wondering anymore; extremely pleased.

Summary Heading: A Hotel not quite a Resort
Summary: My wife and I booked this "Resort" via RCI in Australia as we wished to holiday in California and take in Disneyland, Universal Studios etc.  After reading some of the reports prior to leaving I was expecting the worst but having already booked the week in exchange we were committed.  This is not a Resort as such and we have stayed in many here in Australia but the room was clean and tidy upon arrival but beware if travelling from overseas and you arrive early say in the morning your room may not be ready. However the staff were very helpfull arranging for secure baggage storage. Our room was not ready until 2:00 - 3:00 PM and after a long flight we did not feel ready to tackle Disneyland to fill in the time. Once given access to our room we found it OK but do not expect 5 star

Summary: I was a little hesitant to stay at this plasce after reading the reviews. PLEASE keep in mind - this hotel is rated "2 stars". So if you are expecting Disney Hotel ammenities - well you will be disappointed because this hotel is ECACTLY as described. We had a great room (the extra sleeping area was plenty big), lots of fresh clean towels daily and upon request, we had a broken ironing board and once called they had a new one to us within 10 minutes, the swimming area is just as it looks online, yes it was covered, but that wasn't a problem (there is a sun deck on the fourth floor roof), two hot tubs with 2 different temps. The room was ok, but very noisy..& the Time Share presentation is VERY high pressure, with very friendly presenter, 'til you decline, then icy cold & downright rude & obnoxious---would not recommend & would definately not return.

Summary Heading: Read the reviews after I booked and was a bit nervous about staying at Peacock Suites but....
Summary: The rooms were very clean, comfortable we always had enough towels and the fridge and microwave were extremely important! The cleaning staff was so friendly! The breakfast was'nt that great, no variety the same thing everyday and not really that good. The pool was o.k. we only swam twice, it was a nice break from the park. The Shuttles were great every 20 min.. There are no resturants close by only a 7"11 and the hotel gift shop so food was a problem. I agree with one of the other reviewers there are so many choices, that I would probally choose a hotel with a nicer pool and closer to resturants or one with a resturant. We were on the side with the pool and it was a little loud.

Summary Heading: Liked it - will stay there again
Summary: Stayed 6/24 - 6/28. I don't understand other reviewer's issue with parking. There is a two-level parking garage on-site and the additional parking outside; plus, there is no charge for parking. The staff was courteous and friendly. They even allowed us to park after we checked out, giving us time to visit the theme parks the rest of the day. The rooms were large, and really liked that the 'living room' could be seaprated from the 'sleeping' area. There are two TV's, VCR, Fridge, Toaster, MicroWave. The pool is heated and there are two jacuzzis. The shuttle to the parks stops in front of the hotel. Free breakfast consists of fruits, breads, cereals, juices, milk, coffee. Overall we were very happy and would return.

Summary: What a nightmare! My brother thought we were getting a resort - it was just an inner city hotel. Small rooms, old small bathrooms, tiny pool and scum filled jacuzzi(2). NO Parking. Everything was crowded. Never again.

Summary: We stayed at the Peacock Hotel on 3/28/3.  The room was so small and cramped, we did not even have a place to place our luggage. Summary: I just got back from staying 7 nights at the Peacock Suites.  It was a great experience.  As soon as we got to our room there was a knock at the door and we were presented with a basket full of "goodies".  The location was good, however their parking lot is very small and cramped.
